Carpathian Flysch Belt is an arcuate tectonic zone included in the megastructural elevation of the Carpathians . It is a thin-skinned thrust belt or accretionary wedge formed by rootles nappes consisting of so-called flysch - alternating marine deposits of claystones, shales and sandstones which were detached from their substratum and moved tens of kilometers to the north (generally) The belt is connected to the flysch belt of the Alps and continues through the territory of the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Poland, Ukraine and Romania . The Flysch belt is together with Neogene volcanic complexes only tectonics zone occurring along the whole Carpath

Island off the coast of Niigata, Japan, is the second largest island after Okinawa Island . Sado Island covers an area of 854.76 km2 (330.02 sq mi) The shortest distance between the island and Honshu is 32 km (20 mi) The highest peak is Mount Kinpoku, with an elevation of 1,172 m (3845 ft) The island is located in the eastern part of the Sea of Japan, under the jurisdiction of Sado City, Niigta Prefecture, Japan . An earthquake struck the Mexican state of Oaxaca at 10:29 local time on June 23, 2020, with a magnitude of 7.4 Mw . The epicenter was 19 miles (31 km) from San Miguel del Puerto and 7.5 miles (12.1 km) south-southwest of Santa María Zapotitlán . The quake was felt by an estimated 49 million people in Mexico and Guatemala, with some tremors felt as far away as 640 kilometers (400 mi) A tsunami warning was issued for southern Mexico, El Salvador and El Salvador . Thousands of houses were damaged and 10 deaths were reported, with 23 injured and thousands of houses damaged in Oax

The 1687 Peru earthquake occurred at 11:30 UTC on 20 October . It had an estimated magnitude of 8.4–8.7 and caused severe damage to Lima, Callao and Ica . It triggered a tsunami and overall about 5,000 people died . The earthquake is likely to be a result of thrust faulting, caused by the subduction of the Nazca plate beneath the South American plate . The coastal parts of Peru and Chile have a history of great megathrust earthquakes originating from this plate boundary, such as the 1960 Valdivia earthquake . The port of Pisco was also hit by a tsunami, which triggered a death toll of 5,200 people in the area .

Torre Pellice is a comune (municipality) in the Metropolitan City of Turin in the Italian region Piedmont . The Waldensians arrived in the valley in the early 13th century . It is the centre of the Waldensian church, which is located about 45 kilometres (28 mi) southwest of Turin . The town is crossed by the Pellice river and is located in the middle of the Pelliches valley . It has a population of 4,545, with a density of220/km2 (560/sq-mi) Time zone UTC+1 (CET) and summer (DST) UTC+2 (CEST)

Awa was established on April 1, 2005, from the merger of the former town of Awa, absorbing the town of Ichiba and the towns of Donari and Yoshino . It is located in the former Awa Province (Tokushima). As of June 1, 2019, the city has a population of 35,294, with a density of180/km2 (480/sq mi) Time zoneUTC+09:00 (JST) is the time zone for Awa City, located in Shikoku, Japan . The city is located on the outskirts of the city of Shiki, in the heart of the island of Shigoku, Shikokoku

The 2010 Baja California earthquake occurred on April 4 (Easter Sunday) with a moment magnitude of 7.2 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong) The shock originated at 15:40:41 local time (3:40 PM PDT) south of Guadalupe Victoria, Baja California, Mexico . Total damage was $1.15 billion (2010 USD) and 2–4 people were killed and 100 were injured in the earthquake . The earthquake was centered 32°08′N 115°18′W.13°N 115.30°W﻿ / 32.13; -115.30; . Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . Earthquake 2008 in China was the 18th deadliest earthquake of all time .87,587 people were killed,374,643 injured and 18,392 missing . Total damage was $150 billion (2008 USD) Max. intensityXI (Extreme) Aftershocks149 to 284 major, over 42,719 total . Quake occurred in Sichuan province in May 2008, killing 87,587 and injuring 374,643 . Quake was the most powerful earthquake in the world, with a magnitude of 8.0 (7.9 Mw) Quake occurred on May 12, 2008, in Chengdu, China, at the time of the largest quake in the history of the world's history .

The 1812 Caracas earthquake measured 7.7 on the Richter magnitude scale . It caused extensive damage in Caracas, La Guaira, Barquisimeto, San Felipe, and Mérida . An estimated 15,000–20,000 people perished as a result of the earthquake . The seismic movement was so significant that in a zone named Valecillo, a new lake was formed and the river Yurubí was dammed up. Numerous rivulets changed their course in the Caracas valley, which was flooded with dirty water . The 1855 Edo earthquake was the third Ansei Great Earthquake, which occurred during the late-Edo period . It succeeded the 1854 Nankai earthquake, which took place about a year prior . The earthquake occurred at 22:00 local time on November 11, 1855 . It had an epicenter close to Edo (now Tokyo), causing considerable damage in the Kantō region from the shaking and subsequent fires, with a total of 7,000 casualties resulting from the earthquake and the loss of more than 7,500 lives . The quake occurred in Japan, now Tokyo, with an estimated 7,800 people killed in the area

The 1812 San Juan Capistrano earthquake occurred on December 8 at 15:00 UTC in Alta California . Damage occurred at several of the missions in the region of Pueblo de Los Ángeles . 40 parishioners were killed during the collapse of a church at an early morning service . Tree ring and paleoseismic evidence show that there is a strong likelihood that the earthquake originated along the Mojave s Fault Line of the Fault Line . The 1556 Shaanxi earthquake, or Huaxian earthquake, is the deadliest earthquake in recorded history . It occurred on the morning of 23 January 1556, during the Ming dynasty . According to imperial records, approximately 830,000 people lost their lives . The earthquake was the deadliest ever recorded event in the history of the world . It was the 12th day of the 12 month of the year Jiajing 34 in Chinese calendar, when the earthquake occurred . The quake was magnitude 8.0m (MW) and the depth of the quake was unknown . The area was affected by the earthquake, and the area was largely uninhabited by modern-day Shaanx province .

Catastrophic volcanic eruption in present-day Indonesia . Mount Tambora started in 1815, causing global temperatures to drop . The following year, 1816, was called the Year Without a Eruption, with the following year being called the 'Year Without a Volcanic Eruption' The eruption occurred in Sumbawa, Lesser Sunda Islands, Dutch East Indies (now Indonesia) The eruption was a catastrophic event in the region of Indonesia . The volcano erupted in 1816 and reduced global temperatures, reducing the world's temperature to less than 2,000 degrees Fahrenheit . The eruption of Mount Tambura was the largest in the history of volcanic eruptions in the world, with

The 1755 Lisbon earthquake impacted Portugal, the Iberian Peninsula, and Northwest Africa . Seismologists estimate the Lisbon earthquake had a magnitude of 7.7[4] or more on the moment magnitude scale, with its epicenter in the Atlantic Ocean about 200 km . The earthquake almost totally destroyed Lisbon and adjoining areas, killing 12,000–50,000 . The Great Lisbon earthquake occurred on 1 November 1755, the Feast of All Saints, at around 09:40 local time in Lisbon, Portugal . In combination with subsequent fires and a tsunami, the earthquake almost completely destroyed the city of Lisbon and its surrounding areas . The Azores-Gibraltar Transform Fault[1]

The 1816 Guatemala earthquake occurred at 15:30 UTC on 22 July . It had an estimated magnitude of 7.5 to 7.75 on the Mw and a maximum perceived intensity of IX (Violent) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The area affected by shaking up to intensity VII (Very strong) was at least 13,000 km2 . At least 23 people were killed in the 1816 earthquake . The discovery of this earthquake 175 years after it occurred was based on study of historical documents . It is notable for showing that this portion of Guatemala, previously believed by many planners to be of low seismic risk, has experienced, and is at further risk of, seismic activity .

This list considers every notable earthquake felt or with its epicenter within Mexico's current borders and maritime areas . Mexico lies within two seismically active earthquake zones . The Cocos Plate is subducting under the North American Plate at a rate of 67mm (0.220ft) per year . Southern Mexico also contains numerous faults, which causes that section of the country to have high tectonic activity . Northeastern Mexico and the Yucatan Peninsula are not as active as the area close to the boundary between the Cocos and Cocos plates . The Baja California peninsula lies near the boundary of the Pacific Plate and the Pacific and Rivera plates, while southern Mexico lies just north of the boundary

Island in Indonesia is located in the Lesser Sunda Islands chain, with Lombok to the west, Flores to the east, and Sumba further to the southeast . Traditionally, the island is known as the source of sappanwood, as well as honey and sandalwood . Its savanna-like climate and vast grasslanlanlan are characteristic of the island's savanna style . There have been plans by the Indonesian government to split the island off into a separate province of West Nusa Tenggara, but there have been no plans for the split of the province . The 1819 Rann of Kutch earthquake occurred at about 18:45 to 18:50 local time on 16 June . It had an estimated magnitude of 7.7 to 8.2 on the moment magnitude scale and a maximum perceived intensity of XI (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . It triggered a tsunami and caused at least 1,543 deaths . The earthquake caused an area of subsidence that formed the Sindri Lake and a zone of uplift to the north about 80 km long, 6 km wide and 6 m high that dammed the Koree / Kori / Puran / Nara river . The 2017 Puebla earthquake struck at 13:14 CDT (18:14 UTC) on 19 September 2017 with an estimated magnitude of Mw7.1 and strong shaking for about 20 seconds . Its epicenter was about 55 km (34 mi) south of the city of Puebla . 370 people were killed and 6,011 were injured in the earthquake . The earthquake caused damage in Mexico and in the Greater Mexico City area, including the collapse of more than 40 buildings.[3] 370 people died in the disaster, including 6,000 injured and 370 were trapped in the region of Mexico City . This list includes notable earthquakes that have affected Greece during recorded history . This list is currently incomplete, representing only a fraction of the possible events . Greece is located at the complex boundary zone in the eastern Mediterranean between the African Plate and the Aegean Sea Plate . The northern part of Greece lies on the Eurasian Plate while the southern part lies on . These two plate boundaries give rise to two contrasting tectonic styles, exten . The southern convergent boundary forms the Hellenic arc, forming the Hellen arc of the plate boundaries . The seismicity of Romania is clustered in several epicentral zones: Vrancea, Făgăraș-Câmpulung, Banat, Crișana, Maramureș and Southern Dobrogea . Seismic hazard for Romania has a 10% chance of being exceeded (or a 90% chance) within the next 50 years . All casualties were caused by heart attacks . 2004 and 2004 were the most significant quakes in Costa Rica's history . 2011 was the most severe earthquake in the country . 2012 was the second biggest aftershock in the history of the country's history of quakes . The largest was the 2012 aftershock, which was caused by a magnitude 7.5-8.6 magnitude earthquake in which it occurred at the time of the 2011 earthquake in San Jose, which occurred at a depth of 10.5km . 1953 earthquake centered in the southern Ionian Islands in western Greece . The event measured 6.8 on the moment magnitude scale . It raised the whole island of Kefalonia by 60cm (24in) and caused widespread damage . The most destructive was the August 12 earthquake, which killed445–800 . In mid-August there were over 113 recorded earthquakes in the region, and the most destructive of the event was that August 12 . The earthquake was centered near the Ionian islands of the southern Greek island of the Zakyntos region, which was also known as the Great Kefaalonia . It was the first earthquake to hit the region since the 1953 Ionian earthquake .

New Zealand is affected by at least one tsunami with the a wave height greater than one metre every ten years on average . The history of tsunamis is limited by the country's written history only dating from the early to mid-1800s with Māori oral traditions and paleotsunami research prior to that time . Tsunamis tend to be caused by earthquakes on the Pacific Plate both locally and as far away as South America, Japan, and Alaska . Some have been attributed to undersea landslides, volcanoes, and at least a meteor strike . The country is part of the geologically active Pacific Plate and associated with the Pacific Ring of Fire . The 1967 Neiva earthquake occurred at 10:24 local time (UTC-05) on February 9 in Colombia . The epicentre of the earthquake was located in San Vicente del Caguán in the department of Caquetá . The earthquake, associated with the Algeciras Fault, had a moment magnitude of 7.0 and an intensity of VIII and was felt in northwestern South America from Caracas to Iquitos and Buenaventura to Mitú . 350 aftershocks were registered in the following mon hours . The South American Plate is moving over the Nazca Plate at a rate of 77mm (3.0in) per year . The same process has caused the rise of the Andes mountain range and the creation of the Peru–Chile Trench, as well as volcanism in the Peruvian highlands . The oldest rocks in Peru date to the Precambrian and are more than two billion years old . Along the southern coast, granulite and charnockite shows reworking by an ancient orogeny mountain-building event . Peace treaty concluded between Imperial Russia and Persia (modern day Iran) on 24 October 1813 . It was the first of the series of treaties signed between Qajar Iran and Imperial Russia that forced Persia to cede or recognize Russian influence over the territories that formerly were part of Iran . The treaty confirmed the existence of the Russian Empire in modern-day Iran as a result of the first full-scale Russo-Persian War, (1804 to 1813) The treaty was signed in the village of Gulistan (now in the Goranboy District of Azerbaijan) It was also the last of the treaties signed by Imperial Russia in 1813 that forced Iran to recognize the Russian influence in the

1668 magnitude 8.5 earthquake in East China not to be confused with 1976 Tangshan earthquake . Quake had cataclysmic implications to the region, shaking intensity was estimated to reach XII (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale, the most destructive shak . Quake was the largest historical earthquake in Eastern China and one of the largest in the world on land . Quake occurred during the rule of the Qing Dynasty somewhere in Shandong Province on July 25 of the year 1668 . Quake killed 42,578–50,000+ people, aftershocks lasted for six years . Quake is the largest earthquake in China's history and is one of world's largest ever recorded quakes .

The 2008 Chechnya earthquake occurred October 11 at 09:06:10 UTC with a Mwc magnitude of 5.8 . At least 13 people from the districts of Gudermes, Shalinsky and Kurchaloyevsky were killed . The mainshock and a series of aftershocks were felt throughout the North Caucasus, and even in Armenia and Georgia . About 116 people were injured, with a total of 16 shocks between 3 and 6 on the Richter magnitude scale . The earthquake occurred in Dagestan, Ingushetia, North Ossetia and Stavropol also experienced the tremors . The quake was centered 43°17′17″N

The 856 Damghan earthquake or the 856 Qumis earthquake occurred on 22 December 856 (242 AH) The earthquake had an estimated magnitude of 7.9, and a maximum intensity of X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . It caused approximately 200,000 deaths and is listed by the USGS as the sixth deadliest earthquake in recorded history . The earthquake's epicenter is estimated to be close to the city of Damghan, which was then the capital of the Persian province of Qumis . The meizoseismal area (area of maximum damage) extended for about 350 kilometres (220 mi) along the southern edge of the eastern Alborz mountains

The Tacna and Arica campaign was part of the War of the Pacific . Chile obtains control of the territories of Tacna and Arica . The boundary dispute was settled in 1929, see Treaty of Lima (1929) For the boundary dispute that was settled  in 1929 see treaty of Lima, Chile, Peru and Bolivia . Chile and Peru were involved in the war of 1879-1880 . Chile was victorious in the campaign, and Peru was defeated in the 1880s . Chile won control of both the territory and the territory of Arica, which is currently from Chile . Argentina and Bolivia were also involved in both campaigns in the 1879/1880s campaign .

This article is about the Nepal earthquake that took place on 13 April 2015 . For the major aftershock on 12 May 2015, see May 2015 Nepal earthquake . The April 2015 earthquake (also known as the Gorkha earthquake) killed 8,964 people and injured 21,952 injured . Aftershocks of 4 Mw and above as of 24 May 2016 have been followed by459 aftershocks since the April 2015 quake . In Nepal, 8,857 people were killed and 3.5 million people were made homeless by the earthquake, killing 8,000 people and injuring 21,000 more . The main earthquake was magnitude 7.8 Mw, with a depth of 8.1m

Magnitude 8 earthquake that struck Kunming in Yunnan, China on September 6, 1833 . The earthquake had its epicenter along the Xiaojiang Fault near the town of Songming, approximately 50 km (31 mi) northeast of Kunming's city centre . More than 6,000 people died as a result of the earthquake and another 80,000 were displaced . The Qing government at the time provided relief to the region and used the event to strengthen its administration in the province . The 1833 Kunming earthquake destroyed many buildings, homes, and temples in Kunming and the nearby countryside . The event was used to strengthen the administration of the province in the aftermath of the event .

The 1868 Arica earthquake occurred on 13 August 1868, near Arica, then part of Peru, now part of Chile, at 21:30 UTC . It had an estimated magnitude between 8.5–9.0 Mw (est.) A tsunami (or multiple tsunamis) in the Pacific Ocean was produced by the earthquake, which was recorded in Hawaii, Japan, Australia, and New Zealand . The USS Wateree beached at Arica 430 yards (390 m) inland . A total of 25,000 people were killed in the 1868 earthquake and tsunami . The earthquake was centered in Peru and northern Chile, which is now in the region of Chile and Peru

The 1833 Sumatra earthquake occurred on November 25 at about 22:00 local time, with an estimated magnitude in the range of 8.8–9.2 Mw . It caused a large tsunami that flooded the southwestern coast of the island . There are no reliable records of the loss of life, with the casualties being described only as 'numerous' The magnitude of this event has been estimated using records of uplift taken from coral microatolls . The island of Sumatra lies on the convergent plate boundary between the Indo-Australi and the Sunda megathrust plate boundary . The earthquake occurred in the Dutch East Indies on the south-west coast of Indonesia's Sumatra

An earthquake measuring 6.6 MW on the moment magnitude scale struck Iburi Subprefecture in southern Hokkaido, Japan, on 6 September 2018 at 3:08 a.m. JST . The earthquake's epicenter was near Tomakomai and occurred at a depth of 35.0 kilometers (21.7 mi) The Japan Meteorological Agency registered a magnitude of 6.7 Mj and a maximum intensity of 7 on the shindo scale . 41 people were killed and 691 were injured in the earthquake . Shaking from the earthquake was felt in the area, but no tsunami or landslide was reported . Aftershocks were felt in parts of the region .

The 1960 Valdivia earthquake (Spanish: Terremoto de Valdivia) was the most powerful earthquake ever recorded . Various studies have placed it at 9.4–9.6 on the moment magnitude scale . It occurred in the afternoon (19:11 GMT, 15:11 local time) and lasted for approximately 10 minutes . The resulting tsunamis affected southern Chile, Hawaii, Japan, the Philippines, and the Philippines . There were 1,000–6,000 casualties and up to 25 m (82 ft) of landlides and landslides . The earthquake was the largest in the history of the world's most powerful quakes, with the greatest number of quakes ever recorded

The 1992 Flores earthquake and tsunami occurred on December 12 on the island of Flores in Indonesia . With a magnitude of 7.8 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe), it was the largest and also the deadliest earthquake in 1992 . At least 2,500 people were killed or missing near Flores, including 1,49 people who were missing . The quake hit at 13:29:26 WITA (Indonesia Central Standard Time) and was followed by several serious aftershocks.[3] At least 500 people were injured and 500 were injured in the quake, the largest in the history of the world's history of quakes and tsunamis . The Galilee earthquake of 1837 shook the Galilee on January 1, 1837 . Intensity assessments for the event were VIII (Damaging) on the Medvedev–Sponheuer–Karnik scale and VIII (Heavily damaging) on European Macroseismic Scale . The event was one of a number of moderate to large events that have occurred along the Dead Sea Transform (DST) fault system that marks the boundary of two tectonic plates; the African Plate on the west and the Arabian plate on the east . This list considers every notable earthquake felt or with its epicenter within Mexico's current borders and maritime areas . Mexico lies within two seismically active earthquake zones . The Cocos Plate is subducting under the North American Plate at a rate of 67mm (0.220ft) per year . Southern Mexico also contains numerous faults, which causes that section of the country to have high tectonic activity . The 1879 Gansu earthquake occurred at about 04:00 local time on 1 July . Aftershocks occurred 4.3, 5.5 and 5.2 magnitude 6.1 Mw, with a number of aftershocks of magnitude of 5.3 and 6.2 Mw . Carpathian Flysch Belt is an arcuate tectonic zone included in the megastructural elevation of the Carpathians . It is a thin-skinned thrust belt or accretionary wedge formed by rootles nappes consisting of so-called flysch - alternating marine deposits of claystones, shales and sandstones which were detached from their substratum and moved tens of kilometers to the north (generally) The belt is connected to the flysch belt of the Alps and continues through the territory of the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Poland, Ukraine and Romania . Northern Sorsogon is an Austronesian language spoken in the Philippines . It is one of the three Bisayan languages spoken in Bicol region . Three earthquakes occurred off the coast of Kamchatka Peninsula in far eastern Russia in 1737, 1923 and 1952 . They were megathrust earthquakes and caused tsunamis . They occurred where the Pacific Plate subducts under the Okhotsk Plate at the Kuril–Kamchatka Trench . The depth of the trench at the point of the earthquakes is 7,000–7,500 m. There are many more earthquakes and tsunami originating from the area, of which the most recent was the 1997 Kamchatk earthquake and Tsunami originating near the Kronotsky Peninsula in 1997 . The 2000 Baku earthquake occurred on November 25 at 22:09 (18:09 UTC) local time with an epicenter just offshore Baku, Azerbaijan . It measured 6.8 on the moment magnitude scale and the maximum felt intensity was VI on the Mercalli intensity scale . It was the strongest for almost 160 years, since 1842 in the Baku suburbs and in addition to the capital affected Sumgayit, Shamakhi and neighboring cities . The earthquake was followed three minutes later by a quake measuring 5.9 . 26 people were killed and 412 were injured in the earthquake, the worst since the 1842 earthquake in Baku in 1842 . The 1843 Guadeloupe earthquake occurred at 10:37 local time on 8 February in the Lesser Antilles . It had an estimated magnitude of 8.5, making it the strongest recorded earthquake in the Caribbean . The earthquake was felt widely throughout the Caribbean and as far away as New York . Around 1,500 to 5,000 people were killed in the 1843 earthquake, with a maximum perceived intensity of shaking of IX (Violent) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The quake was the strongest in the region and was felt in New York, New York and the United States . The 1993 Kushiro–Oki earthquake was one of two large earthquake to strike the Japanese island of Hōkkaido within the same year . The earthquake with a magnitude of 7.6 Mw or 7.8 MJMA struck on January 15 near the town of Ashoro . Shaking reached a maximum intensity of VIII (Severe) on the Mercalli intensity scale, causing considerable damage, and was felt throughout the island, into northern Honshu, Sakhalin, and the Kuril Islands . The Nevado del Ruiz is a volcano on the border of the departments of Caldas and Tolima in Colombia . It is a stratovolcano composed of many layers of lava . The 1896 Sanriku earthquake was one of the most destructive seismic events in Japanese history . It resulted in two tsunamis which destroyed about 9,000 homes and caused at least 22,066 people dead or missing . The waves reached a then-record height of 38.2 metres (125 ft) in Ryori, Kesen, Iwate, Tōhoku . The 8.5 magnitude earthquake occurred at 19:32 (local time) on June 15, 1896, approximately 166 kilometres (103 mi) off the coast of Iwate Prefecture, Honshu . Fredonia (1845) was an 800-ton bark that served the U.S. Navy as a transport and as a storeship . After several voyages to California by way of Cape Horn, she became the station warehouse in Arica, Chile, where she was destroyed by an earthquake in August 1868 . Fredonia was built in 1845 at Newburyport, Massachusetts, and purchased 14 December 1846 for $52,000 . She was also assigned to take cargo to West Coa during the Mexican–American War . The 1847 Nagano earthquake occurred at about 21:30 local time on 8 May . It had a magnitude of 7.4 on the surface wave magnitude scale . It caused the destruction of many houses in Nagano and at least 8,600 people were killed . The earthquake triggered many landslides, the largest of which dammed the Sai River (a tributary of the Shinano River) 19 days later, the failure of this earthquake dam caused a flood that destroyed many more houses and killed a further 35 people . The 1848 Marlborough earthquake was a 7.5 (Mw) earthquake that occurred at 1:40 a.m. on 16 October 1848 . The shaking lasted for about two minutes and caused widespread damage, especially to brick or stone structures . Most of the buildings damaged in the earthquake were rebuilt in wood[2] and this contributed to the relatively low level of damage and loss of life in the more powerful Wairarapa earthquake that hit Wellington seven years later . The earthquake killed 3 people and left millions of dollars in damage . It was the first earthquake to hit New Zealand's South Island in 1848 and was centered in the Marlboro region of New Zealand .

Only earthquakes with a magnitude of 6.0 or greater are listed, except for a few that had a moderate impact . Aftershocks are not included, unless they were of great significance or contributed to a death toll, such as the M 6.3 2011 Christchurch earthquake and the M 7.3 aftershock to the 1931 Hawke's Bay earthquake . Earthquakes occur frequently in New Zealand as the country is situated in the collision zone between the Indo-Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, part of the Pacific Basin Ring of Fire, where many earthquakes and volcanoes occur . Most events occur along the main ranges running from Fiord to Fiord, New Zealand's main fault lines .

The Awatere Fault is an active dextral (right lateral) strike-slip fault in the northeastern part of New Zealand . It forms part of the Marlborough Fault System, which accommodates the transfer of displacement along the oblique convergent boundary between the Indo-Australian Plate and Pacific Plate . It is formed of two main segments; the Molesworth section to the southwest and the eastern section . The 1848 earthquake was caused by rupture of the entire eastern section of the fault . The 175km long fault is also known as a seismic hazard due to the recent seismicity of the region in the region of the South Island and is located in New Zealand's South Island .

The 1812 Caracas earthquake measured 7.7 on the Richter magnitude scale . It caused extensive damage in Caracas, La Guaira, Barquisimeto, San Felipe, and Mérida . An estimated 15,000–20,000 people perished as a result of the earthquake . The seismic movement was so significant that in a zone named Valecillo, a new lake was formed and the river Yurubí was dammed up. Numerous rivulets changed their course in the Caracas valley, which was flooded with dirty water . Colombia is a seismically active country and has a large seismic risk in many areas of its territory due to its location at the boundaries of the Malpelo, Panama, Caribbean, North Andes and South American Plates along the Pacific Ring of Fire . The southeastern and extreme eastern portions of Colombia are not as seismic active as the rest of the country . The first recorded earthquake felt in Colombia occurred on September 11, 1530, around 10:00 AM, probably with the epicentre near Cumaná, Venezuela. A 6.1 magnitude earthquake struck the island of Luzon in the Philippines on April 22, 2019, leaving at least 18 dead, 3 missing and 256 injured . Total damage was $10.5 million . Aftershocks 1,049 (16 felt) (as of May 1, 2019) left at least 256 injured, including 18 dead and 3 missing . The 1852 Banda Sea earthquake struck on 26 November, 1852 at 07:40 local time, affecting coastal communities on the Banda Islands . The earthquake had an estimated moment magnitude of 7.5 or 8.4 to 8.8 . It caused violent shaking lasting five minutes, and was assigned IX on the Modified Mercalli intensity scale in the Maluku Islands . A tsunami measuring up to 8 meters slammed into the islands of Banda Neira, Saparua, Haruku and Ceram . The tsunami caused major damage, washing away many villages, ships and residents . At least 60 people were killed in the earthquake and tsunami, including many of the villages and residents of the islands

Cuba is located in an area with several active fault systems which produce on average about 2000 seismic events each year . The island has been struck by a number of destructive earthquakes over the past four centuries, including several major quakes with a magnitude of 7.0 or above . 70% of seismic activity in Cuba emanates from the Oriente fault zone, located in the Bartlett-Cayman fault system which runs along the south-eastern coast of Cuba and marks the tectonic boundary between the North American Plate and the Caribbean Plate . The 1843 Whanganui earthquake occurred on 8 July at 16:45 local time with an estimated magnitude of 7.5 on the Mw scale . The 1855 Wairarapa earthquake occurred on 23 January at about 9 p.m. The moment magnitude of the earthquake has been estimated as 8.2, the most powerful recorded in New Zealand since systematic European colonisation began in 1840 . This earthquake was associated with the largest observed movement on a strike-slip fault, maximum 18 metres (59ft) It has been suggested that the surface rupture formed by this event helped influence Charles Lyell to link earthquakes with rapid movement on faults . The 1855 Bursa earthquake occurred on 28 February, with an estimated magnitude of 7.02±0.64 Mw . A devastating precursor quake that took place in Kemalpaşa, a town of Burs a town, caused severe destruction . 1,900 people died and thousands of homes and workplaces were wrecked, and some of the historical monuments and buildings including mosques collapsed . The 1857 Fort Tejon earthquake was one of the largest recorded earthquakes in the United States . It ruptured the southern part of the San Andreas Fault for a length of about 225 miles (350 km) The earthquake occurred at about 8:20 a.m. (Pacific time) on January 9, 1857 in central and Southern California . The event is referred to as the Fort Tejon earth . The earthquake was the largest ever recorded earthquake in the U.S. with an estimated moment magnitude of 7.9 Mw . The 1855 Edo earthquake was the third Ansei Great Earthquake, which occurred during the late-Edo period . It succeeded the 1854 Nankai earthquake, which took place about a year prior . The earthquake occurred at 22:00 local time on November 11, 1855 . It had an epicenter close to Edo (now Tokyo), causing considerable damage in the Kantō region from the shaking and subsequent fires, with a total of 7,000 casualties resulting from the earthquake and the loss of more than 7,500 lives . The quake occurred in Japan, now Tokyo, with an estimated 7,800 people killed in the area

The 1556 Shaanxi earthquake, or Huaxian earthquake, is the deadliest earthquake in recorded history . It occurred on the morning of 23 January 1556, during the Ming dynasty . According to imperial records, approximately 830,000 people lost their lives . The earthquake was the deadliest ever recorded event in the history of the world . It was the 12th day of the 12 month of the year Jiajing 34 in Chinese calendar, when the earthquake occurred . The quake was magnitude 8.0m (MW) and the depth of the quake was unknown . The area was affected by the earthquake, and the area was largely uninhabited by modern-day Shaanx province .

The 1856 Heraklion earthquake, also known as the Crete earthquake or Rhodes earthquake, occurred on the morning of October 12 at 02:45 am local time . The earthquake was felt over a very wide area extending from Sicily, Italy to the Levant and North Africa . On the Greek island of Crete, the effects of the earthquake were cataclysmic, over 50 people were killed and over 50 others were injured in the 1856 Crete quake . The quake had an estimated magnitude of 7.7 to 8.3 at a depth of approximately 61 to 100 km . It was also felt in the Levant, Egypt, Cyprus, Egypt and the Levant as well as the Levant .

1861 Sumatra earthquake occurred on February 16, 1861 . It was the last in a sequences of earthquakes that ruptured adjacent parts of the Sumatran segment of the Sunda megathrust . The earthquake was felt as far away as the Malay peninsula and the eastern part of Java . The rupture area for the 2005 Nias–Simeulue earthquake is similar to that estimated for the 1861 event . It caused a devastating tsunami which led to several thousand fatalities, including several thousand people being killed by a tsunami . The 2005 event was similar to the 1861 quake, with the rupture area of the 2005 event being similar to this event's rupture area . The 2011 earthquake was also similar to 1861

Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . The city is also known as the capital of Ghana, the capital and largest city in the country, and is the country's capital city . Magnitude 7 earthquake (3 May 1481) amongst a series that affected Rhodes in that year . It triggered a small tsunami, which caused local flooding . There were an estimated 30,000 casualties . The island of Rhodes lies on part of the boundary between the Aegean Sea and African plates . It sits in what is known as the Hellenic arc, which is in an areis in an area known as Hellenic Arc . It was the largest of a series of earthquakes that affected the island in 1481, starting on 15 March 1481 and continuing until January 1482 . The 1481 Rhodes earthquake occurred at 3:00 in the morning on 3 May, and triggered a tsunami .

Vanuatu lies atop a complex and active plate boundary in the southwestern Pacific Ocean . The primary tectonic feature of the 1,200 km (750 mi) island chain is the New Hebrides Subduction Zone, the convergent boundary of the Australian and Pacific Plates . Volcanic activity is also present along this north-northwest trending and northeast-dipping oceanic trench . The area adjacent to the d'Entrecasteaux Ridge does not experience intermediate-depth earthquakes along a Wadati–Benioff zone that dips steeply at 70° . There is a corresponding g in the area surrounding the ridge, but there is no corresponding earthquake activity .

The Fall of Gallipoli (Turkish: Gelibolu'nun Fethi) was the siege and capture of the fortress and peninsula, by the Ottoman Turks, in March 1354 . After suffering a half-century of defeats at the hands of the Ottomans, the Byzantine Empire had lost nearly al the entire Byzantine Empire . The fall of the fall was part of the Byzantine-Ottoman wars between the two empires . The Ottoman Turks captured the fortress in 1354, taking over the peninsula from the Eastern Roman Empire of the same name . The Fall was the first invasion of the peninsula since the fall of 1354 and the second of the Ottoman Empire in 1483 .

The 1981 Irian Jaya earthquake killed more than 300 people in Indonesia . The earthquake was recorded as a moment magnitude of 6.7 . The quake occurred in eastern Indonesia on January 19, 1981 . Indonesia is one of the most seismically active places in the world, with a subduction zone and many faults . Such earthquakes pose a significant threat to life in the area through earthquakes and also tsunamis . The 1981 earthquake was registered as a magnitude of 6.7 and registered as an earthquake at 4°35′S 139°14′E.23°E﻿ / ﻿4.58°S 139.58; 139.23 °E＼

Zurbatiyah is located in Wasit, Iraq and is a busy port of entry from Iran . It is mainly inhabited by Feyli Kurds and is just across the border from Mehran, Ilam, in Iran . Hundreds of Iranians, mainly pilgrims heading for the Shiite holy cities of Najaf and Karbala, cross the border on foot each day . The city is one of Iraq's busiest crossing points, east of Baghdad, with a population of 22,400 in 2011 . The town is located near the border with Mehran, Iran, which is a border crossing point for pilgrims to Najaf, Karbale and Najaf . The population has grown to 22,000 in 2011

Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The country is well known for its long history of disastrous earthquake activity . It is also known for the waste of valuable natural resources and the deaths of at least 125,000 people since 1900 . The earthquakes of July 1880 in Luzon, the largest island of the Philippines, were one of the most destructive tremors on record in the history of the country . The shocks continued, with greater or less interruption, from the 14th to the 25th of the month, highlighted by three violent shaking events, which destroyed churches and other buildings, producing loss of life . The 2006 Tonga earthquake occurred on 4 May at 04:26:35 local time with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (very strong) One injury occurred and a non-destructive tsunami was observed . The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's Pacific Tsunami Warning Center in Hawaii issued a warning 17 minutes after the earthquake for coastal areas around the Pacific . An hour later, the center downgraded the warning to only the region within 600 miles . The warning was downgraded an hour later to just a region within the region of the Pacific Ocean . The Minoan eruption was a major catastrophic volcanic eruption that devastated the Aegean island of Thera (also called Santorini) in around 1600 BCE . It destroyed the Minoan settlement at Akrotiri, as well as communities and agricultural areas on nearby islands and the coast of Crete with subsequent earthquakes and tsunamis . With a VEI magnitude between 6 and 7, resulting in an ejection of about 7,000 tons of volcanic material, the eruption was the largest in the history of the world's history of eruptions . Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . The 1868 Hawaii earthquake was the largest recorded in the history of Hawaiʻi island . The earthquake occurred at 4 p.m. local time on April 2, 1868 and caused a landslide and tsunami that led to 77 deaths . The aftershock sequence for this event has continued up to the present day . The island of Hawai'i (commonly called the "Big Island") is the currently active volcanic center of the Hawaiian Isle . The event was the biggest ever recorded earthquake on the island of Hawaii, with an estimated magnitude of 7.9 Mfa[1] and a maximum Mercalli intensity of X (Extreme) The event occurred in the Hilina Slump, the

The 1966 Tashkent earthquake occurred on 26 April in the Uzbek SSR . It had a magnitude of 5.1[clarification needed] with an epicenter at a depth of 3–8 kilometers (1.9–5.0 mi) The earthquake caused massive destruction to TASHkent, destroying most of the buildings in the city, killing between 15 and 200 people and leaving between 200,000 to 300,000 homeless . Most of the historic parts of the city had been destroyed and the city was rebuilt, modelled on Soviet architectural styles . The earthquake was the first in the Soviet Union to have a very strong intensity MSK-64 VII (very strong)

The 1868 Arica earthquake occurred on 13 August 1868, near Arica, then part of Peru, now part of Chile, at 21:30 UTC . It had an estimated magnitude between 8.5–9.0 Mw (est.) A tsunami (or multiple tsunamis) in the Pacific Ocean was produced by the earthquake, which was recorded in Hawaii, Japan, Australia, and New Zealand . The USS Wateree beached at Arica 430 yards (390 m) inland . A total of 25,000 people were killed in the 1868 earthquake and tsunami . The earthquake was centered in Peru and northern Chile, which is now in the region of Chile and Peru

The 1868 Ecuador earthquakes occurred at 19:30 UTC on August 15 and 16 August 1868 . They had an estimated magnitude of 6.3 and 6.7 and together caused up to 70,000 casualties . The earthquake of 15 August occurred near El Ángel, Carchi Province, close to the border with Colombia, while that of August 16 occurred near Ibarra in Imbabura Province . Reports of these earthquakes are often confused with the effects of the earthquake of 13 August at Arica, which occurred on August 13, 1868.[1] The earthquakes caused severe damage in the northeastern part of Ecuador and in southwestern Colombia, causing up to 80,000 deaths

The 1868 Hayward earthquake occurred in the San Francisco Bay Area, California, United States on October 21, 1868 . It was the most recent large earthquake to occur on the Hayward Fault Zone . It caused significant damage and a number of deaths throughout the region, and was known as the "Great San Francisco earthquake" prior to the Great San Francisco Quake prior to t . The earthquake caused $350,000 in damage and 30 people were killed in the region . It also caused significant structural damage and significant damage to buildings in the area, including the Hayward stud mill, which was damaged by the 1868 earthquake . The Hayward earthquake was most recent on the fault, and occurred on the same fault line

The 2001 southern Peru earthquake occurred at 20:33:15 UTC (15:33 local time) on June 23 with a moment magnitude of 8.4 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) The quake affected the Peruvian regions of Arequipa, Moquegua and Tacna . It was the most devastating earthquake in Peru since the catastrophic 1970 Ancash earthquake and globally the largest earthquake since the 1965 Rat Islands earthquake . The earthquake was centered in the Arequipe region of Peru and was centered 32km (20 mi) away from the city of Alquimbo . The quake killed 74–145 and injured 2,687–2,713 people .

An earthquake occurred on March 14, 1872 at off coast Hamada, Shimane Prefecture in Japan . 551 people were killed, 4506 houses were damaged, 230 houses were burned and landslides destroyed 6567 homes in the affected area . The earthquake occurred at 16:40 local time, with a magnitude of 7.1 MK (7.1 KUJ) The quake occurred off coast of Hamada in Shimane, Japan, at the time of the earthquake in 1872 . The official confirmed report said 4506 homes were damaged by the earthquake, 230 homes were burned, and 551 were killed . In total, 6567 landslides were also destroyed in the area .

The 1872 Owens Valley earthquake, also known as the Lone Pine earthquake, struck on March 26 at 02:30 local time in the Owens Valley (California, along the east side of the Sierra Nevada), with the epicenter near the town of Lone Pine . Its magnitude has been estimated at Mw 7.4 to 7.9, with a maximum Mercalli Intensity of X (Extreme) It was one of the largest quakes ever recorded in the history of the world . The 526 Antioch earthquake hit Syria (region) and Antioch in the Byzantine Empire in 526 . It struck during late May, probably between 20 and 29 May, at mid-morning, killing approximately 250,000 people . The maximum intensity in Antioch is estimated to be between VIII (Severe) and IX (Violent) on the Mercalli intensity scale . This was in the seventh year of the reign of the Byzantine emperor Justin I and under the consulship of Olybrius.[4] The earthquake was followed by a fire that destroyed most of the buildings left standing by the earthquake . The site of Antioch lies clos to the site of the city of Antioch, now Turkey .

The 1509 Constantinople earthquake or historically Kıyamet-i Sugra ('Little Judgment Day') occurred in the Sea of Marmara on 10 September 1509 at about 10 p.m. The earthquake had an estimated magnitude of 7.2 ± 0.3 on the surface wave magnitude scale . A tsunami and forty-five days of aftershocks followed the earthquake . The death toll of this earthquake is poorly known, with estimates in the range of 1,000 to 13,000 . The 1812 Caracas earthquake measured 7.7 on the Richter magnitude scale . It caused extensive damage in Caracas, La Guaira, Barquisimeto, San Felipe, and Mérida . An estimated 15,000–20,000 people perished as a result of the earthquake . The seismic movement was so significant that in a zone named Valecillo, a new lake was formed and the river Yurubí was dammed up. Numerous rivulets changed their course in the Caracas valley, which was flooded with dirty water . The 1995 Dinar earthquake occurred on 1 October in Dinar (District), Afyonkarahisar, Turkey . It had an Mw magnitude of 6.2[3] with an epicenter close to the Dinar-Çivril fault . The earthquake occurred at a time of political instability in Turkey, with large strikes by public sector workers taking place just 11 days earlier . The disaster was preceded by a number of smaller earthquakes of up to 5.1 magnitude, the last of which had occurred on 26 September 1995 . Total damage of 4,500 or 5100 buildings damaged; at least 90 people were killed and thousands of others were injured in the disaster . Quake occurred at

Vanuatu lies atop a complex and active plate boundary in the southwestern Pacific Ocean . The primary tectonic feature of the 1,200 km (750 mi) island chain is the New Hebrides Subduction Zone, the convergent boundary of the Australian and Pacific Plates . Volcanic activity is also present along this north-northwest trending and northeast-dipping oceanic trench . The area adjacent to the d'Entrecasteaux Ridge does not experience intermediate-depth earthquakes along a Wadati–Benioff zone that dips steeply at 70° . There is a corresponding g in the area surrounding the ridge, but there is no corresponding earthquake activity .

1927 Crimean earthquakes occurred in the month of June and again in September in the waters of the Black Sea near the Crimean Peninsula . Each of the submarine earthquakes in the sequence triggered tsunami . The June event was moderate relative to the large September 11 event, which had at least one aftershock that also generated a tsunami . Natural gas that was released from the sea floor created flames that were visible along the co-section of the surface of the seabed floor . The 1927 Crimean earthquake killed 12 people and triggered a tsunami in the area of Yalta, Crimea, in the wake of the June event, and the September 11 aftershocks were foreshocks of 6.0 and 4.9

The 1965 Ceram Sea earthquake occurred on January 24 at 00:11 UTC with a moment magnitude of 8.2 and its epicenter was located just off the southwestern coast of Sanana Island in eastern Indonesia . The number of people reported dead was 71 and up to 3,000 buildings and a total of 14 bridges were destroyed by both the earthquake and tsunami on Sanana . The event occurred at a depth of 28 kilometers under the Ceram sea, and a tsunami was generated which caused damage in Sanana, Buru, and Mangole.[4] A series of tremors were reported during the week leading up to the mainshock . The 1960 Valdivia earthquake was 9.4–9.6 on the moment magnitude scale . It occurred in the afternoon (19:11 GMT, 15:11 local time) and lasted for approximately 10 minutes . The resulting tsunamis affected southern Chile, Hawaii, Japan, the Philippines, and the Philippines . The quake was the most powerful earthquake ever recorded in the history of the Great Chilean earthquake (Gran terremoto de Chile) in 1960 . It was recorded at the time of the earthquake on 22 May 1960 in Valdivia, Chile, Punta Arenas, Iquique, Santiago and Punta Arenas . The earthquake was the largest ever recorded earthquake in the world

Vanuatu lies atop a complex and active plate boundary in the southwestern Pacific Ocean . The primary tectonic feature of the 1,200 km (750 mi) island chain is the New Hebrides Subduction Zone, the convergent boundary of the Australian and Pacific Plates . Volcanic activity is also present along this north-northwest trending and northeast-dipping oceanic trench . The area adjacent to the d'Entrecasteaux Ridge does not experience intermediate-depth earthquakes along a Wadati–Benioff zone that dips steeply at 70° . There is a corresponding g in the area surrounding the ridge, but there is no corresponding earthquake activity .

Charallave is the capital of Cristóbal Rojas Municipality . The name derives from the local Charavares indigenous people found at the time the city was founded . Total damage was $1.15 billion (2010 USD) and 2–4 people were killed and 100 were injured in the earthquake . The earthquake was centered 32°08′N 115°18′W.13°N 115.30°W﻿ / 32.13; -115.30; . The 893 Ardabil earthquake was a destructive earthquake that struck the city of Ardabil, Iran, on 23 March 893 . The magnitude is unknown, but the death toll was reported to be very large . The USGS, in their "List of Earthquakes with 50,000 or More Deaths", give an estimate that 150,000 were killed, which would make it the ninth deadliest earthquake in history . The Ardabil area is prone to numerous earthquakes and was struck by a major earthquake in 1997 . However, the 893 event is, in fact, considered to be a "mistaken" earthquake, derived from misreadings of the original Armenian writings about the earthquake in Dvin,

1721 catastrophic earthquake centered near Tabriz, Iran . Magnitude7.7 Ms . Quake leveled some three-quarters of the city, and resulted in the deaths of tens of thousands of people . Quake was popularly interpreted as an omen of misfortune or a demonstration of godly wrath . The destruction that the earthquake caused was a significant factor in the successful Ottoman takeover of Tabriz in 1725, as well as contributory factors to the successful takeover of the town of Iran in the 1725 . The total number of casualties caused by the earthquake is between 8,000 and 250,000;[1] it was most likely approximately 80,000.[1] Quake occurred on April 26

The 1879 Gansu earthquake occurred at about 04:00 local time on 1 July . It had an estimated magnitude of 8.0 on the Ms scale and a maximum perceived intensity of XI (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . It caused widespread damage and killed an estimated 22,000 people . The earthquake may have been caused by movement on the SSW-NNE trending Fanjiaba-Linjiang Fault . The meizoseismal area extends 70 km in a SSW/NNE direction and is 30 km across.[2] The earthquake was preceded by foreshocks in the few days before the mainshock . The epicenter was in W

Continental rift zone that was active between the Late Oligocene and the end of the Miocene . It represented a continuation of the Red Sea Rift until break-up occurred in the middle Miocene, with most of the displacement on the newly developed Red Sea spreading centre being accommodated by the Dead Sea Transform . During its brief post-rift history, the deepest part of the remnant rift topography has been filled by the sea, creating the Gulf of Suez . North of the Gulf, the rift becomes indistinct and its exact geometry is uncertain, linking eventually to the Manzala rift beneath the Nile delta . It is unclear how much of the rift's exact geometry will remain in the future .

The earthquakes of July 1880 in Luzon, the largest island of the Philippines, were one of the most destructive tremors on record in the history of the country . The shocks continued, with greater or less interruption, from the 14th to the 25th of the month, highlighted by three violent shaking events, which destroyed churches and other buildings, producing loss of life . Coinciding with the tectonic activity was an increase in volcanic activity in Taal Volcano in southwestern Luzon . This list includes notable earthquakes that have affected Greece during recorded history . This list is currently incomplete, representing only a fraction of the possible events . Greece is located at the complex boundary zone in the eastern Mediterranean between the African Plate and the Aegean Sea Plate . The northern part of Greece lies on the Eurasian Plate while the southern part lies on . These two plate boundaries give rise to two contrasting tectonic styles, ex-Hellenic arc . The southern convergent boundary forms the Hellenic arc.[1] The northern plate boundary is a relatively diffuse divergent boundary and the southern . convergent . boundary forms . the Hellene arc, which gives rise to a . contrasting plate boundaries .

Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . The 1881 Chios earthquake occurred at 13:40 local time (11:30 UTC) on 3 April . It caused severe damage on the island of Chios and also affected Çeşme and Alaçatı on the coast of Turkey . The earthquake had an estimated magnitude of 7.3 and there were an estimated 7,866 casualties . The devastation from the earthquake was the last of the three 'catastrophes' that affected Chios in the 19th century . The 1881 Nicobar Islands earthquake occurred at about 07:49 local time (01:49 UTC) on 31 December, with an epicentre beneath Car Nicobar . It occurred as two separate ruptures, the largest of which had an estimated magnitude of 7.9 on the moment magnitude scale and triggered a tsunami that was observed around the Bay of Bengal . It is probably the earliest earthquake for which rupture parameters have been estimated instrumentally . The Nicobar islands are a series of volcanic islands that are part of an active volcanic region . The largest of the ruptures was estimated to be a magnitude of 7.9 Mw . The 1852 Banda Sea earthquake struck on 26 November, 1852 at 07:40 local time, affecting coastal communities on the Banda Islands . The earthquake had an estimated moment magnitude of 7.5 or 8.4 to 8.8 . It caused violent shaking lasting five minutes, and was assigned IX on the Modified Mercalli intensity scale in the Maluku Islands . A tsunami measuring up to 8 meters slammed into the islands of Banda Neira, Saparua, Haruku and Ceram . The tsunami caused major damage, washing away many villages, ships and residents . At least 60 people were killed in the earthquake and tsunami, including many of the villages and residents of the islands

Colombia is a seismically active country and has a large seismic risk in many areas of its territory due to its location at the boundaries of the Malpelo, Panama, Caribbean, North Andes and South American Plates along the Pacific Ring of Fire . The southeastern and extreme eastern portions of Colombia are not as seismic active as the rest of the country . The first recorded earthquake felt in Colombia occurred on September 11, 1530, around 10:00 AM, probably with the epicentre near Cumaná, Venezuela. The 1556 Shaanxi earthquake, or Huaxian earthquake, is the deadliest earthquake in recorded history . It occurred on the morning of 23 January 1556, during the Ming dynasty . According to imperial records, approximately 830,000 people lost their lives . The earthquake was the deadliest ever recorded event in the history of the world . It was the 12th day of the 12 month of the year Jiajing 34 in Chinese calendar, when the earthquake occurred . The quake was magnitude 8.0m (MW) and the depth of the quake was unknown . The area was affected by the earthquake, and the area was largely uninhabited by modern-day Shaanx province .

Amir Taheri was born in Ahvaz, Iran, and educated in Tehran, London, and Paris . He was executive editor-in-chief of Kayhan, a "strongly pro-Shah" newspaper . He is the current Chairman of Gatestone Institute in Europe . His writings focus on the Middle East affairs and topics related to Islamic terrorism . He has been the subject of many controversies involving allegations about his writings, most notable of which was the 2006 Iranian sumptuary law controversy . He claims Osama bin Laden's death in 20022 was a hoax; he is the author of Nest of Spies and claims of Khomeni quotation and Javad Zarif's accusations .

The 1884 Andalusian earthquake (Spanish: Terremoto de Andalucía de 1884) occurred in Andalusia, in the south of Spain . It shook a poor region where many of the houses were built without foundations, with lime or mud mortar, and with weak joints . 10,715 buildings were badly damaged, of which 4,399 were completely destroyed . There were over 1,200 deaths and 1,500 serious injuries . The heavy snow that followed the earthquake caused further suffering and deaths . The 1674 Ambon earthquake occurred on February 17 at between 19:30 and 20:00 local time somewhere in the Maluku Islands . The resulting tsunami reached heights of up to 100 meters on Ambon Island killing over 2,000 individuals . It was the first detailed documentation of a tsunami in Indonesia and the largest ever recorded in the country . The earthquake occurred in the Banda Sea, Indonesia, killing 2,347 people . The 19.5-minute tsunami was the largest in Indonesia, with the highest death toll of any tsunami ever recorded at the time of the 1674 earthquake and megatsunami in the history of the country's largest tsunami in the region . The 1886 Peloponnese earthquake occurred at 23:27 local time (21:32 UTC) on 27 August . The 1969 Bohai earthquake occurred on July 18, 1969, at 13:24 local time . The magnitude of this earthquake is Ms 7.4 . The earthquake could be felt in Liaoning, Hebei, Beijing, Tianjin, Shanxi, Shandong, and Jiangsu . This earthquake caused ground surface subsidences of about 15.1cm ~ 15.8cm in the Yellow River Delta region . The mechanism of the earthquake was of dextral strike-slip faulting . It was located near the Tancheng-Lujiang fault zone (郯庐断裂带), some researchers think that this earthquake was dominated by this fault zone .

The 1897 Mindanao earthquakes occurred on September 20, 1897 and September 21, 1897 . The earthquakes were originally given estimated magnitudes of 8.6 and 8.7 on the surface wave magnitude scale by Charles Richter . The estimated epicentres of the two earthquakes are identical, lying just off the southwestern coast of Mindanaos in the Philippines, south of Basilan island . With few exceptions, all the masonry buildings in Zamboanga and Basilan were left in ruins.[4] Both earthquakes triggained a magnitude of 7.4 and 7.5 Ms, respectively, and both were reported to have been very strong or very strong . The 856 Damghan earthquake or the 856 Qumis earthquake occurred on 22 December 856 (242 AH) The earthquake had an estimated magnitude of 7.9, and a maximum intensity of X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . It caused approximately 200,000 deaths and is listed by the USGS as the sixth deadliest earthquake in recorded history . The earthquake's epicenter is estimated to be close to the city of Damghan, which was then the capital of the Persian province of Qumis . The meizoseismal area (area of maximum damage) extended for about 350 kilometres (220 mi) along the southern edge of the eastern Alborz mountains

The 1556 Shaanxi earthquake, or Huaxian earthquake, is the deadliest earthquake in recorded history . It occurred on the morning of 23 January 1556, during the Ming dynasty . According to imperial records, approximately 830,000 people lost their lives . The earthquake was the deadliest ever recorded event in the history of the world . It was the 12th day of the 12 month of the year Jiajing 34 in Chinese calendar, when the earthquake occurred . The quake was magnitude 8.0m (MW) and the depth of the quake was unknown . The area was affected by the earthquake, and the area was largely uninhabited by modern-day Shaanx province .

Malatya is a large city in the Eastern Anatolia region of Turkey . The city has been a human settlement for thousands of years . It has been the capital of Malatiya Province and is a major city in Turkey's Eastern Anatolian region . It is located in a district of 922.16 km2 (356.05 sq mi) and has a population of 806,156 (2,300 sq m) The city is the largest in Turkey and is the most populous in the region of the Turkish region of Anatolia, with a population population of 9,800 sq m (3,130 sq ft) and a district density of870/km2 (2

1953 earthquake centered in the southern Ionian Islands in western Greece . The event measured 6.8 on the moment magnitude scale . It raised the whole island of Kefalonia by 60cm (24in) and caused widespread damage . The most destructive was the August 12 earthquake, which killed445–800 . In mid-August there were over 113 recorded earthquakes in the region, and the most destructive of the event was that August 12 . The earthquake was centered near the Ionian islands of the southern Greek island of the Zakyntos region, which was also known as the Great Kefaalonia . It was the first earthquake to hit the region since the 1953 Ionian earthquake .

The 1973 Luhuo earthquake struck near the town of Zhaggo in the Garzê Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture of Sichuan Province, China on February 6 with a magnitude of 7.6 Ms. The earthquake had a maximum intensity of X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale, resulting in 2,199 deaths and a further 2,743 injuries . Serious and widespread destruction to villages was reported in the area as a result of the earthquake . Serious damage was reported to villages in Luhu County, China . The earthquake was recorded at 31°23′53″N 100°34′52″E﻿ / ﻿31.398°N 100

Vanuatu lies atop a complex and active plate boundary in the southwestern Pacific Ocean . The primary tectonic feature of the 1,200 km (750 mi) island chain is the New Hebrides Subduction Zone, the convergent boundary of the Australian and Pacific Plates . Volcanic activity is also present along this north-northwest trending and northeast-dipping oceanic trench . The area adjacent to the d'Entrecasteaux Ridge does not experience intermediate-depth earthquakes along a Wadati–Benioff zone that dips steeply at 70° . There is a corresponding g in the area surrounding the ridge, but there is no corresponding earthquake activity .

The 1893 Quchan earthquake occurred at about 19:30 local time (15:06 UTC) on 17 November . It had an estimated magnitude of 6.6 on the surface wave magnitude scale and a maximum perceived intensity of X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The Kopet Dag mountain range lies at the northern edge of the complex zone of deformation caused by the continuing collision of the Arabian Plate with the Eurasian Plate . There are currently about 18,000 casualties in the area, particularly to the town of Quchian, and there were an estimated 18,000 casualties . The first of the 1894 Atalanti earthquakes occurred on 20 April 1894 at 16:52 UTC, with a magnitude of 6.4 on the moment magnitude scale and a maximum perceived intensity of X on the Mercalli intensity scale . It was followed seven days later on 27 April at 19:42 UTC by the second at 6.9 . These two earthquakes caused widespread damage in the Locris area, causing a total of 255 deaths . More literature on these destructive events can be seen in the references section of this article . The 1894 earthquakes were the first and second of the series of quakes to occur in Greece in 1894, with the second lasting at least six hours .

The 1894 San Juan earthquake took place in the province of San Juan, Argentina, on 27 October 1894, at about 07:30 PM . It was the most powerful earthquake recorded in Argentina, with magnitude 7.5 on the surface wave magnitude scale . The maximum perceived intensity for the earthquake was IX (Violent) on the Mercalli intensity scale . It caused severe damage and about 100 casualties in San Juan and La Rioja province, and also caused minor damage in Catamarcarca, Córdoba, San Luis and Mendoza, up to 500 km away from the epicenter . The earthquake was centered at 29°36′S 69°00′W

The 1895 Ljubljana earthquake struck on Easter Sunday, 14 April . It struck with a Richter magnitude of 6.1 and a maximum Mercalli Intensity of VIII–IX . The earthquake's epicentre was located in Janče, about 16 kilometres (10 mi) to the east of the city . It was the most[3] and the last, destructive earthquake in the area.[4] The shock was felt in a circle with a radiating radius of around 8 kilometres (9 miles) The earthquake struck at 20:17 UTC (22:17 local time) with a depth of 10 kilometres (16 km) deep . 1931 Southwest Sumatra earthquake occurred on 25 September at 05:59 UTC . It was located between Enggano Island and Sumatra, Indonesia, then under the rule of Dutch East Indies . The 2006 Pangandaran earthquake and tsunami occurred on July 17 at 15:19:27 local time along a subduction zone off the coast of west and central Java, a large and densely populated island in the Indonesian archipelago . The shock had a moment magnitude of 7.7 and a maximum perceived intensity of IV (Light) The earthquake killed668 people, 65 missing and 9,299 injured . Total damage was $44.7 million, with total damage estimated at $44 million . The earthquake occurred along the west coast of Java Island, Indonesia, along with the eastern coast of the country's Java Peninsula . The quake was centered 9°20′S 107°19′E

Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . This list considers every notable earthquake felt or with its epicenter within Mexico's current borders and maritime areas . Mexico lies within two seismically active earthquake zones . The Cocos Plate is subducting under the North American Plate at a rate of 67mm (0.220ft) per year . Southern Mexico also contains numerous faults, which causes that section of the country to have high tectonic activity . Northeastern Mexico and the Yucatan Peninsula are not as active as the area close to the boundary between the Cocos and Cocos plates . The Philippines lies along the Pacific Ring of Fire, which causes frequent seismic and volcanic activity . Many earthquakes of smaller magnitude occur very regularly due to the meeting of major tectonic plates in the region . The largest was the 1918 Celebes Sea earthquake with Mw8.3.0 . The 1976 Moro Gulf earthquake killed 5,000–8,000 people . Largest earthquake in the Philippines was the 18th-19th-century Celebes Sea quake, the largest in the country, with a magnitude of 8.3 . The country lies on the Pacific Rim of Fire and is located near the Philippines' southern tip of the U.S.-Pacific Ocean .

The 1946 earthquake occurred near the Aleutian Islands, Alaska on April 1 . The shock had a moment magnitude of 8.6 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VI (Strong) It resulted in 165–173 casualties and over $26 million in damage . The seafloor along the fault was elevated, triggering a Pacific-wide tsunami with multiple destructive waves at heights from 45–130ft . The tsunami obliterated the Scotch Cap Lighthouse on Unimak Island, Alaska among others, and killed all five lighthouse keepers, including all five keepers . The earthquake killed five people and destroyed over $25 million worth of goods and damaged the coast of Alaska and Hawaii . The quake was

The 1856 Heraklion earthquake, also known as the Crete earthquake or Rhodes earthquake, occurred on the morning of October 12 at 02:45 am local time . The earthquake was felt over a very wide area extending from Sicily, Italy to the Levant and North Africa . On the Greek island of Crete, the effects of the earthquake were cataclysmic, over 50 people were killed and over 50 others were injured in the 1856 Crete quake . The quake had an estimated magnitude of 7.7 to 8.3 at a depth of approximately 61 to 100 km . It was also felt in the Levant, Egypt, Cyprus, Egypt and the Levant as well as the Levant .

The 1556 Shaanxi earthquake, or Huaxian earthquake, is the deadliest earthquake in recorded history . It occurred on the morning of 23 January 1556, during the Ming dynasty . According to imperial records, approximately 830,000 people lost their lives . The earthquake was the deadliest ever recorded event in the history of the world . It was the 12th day of the 12 month of the year Jiajing 34 in Chinese calendar, when the earthquake occurred . The quake was magnitude 8.0m (MW) and the depth of the quake was unknown . The area was affected by the earthquake, and the area was largely uninhabited by modern-day Shaanx province .

The 1886 Peloponnese earthquake occurred at 23:27 local time (21:32 UTC) on 27 August . It had an estimated magnitude between 6.8–7.3 on the moment magnitude scale and a maximum felt intensity of X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . It caused extensive damage in Messenia, with the towns of Filiatra and Marathos both severely affected . Between 326 and 600 people were killed . The 1994 Bolivia earthquake occurred on June 9, 1994 . The epicenter was located in a sparsely populated region in the Amazon jungle, about 200 miles from La Paz . The Harvard CMT Project assigned it a focal depth of 647 km and a magnitude MW of 8.2 . It is the largest earthquake since 1977 Sumba earthquake, later superseded by more recent larger events (e.g., 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake) It is also the second largest earthquake ever recorded with a . focal depth greater than 300km, along with the 2018 Fiji earthquake, the largest currently being the 2013 Okhotsk Sea earthquake . 1692 – 7 June: The Jamaica earthquake destroys Port Royal due to heavy liquefaction and a tsunami; around 5,000 are killed there . Residents resettle nearby thus establishing Kingston . 1712 – Hurricane.[3]1720 – Pirate Calico Jack hanged . 1729 – Wolmers's School founded . 1740 – "Twelve Apostles" battery constructed . 1746 – Theatre opens in Harbour Street . 1750 – Sephardic synagogue built . 1755 – House of Assembly (legislature of British Jamaica) relocated to Kingston . The city became Kingston in the mid-19th century and is now the capital of the capital city of Kingston, which is located in Jamaica .

Series of earthquakes in Alaska, USA, USA were recorded in September 1899 . The most powerful of these occurred on September 10 at about noon, local time . The area was sparsely populated and no fatalities were recorded, but the earthquakes were notable for the degree of elevation recorded, up to 47 feet, and for the effects on the glaciers in the region . Fieldwork on the effects of the earthquake was carried out between 1905 and 1910, and a    study was conducted in 1905 to find out the effects the earthquake had on the region's glaciers . The earthquakes occurred in the area around Yakutat Bay, Alaska, which was uplifted by 47 feet in the 1899 earthquakes . No fatalities

1938 Banda Sea earthquake occurred on February 1 with an estimated magnitude of 8.4 on the moment magnitude scale and a Rossi–Forel intensity of VII (Very strong tremor) This oblique-slip event generated destructive tsunamis of up to 1.5 metres in the region . No human lives were lost in the event, but no deaths were attributed to the earthquake . The 1938 earthquake occurred 300 km (190 mi) WNW of Dobo, Aru Islands, 200 km N of Saumlaki, Tanimbar Islands, Australia, and 2,760 km E of Jakarta, Java . For the period 1850–2004, there was about one potentially damaging event per year on average, though many of these did not cause serious consequences or loss of life . This list considers every notable earthquake felt or with its epicenter within Mexico's current borders and maritime areas . Mexico lies within two seismically active earthquake zones . The Cocos Plate is subducting under the North American Plate at a rate of 67mm (0.220ft) per year . Southern Mexico also contains numerous faults, which causes that section of the country to have high tectonic activity . Northeastern Mexico and the Yucatan Peninsula are not as active as the area close to the boundary between the Cocos and Cocos plates . The Baja California peninsula lies near the boundary of the Pacific Plate and the Pacific and Rivera plates, while southern Mexico lies just north of the boundary

The 1985 Mexico City earthquake struck in the early morning of 19 September at 07:17:50 (CST) with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a maximal Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent) The event caused serious damage to the Greater Mexico City area and the deaths of at least 5,000 people . Aftershocks 7.5 Mw’s were followed by 7.0 Mw aftershocks 30 April 1986 . The 2011 Puebla earthquake was the first major earthquake to hit Mexico City in the country since the 1985 earthquake occurred near Mexico City . Colombia is a seismically active country and has a large seismic risk in many areas of its territory due to its location at the boundaries of the Malpelo, Panama, Caribbean, North Andes and South American Plates along the Pacific Ring of Fire . The southeastern and extreme eastern portions of Colombia are not as seismic active as the rest of the country . The first recorded earthquake felt in Colombia occurred on September 11, 1530, around 10:00 AM, probably with the epicentre near Cumaná, Venezuela. Six of the Top Ten strongest Indonesian earthquakes ≥ 8.3 Mw occurred near Sumatra and along the Java Trench, with six of the strongest earthquakes in the country's history occurring near the Sumatra Trench . The 1900 San Narciso earthquake occurred on October 28 at between 4:30 and 4:45 am local time . The earthquake had an epicenter off Miranda State or near the Venezuelan capital Caracas . It had an estimated moment magnitude of 7.6 to 7.7 and a surface wave magnitude of 8.4 . The maximum Mercalli intensity was VIII and X, causing landslides and liquefaction events . Many buildings were severely damaged or collapsed during the earthquake . 140 people were killed and 50 were injured in the earthquake, mostly from landslides, in addition to a tsunami of 5.5 meters (10.3 km) The earthquake occurred in the Cariaco Basin in Venezuela .

Earthquake struck Dobrich Province, Bulgaria on March 31, 1901 . Quake was 7.2 magnitude, the most powerful earthquake ever recorded in the Black Sea . Quake generated a 4–5-metre (13-16-ft) high tsunami that devastated the coastal areas of Romania and Bulgaria . Earthquake epicenter was located in the east of Cape Kaliakra, 30 kilometres (19 mi) off northeast coast of Bulgaria . Quake occurred at a depth of 15 km (9.3 mi) and generated a tsunami of 4-5 metres (13 ft) high . Quake also caused 1,200 houses to be destroyed and 4,200 landslides were caused by aftershocks . Quake

The 1773 Guatemala earthquake struck Guatemala on July 29 at 15:45 local time . It had an estimated epicentral magnitude of 7.5 Mi . It was part of a sequence that started in May that year . The series of all these earthquakes is also referred to as the Santa Marta earthquake(s) as it had started on the feast day of Saint Martha . With an intensity of approximately VII (Very strong) to VIII (Severe) on the Mercalli intensity scale, the series of earthquakes destroyed much of Santiago, Chile, as well as much of the Santiago de Agua, which was destroyed by the Santa Marta quakes in 1773 .
