Iranian island in the Strait of Hormuz is the largest island in Iran, and the largest in the Persian Gulf . It is located 1,491 km2 (576 sq mi) and 135 km (83.9 mi) length . It's located in the Clarence Strait/Khuran, separated from the mainland by the Clarence strait . The population of Qeshm (pop.26,807) is 148,993 (2016) and the population density is 67.07 per km2 (173.71/sqmi) It is also the largest Iranian island, with a population of 148,993 . The 1905 Bolnai earthquake occurred in or near the Asgat Sum of Zavkhan Province in Mongolia on 23 July . The earthquake has been estimated at 8.25[3] to 8.4[2] on the moment magnitude scale . The duration of the earthquake was estimated at about two minutes . It is believed to be a strike-slip rupture of a branch of the Bolnai Fault, extending about 300 to 375 km along the fault, and possibly an additional 80 km of the Teregtiin Fault . The Alaska boundary dispute was a territorial dispute between the United States and the United Kingdom, which then controlled Canada's foreign relations . It was resolved by arbitration in 1903 . The final resolution favored the American position, as Canada did not get an all-Canadian outlet from the Yukon gold fields to the sea . The dispute had existed between the Russian Empire and Britain since 1821, and was inherited by the U.S. as a consequence of the Alaska Purchase in 1867 . The disappointment and anger in Canada was directed at the British government for betraying Canadian interests in favor of healthier Anglo-American relations . The American position was favored by the American as Canada didn't get an outlet to the Yuk

Panama seceded in 1903 from Colombia, and comprises the yellow area in the Central American isthmus . The separation of Panama from Colombia was formalized on 3 November 1903, with the establishment of the Republic of Panama . Panama's brief independence from Spain in 1821 was also formalized in 1903 . The Republic of Colombia was formed in 1886, and is now a republic of Colombia . It is part of a series on the history of Colombia, starting with the US and US-backed establishment of Colombia in 1886 . The republic is now part of Colombia's economic and military history portal, the Colombian portal EconomicConstitutionalMilitaryvte . The country is now the most populous country in the world

The 1904 Douliu earthquake struck central Taiwan with a magnitude of 6.1 at 04:25 on November 6, 1904 . The quake caused widespread damage and killed 145 people, making it the fifth deadliest earthquake of the 20th century in Taiwan . Despite the relatively light magnitude, the shallow depth of the temblor (7km) and the fact that it struck in a popu, the quake was the 5th deadliest in Taiwan, killing 145 people . The earthquake shook towns in present-day Yunlin County, Chiayi County, and Tainan City, and the area surrounding the quake struck in the early hours of November 6 . Earthquakes occur frequently in New Zealand as the country is situated in the collision zone between the Indo-Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, part of the Pacific Basin Ring of Fire, where many earthquakes and volcanoes occur . The Phoenix Islands Protected Area (PIPA) is located in the Republic of Kiribati, an ocean nation in the central Pacific approximately midway between Australia and Hawaii . PIPA is one of Earth’s last intact oceanic coral archipelago ecosystems with reefs being what a reef might have looked like one thousand years ago . It is also designated as the world's largest and deepest UN-designated marine protected area (MPA) and one of the largest protected areas of any type (land or sea) on Earth . 1905 Tsetserleg earthquake occurred on July 9, 1905 . The magnitude of the earthquake has been estimated at 7.9 to 8.3 on the moment magnitude scale . It is believed to be a strike-slip rupture of a branch of the Bolnai Fault, extending about 190 km . The fault displacement during the earthquake was greater than 5 m[3] and the duration is estimated at about one minute . The earthquake occurred in or near the Tseterleg Sum of Khövsgöl Province in Mongolia . The duration of the quake is estimated to have been about a minute, with a magnitude of about 8.0 . Georgian history includes prehistoric Georgia, pre-historic Georgia and early modern Georgian history . Georgian culture includes Shulaveri-Shomu culture, trialeti culture and  Colchian culture . Georgian history: 1801–1918 period of Georgian history; 1801 1818 period of Georgian history of Russian Empire: Trabzon Eyalet, Trabzo . Georgia is the birthplace of the Iberian kingdom of Iberia, the capital of Kartli, and the Caucasus region of Tbilisi . Georgia was ruled by the Kingdom of Georgia during the Roman era of Romanism and the early medieval period of the Georgian kingdom of the Caucasus .

The Philippines lies along the Pacific Ring of Fire, which causes frequent seismic and volcanic activity . Many earthquakes of smaller magnitude occur very regularly due to the meeting of major tectonic plates in the region . The largest was the 1918 Celebes Sea earthquake with Mw8.3.0 . The 1976 Moro Gulf earthquake killed 5,000–8,000 people . Largest earthquake in the Philippines was the 18th-19th-century Celebes Sea quake, the largest in the country, with a magnitude of 8.3 . The country lies on the Pacific Rim of Fire and is located near the Philippines' southern tip of the U.S.-Pacific Ocean .

The 1906 Meishan earthquake was centered on Moe'akhe, Kagi-cho, Japanese Taiwan . It is the third-deadliest earthquake in Taiwan's recorded history, claiming around 1,260 lives . The shock had a surface wave magnitude of 6.8 and a Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent) The shock was centered 23°33′N 120°27′E﻿ / 23.55°N 120.45°E (3.7 mi) The earthquake occurred on March 17, 1906, in modern-day Meishaan, Chiayi County, Taiwan . The death toll from the earthquake is 1,258-1,266; 2

The Revillagigedo Islands are a group of four volcanic islands in the Pacific Ocean . They lie in an area of 157.81 km2 (60.93 sq mi) and are known for their unique ecosystem . The 1906 San Francisco earthquake struck the coast of Northern California . The earthquake was a magnitude 7.9m (MW) and a depth of 5m (8.0km) The quake was the largest earthquake ever recorded in the United States in the history of the San Francisco Bay Area and Central Coast of the U.S. It was the first major earthquake to hit the North Coast since the 1906 San Andreas Fault in California . Lake Langano (Oromo: Hora Langaanoo) is a lake in the Oromia Region of Ethiopia . It is located to the east of Lake Abijatta in the Main Ethiopian Rift at an elevation of 1,585 meters . In 1849, the first earthquake following European settlement in WA was recorded . The strongest earthquake with its epicentre on land is the Meckering earthquake of 1968, which caused injuries to at least 17 people and extensive property damage . The previous largest earthquake documented occurred in 1941, at Meeberrie, in the Murchison region . The largest earthquake affecting Western Australia in modern times was an offshore earthquake in 2019, occurring 202 km west of Broome at a magnitude of 6.6 causing minor damage in the town itself . The South American Plate is moving over the Nazca Plate at a rate of 77mm (3.0in) per year . The same process has caused the rise of the Andes mountain range and the creation of the Peru–Chile Trench, as well as volcanism in the Peruvian highlands . The oldest rocks in Peru date to the Precambrian and are more than two billion years old . Along the southern coast, granulite and charnockite shows reworking by an ancient orogeny mountain-building event . The rocks have anomalously high strontium isotope ratios, which are located close to the Peru-Chile Trench, with anomal

The 1687 Peru earthquake occurred at 11:30 UTC on 20 October . It had an estimated magnitude of 8.4–8.7 and caused severe damage to Lima, Callao and Ica . It triggered a tsunami and overall about 5,000 people died . The earthquake is likely to be a result of thrust faulting, caused by the subduction of the Nazca plate beneath the South American plate . The coastal parts of Peru and Chile have a history of great megathrust earthquakes originating from this plate boundary, such as the 1960 Valdivia earthquake . The port of Pisco was also hit by a tsunami, which triggered a death toll of 5,200 people in the area .

The group, with a total area of 483 square miles (1,251 square km), includes Karakelong (the largest), Salibabu, Kabaruan, and a small number of offshore islets . The islands are located about 225 miles (360 km) northeast of Sulawesesi, in Indonesia, north-east of the Sangihe Islands . The 2013 Okhotsk Sea earthquake occurred with a moment magnitude of 8.3 at 15:44:49 local time on 24 May . It had an epicenter in the Sea of Okhotski and affected primarily (but not only) Asian Russia, especially the Kamchatka Peninsula where the shaking lasted for five minutes . The quake was not particularly intense at the surface, but was felt over a very large area . The 1907 Sumatra earthquake occurred on January 4 at 05:19:11 UTC . The estimated magnitude is 7.5–8.0 Ms, with an epicentre close to Simeulue, off Sumatra . It triggered a widespread and damaging tsunami that caused at least 2,188 deaths . The tsunami gave rise to the S'mong legend, which is credited with saving many lives during the 2004 earthquake . The earthquake was the first to occur in the region of Sumatra and was recorded as a tsunami, with a magnitude of 8.4 Mw, 8.2-8.5 Ms . The Hindu Kush is an 800-kilometre-long (500 mi) mountain range in Central and South Asia to the west of the Himalayas . It stretches from central and western Afghanistan into northwestern Pakistan and far southeastern Tajikistan . The range forms the western section of the Hindu Kush Himalayan Region (HKH) to the north, nea . The highest peak in the range is at 7,708 m (25,289 ft) and the highest elevation is at Tirich Mir (Pakistan) The range is located near the border of Afghanistan and Pakistan, with its highest peak being at 7,708m (26,289ft) It is

Myanmar is one of the most seismically active regions in the world . Oblique subduction, block rotation, and a transform margin has been responsible for the seismic activities of the country . The Sagaing Fault is one the largest sources of earthquakes in the country, having produced deadly quakes in the past centuries . The Shan Plateau is another source of earthquakes, hosting many active strike-slip faults that accommodate block rotation of the Sunda Plate . The 2004 earthquake was the largest earthquake in Myanmar, with a magnitude of 6.0 magnitude of magnitude 9.0 in the region . Myanmar has also suffered tsunamis, with the 2004 earthquake being the largest tsunami in Myanmar . The country has

The 1908 Messina earthquake occurred on 28 December in Sicily and Calabria, southern Italy with a moment magnitude 7.1 magnitude earthquake & tsunami . The earthquake was also known as the 1908 Messina and Reggio earthquake[4] The disaster occurred on December 28, 1908 in Messina, Italy . The quake was the largest earthquake ever recorded in the history of the Messina -Taormina Fault, which runs offshore of Sicily the entire length of the Strait of Messina; or according to findings in 2019, the fault may be blind normal fault underlying the Strait . This list includes any notable historical earthquakes that have epicenters within the current boundaries of Turkey . This list is incomplete . Turkey is a seismically active area within the complex zone of collision between the Eurasian Plate and both the African and Arabian Plates . Much of the country lies on the Anatolian Plate, a small plate bounded by two major strike-slip fault zones . The western part of Turkey is also affected by the zone of the North and East Anolian Fault . Seismic hazard is a major concern for the country's geology and geology of the region . The 1909 Borujerd earthquake also known as Silakhor earthquake occurred on the Dorood Fault, in modern day Iran . Around 8,000 fatalities were caused directly from the magnitude 7.3 earthquake . An indefinite number of aftershocks continued for six months after the main shock . The section on this fault ruptured was the same as the main rupture zone of the 2006 Borujder earthquake . The tremor caused 40 kilometers (25 mi) of visible surface faulting . The earthquake also caused damage to 60 villages within the region . The area was affected by a series of earthquakes in the early 1900s and early 2000s . The 1906 earthquake was the first major earthquake to strike in Iran

The 1939 Erzincan earthquake struck eastern Turkey at 1:57:23 a.m. on 27 December local time with a moment magnitude of 7.8 Mw and a maximum Mercalli intensity of XII (Extreme) It was the second most powerful earthquake recorded in Turkey, after the 1668 North Anatolia earthquake . This was one of the largest in a sequence of violent shocks to affect Turkey along the North Anatolian Fault . The earthquake killed 32,700–32,700 people and injured 100,000 people in the region . This list considers every notable earthquake felt or with its epicenter within Mexico's current borders and maritime areas . Mexico lies within two seismically active earthquake zones . The Cocos Plate is subducting under the North American Plate at a rate of 67mm (0.220ft) per year . Southern Mexico also contains numerous faults, which causes that section of the country to have high tectonic activity . Northeastern Mexico and the Yucatan Peninsula are not as active as the area close to the boundary between the Cocos and Cocos plates . The Baja California peninsula lies near the boundary of the Pacific Plate and the Pacific and Rivera plates, while southern Mexico lies just north of the boundary

This is a list of earthquakes in Japan with either a magnitude greater than or equal to 7.0 or which caused significant damage or casualties . The present list is not exhaustive, and reliable and precise magnitude data is scarce for earthquakes that occurred before the development of modern measuring instruments . The first reliably documented earthquake in Nara prefecture on May 23, 416, was in Yamato in what is now Nara Prefecture on August 23,  416, and the first to be reliably documented took place in May 24, 416 . Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . An earthquake measuring 6.6 MW on the moment magnitude scale struck Iburi Subprefecture in southern Hokkaido, Japan, on 6 September 2018 at 3:08 a.m. JST . The earthquake's epicenter was near Tomakomai and occurred at a depth of 35.0 kilometers (21.7 mi) The Japan Meteorological Agency registered a magnitude of 6.7 Mj and a maximum intensity of 7 on the shindo scale . 41 people were killed and 691 were injured in the earthquake . Shaking from the earthquake was felt in the area, but no tsunami or landslide was reported . Aftershocks were felt in parts of the region .

Vanuatu lies atop a complex and active plate boundary in the southwestern Pacific Ocean . The primary tectonic feature of the 1,200 km (750 mi) island chain is the New Hebrides Subduction Zone, the convergent boundary of the Australian and Pacific Plates . Volcanic activity is also present along this north-northwest trending and northeast-dipping oceanic trench . The area adjacent to the d'Entrecasteaux Ridge does not experience intermediate-depth earthquakes along a Wadati–Benioff zone that dips steeply at 70° . There is a corresponding g in the area surrounding the ridge, but there is no corresponding earthquake activity .

This is a list of earthquakes that have occurred in the Italian seismic district of Irpinia since the 15th century . The death toll includes the total number of deaths as a result of the earthquake . It comprises all of the significant earthquakes whose epicenter was located in the area, not those whose were outside the area but may have still have an effect on it . The list includes all significant earthquakes that occurred outside the region, but may still have a significant effect on the area's seismic district, but not only those that occurred in it . It includes the death toll of the earthquakes, not the number of people who died from the earthquake, as well as those who were killed by the quake .

The 2013 Solomon Islands earthquake struck northeast of Australia on 6 February with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) Its epicenter was the Solomon Islands, at the boundaries of the Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, causing local evacuations and a tsunami of 1.5 m (4.9 ft) and killing at least nine people . Aftershocks were also felt in the region, with a total of 20 aftershocks of around 20,000 occurring during the event . The Santa Maria earthquake was the largest earthquake ever recorded in Oceania, killing 9 people and injuring 5 others, killing 5 and injuring 17 .

Archipelago in eastern Indonesia, also called the Spice Islands"Spice Islands" redirects here. For other uses, see Spice Islands (disambiguation) For the Indonesian provinces administering the archipelago, see North Maluku and Maluku (province) The Maluku Islands or the Moluccas are located east of Sulawesi, west of New Guinea, and west of Papua New Guinea . They are located on the Halmahera Plate within the Molucca Sea Collision Zone . The highest elevation of 3,027 m (9931 ft) is at Binaiya, the highest point of the island's highest peak . The Philippines lies along the Pacific Ring of Fire, which causes frequent seismic and volcanic activity . Many earthquakes of smaller magnitude occur very regularly due to the meeting of major tectonic plates in the region . The largest was the 1918 Celebes Sea earthquake with Mw8.3.0 . The 1976 Moro Gulf earthquake killed 5,000–8,000 people . Largest earthquake in the Philippines was the 18th-19th-century Celebes Sea quake, the largest in the country, with a magnitude of 8.3 . The country lies on the Pacific Rim of Fire and is located near the Philippines' southern tip of the U.S.-Pacific Ocean .

The 1911 Sarez earthquake occurred in the Pamir Mountains in the Rushon District of eastern Tajikistan . It triggered a massive landslide, blocking the Murghab River and forming the Usoi Dam, the tallest dam in the world, creating Sarez Lake . The earthquake and related landslides destroyed many buildings and killed about 100 people in the region . The quake had an estimated magnitude of 7.4 on the surface wave magnitude scale and a maximum felt intensity of about IX (Violent) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The Sarez lake was formed by the dam, which is now known as Sarez Dam, is located in Sarez Province of the Russian Empire, Tajik

At least 13 people were killed and another 210 injured in Davao del Sur on December 15, 2019 . The earthquake measured 6.8 Mw. The quake was centered on the island of Mindanao in the province of Davao Del Sur on the Philippines' island of the southern tip of the north-eastern province of the Philippines . Archipelago in the western Pacific Ocean, part of Micronesia and Palau . For the island in Kiribati (Southern Line Islands), see Caroline Island . The Caroline Islands (or the Carolines) are a widely scattered archipelago of tiny islands to the north of New Guinea . Politically, they are divided between the Federated States of Micronesia in the eastern part of the group, and the extreme western end . On November 11, 1911, a cold snap affected the Central United States . Many cities broke record highs, going into the 70s and 80s early that afternoon . This is the only day in many midwest cities' weather bureau jurisdictions where the record highs and lows were broken for the same day . Some cities experienced tornadoes on Saturday and a blizzard on Sunday . A blizzard even occurred within one hour after an F4 tornado hit Rock County, W.C. The Great Blue Norther or 11/11/11 is the name of the 1911 cold snap, known as the Great Blue Norther or the Great Blue norther of November 11, 1911

The 1964 Alaskan earthquake occurred at 5:36 PM AKST on Good Friday, March 27, 1964 . It was the second most powerful earthquake in recorded history . 131 people were killed in the earthquake . The earthquake caused a tsunami of 67 m (220 ft) at Shoup Bay, Alaska . Total damage was $311 million (1964 USD) and total damage was $311 million in the United States, Canada . It is the second largest earthquake ever recorded in the history of the world's history of quakes, with 9.2 magnitude (6.7 mb) and 9.3 magnitude (9.2 mw) The earthquake was also known as the Great Al

The 1908 Messina earthquake occurred on 28 December in Sicily and Calabria, southern Italy with a moment magnitude 7.1 magnitude earthquake & tsunami . The earthquake was also known as the 1908 Messina and Reggio earthquake[4] The disaster occurred on December 28, 1908 in Messina, Italy . The quake was the largest earthquake ever recorded in the history of the Messina -Taormina Fault, which runs offshore of Sicily the entire length of the Strait of Messina; or according to findings in 2019, the fault may be blind normal fault underlying the Strait . The 1911 Guerrero earthquake occurred on December 16 at 12:14 local time near the coast of Guerrero, Mexico along the Mexican subduction zone . The duration of the shaking was just over two minutes and the death toll was placed at 28 . The earthquake's energy was calculated using several different magnitude scales with an estimated moment magnitude of 7.6 and a surface wave magnitude of 7.8 . Telegraphy reports came in from a broad area of Mexico following the event, with cities from Guadalajara, Mérida (on the Yucatán Peninsula), and Tapachula (near Guatemala) all reported the tremors . The quake was centered 17°00′N 100°

Myanmar is one of the most seismically active regions in the world . Oblique subduction, block rotation, and a transform margin has been responsible for the seismic activities of the country . The Sagaing Fault is one the largest sources of earthquakes in the country, having produced deadly quakes in the past centuries . The Shan Plateau is another source of earthquakes, hosting many active strike-slip faults that accommodate block rotation of the Sunda Plate . The 2004 earthquake was the largest earthquake in Myanmar, with a magnitude of 6.0 magnitude of magnitude 9.0 in the region . The 1896 Sanriku earthquake was one of the most destructive seismic events in Japanese history . It resulted in two tsunamis which destroyed about 9,000 homes and caused at least 22,066 people dead or missing . The waves reached a then-record height of 38.2 metres (125 ft) in Ryori, Kesen, Iwate, Tōhoku . The 8.5 magnitude earthquake occurred at 19:32 (local time) on June 15, 1896, approximately 166 kilometres (103 mi) off the coast of Iwate Prefecture, Honshu . The tsunami wave reached a record height of 38.2m (125ft)in Ry

The 1966 Toro earthquake, or the 1966 Ruwenzori earthquake, occurred on March 20 at 01:42 UTC (04:42 Uganda local time) The earthquake was located near the border between Uganda and the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), to the south of Lake Albert . The earthquake had a magnitude of Mw 6.8[3]: 66  and a maximum perceived intensity of VIII (Severe) on the Mercalli intensity scale .157 people were killed in the April 18 aftershock, including 90 in the May 18 aftershap . The 1817 Santiago del Estero earthquake took place on 4 July at about 05:30 PM . It was estimated to be 7.0 on the Richter magnitude scale . The earthquake was felt with grade VIII in the Mercalli intensity scale in the provincial capital Santiago . It caused grave damage to the province of Santiago del Estero, where it was felt in the province's capital . The epicenter was at 28°00′S 64°30′W. / ﻿28.000°S 64.500°W﻿ / -28,000; -64.500; . Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The country is well known for its long history of disastrous earthquake activity . It is also known for the waste of valuable natural resources and the deaths of at least 125,000 people since 1900 . Papua New Guinea is located near the geologically-active Pacific Ring of Fire . No major damage or deaths have been reported from the earthquakes . Landslides and a dozen homes collapsed in a series of aftershocks in the past . The South American Plate is moving over the Nazca Plate at a rate of 77mm (3.0in) per year . The same process has caused the rise of the Andes mountain range and the creation of the Peru–Chile Trench, as well as volcanism in the Peruvian highlands . The oldest rocks in Peru date to the Precambrian and are more than two billion years old . Along the southern coast, granulite and charnockite shows reworking by an ancient orogeny mountain-building event . Archipelago in the western Pacific Ocean, part of Micronesia and Palau . For the island in Kiribati (Southern Line Islands), see Caroline Island . The Caroline Islands (or the Carolines) are a widely scattered archipelago of tiny islands to the north of New Guinea . Politically, they are divided between the Federated States of Micronesia in the eastern part of the group, and the extreme western end . Sakurajima is an active stratovolcano, formerly an island and now a peninsula, in Kagoshima Prefecture in Kyushu, Japan . The 1914 eruption connected it with the Ōsumi Peninsula . It is the most active volcano in Japan, with the highest elevation of 1,117m (3,665 ft) It is currently the most active volcano in the country, with its last eruption in 1955 to 2021 (Ongoing) As of April 2021, the volcanic activity still continues dropping volcanic ash on the surroundings of the surrounding area . Earlier eruptions occurred in the 1950s and 1960s, when it was an island, now an island

This list includes notable earthquakes that have affected Greece during recorded history . This list is currently incomplete, representing only a fraction of the possible events . Greece is located at the complex boundary zone in the eastern Mediterranean between the African Plate and the Aegean Sea Plate . The northern part of Greece lies on the Eurasian Plate while the southern part lies on . These two plate boundaries give rise to two contrasting tectonic styles, exten . The southern convergent boundary forms the Hellenic arc, forming the Hellen arc of the plate boundaries . The 1915 Avezzano earthquake or 1915 Fucino earthquake occurred on 13 January in central Italy at 07:52:42 local time . The shock had a moment magnitude of 6.7 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of XI (Extreme) Around 30,000 direct fatalities and $60 million in damage resulted from the earthquake . The epicenter was located in the town of Avezano (which was destroyed) in the Province of L'Aquila . The earthquake was centered near the city of Avellano in the province of L’Aquila, which was destroyed in the earthquake's epicenter . Around $60 million in damage and 29,978–32,610 dead

The 1994 Kuril Islands earthquake – also known as the Hokkaido Toho-oki earthquake – occurred on October 5 at 00:23:00 local time . The magnitude of this earthquake was put at Mw8.3, or MJMA8.1 . The epicenter was located at about 70 km east of Shikotan Island . The shaking and tsunami caused road and building damage . At least 10 people were reported dead . The earthquake was an intra-slab earthquake within the Pacific Plate which is subducting beneath the surface . The quake was caused by a subducted subduction of the Earth's Pacific Plate, and caused a tsunami of magnitude 8.3

Three earthquakes occurred off the coast of Kamchatka Peninsula in far eastern Russia in 1737, 1923 and 1952 . They were megathrust earthquakes and caused tsunamis . They occurred where the Pacific Plate subducts under the Okhotsk Plate at the Kuril–Kamchatka Trench . The depth of the trench at the point of the earthquakes is 7,000–7,500 m. There are many more earthquakes and tsunami originating from the area, of which the most recent was the 1997 Kamchatk earthquake and Tsunami originating near the Kronotsky Peninsula in 1997 . 1953 earthquake centered in the southern Ionian Islands in western Greece . The event measured 6.8 on the moment magnitude scale . It raised the whole island of Kefalonia by 60cm (24in) and caused widespread damage . The most destructive was the August 12 earthquake, which killed445–800 . In mid-August there were over 113 recorded earthquakes in the region, and the most destructive of the event was that August 12 . The earthquake was centered near the Ionian islands of the southern Greek island of the Zakyntos region, which was also known as the Great Kefaalonia . It was the first earthquake to hit the region since the 1953 Ionian earthquake .

1915 Asmara earthquake was 6.2 Mw (Mw) with a maximum perceived intensity of VI (Strong) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The event caused panic among the inhabitants and minor damage . The earthquake is described by experts as being of relatively large magnitude . It is believed to have been relatively large and caused minor damage to the Eritrea region . It was the first earthquake outside of Eritrea on September 23, 1915, with an Mw  of 6.3 Mw . The quake was the largest in the history of quakes in the region of Egypt, Arabia and the Red Sea . It took place in Eritrea in the early 1900s and caused panic

1915 Pleasant Valley earthquake occurred at 22:53:21 on October 2 in north-central Nevada . With a moment magnitude of 6.8 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of X (Extreme), it was the strongest earthquake ever recorded in the state . The earthquake remains as one of the best examples ever for evidence of fault scarps along the west side of the Tobin Range showing the fault scarp (marked by the white line) The earthquake was one of Nevada's strongest ever recorded and caused only limited damage to the area . USGS: Indonesia has had more than 150 earthquakes with magnitude > 7 in the period 1901–2017 . Six of the Top Ten strongest Indonesian earthquakes ≥ 8.3 Mw occurred near Sumatra and along the Java Trench, with six of the strongest earthquakes in the country's history occurring near the Sumatra Trench . The Philippines lies along the Pacific Ring of Fire, which causes frequent seismic and volcanic activity . Many earthquakes of smaller magnitude occur very regularly due to the meeting of major tectonic plates in the region . The largest was the 1918 Celebes Sea earthquake with Mw8.3.0 . The 1976 Moro Gulf earthquake killed 5,000–8,000 people . Largest earthquake in the Philippines was the 18th-19th-century Celebes Sea quake, the largest in the country, with a magnitude of 8.3 . The country lies on the Pacific Rim of Fire and is located near the Philippines' southern tip of the U.S.-Pacific Ocean .

Region of eastern Indonesia on the island of New Guinea . Lying to the west of Papua New Guinea, it is the only Indonesian territory situated in the region . Since Papua is alternatively named as Papua, the region is also called West Papua (Indonesian: Papua Barat) West Papua is Indonesia's western half of the island . It is also known as Papua or Indonesian New Guinea since 1962, as Indonesia has controlled the region since 1962 . The 1994 Bolivia earthquake occurred on June 9, 1994 . The epicenter was located in a sparsely populated region in the Amazon jungle, about 200 miles from La Paz . The Harvard CMT Project assigned it a focal depth of 647 km and a magnitude MW of 8.2 . It is the largest earthquake since 1977 Sumba earthquake, later superseded by more recent larger events (e.g., 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake) It is also the second largest earthquake ever recorded with a . focal depth greater than 300km, along with the 2018 Fiji earthquake, the largest currently being the 2013 Okhotsk Sea earthquake . The first documented earthquake event in Nepal dates back to 7 June 1255, during the reign of King Abhaya Malla . The quake, measuring 7.8 on the Richter scale, took the life of the king and wiped out a third of Kathmandu's then population . Nepal has witnessed at least one major earthquake per century ever since . Lenart pri Gornjem Gradu is a dispersed settlement in the hills northwest of Gornji Grad in Slovenia . The name of the settlement was changed from Sveti Lenart (literally, 'Saint Leonard') in 1955 . The area belongs to the traditional region of Styria and is now included in the Savinja Statistical Region . It is located in the Slovenian capital, Ljegegelica, and has a total of 142 residents . The 1918 Shantou earthquake occurred in Shantou, Guangdong, Republic of China . The earthquake occurred on February 13, 1918, at 14:07 in the afternoon . Serious damage and high casualty numbers were reported in Guangzhou and the surrounding provinces . It also caused some damage in what was then British Hong Kong, where the quake caused only minor damage and cracks to building . The epicenter location is believed to be centered off Nan'ao Island or about 300 km northeast of the territory of Hong Kong . The quake was centered about 23°32′N 117°14′E﻿ / ﻿23.54°N 117.24°E . The 1917 Samoa earthquake occurred on June 26 at 05:49 UTC . The epicenter was located in the southwest of the Samoan Islands . The earthquake had a magnitude of Mw 8.5, or Ms 8.4, one of the strongest earthquakes ever recorded in this region . A tsunami was triggered by the earthquake, which affected both American Samoa and German Samoa, which was then under Allied occupation . The maximum range of the tsunami in Apia was about 80 feet (40 feet) A tsunami reached a maximum of 40 feet (12 m) The earthquake was the first to trigger a tsunami in the region since the First World War II, and the second to trigger an earthquake in the

Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2 lives in the wake of the 1999 tsunami in the same year . Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . The 1917 Guatemala earthquake was a sequence of tremors that lasted from 17 November 1917 through 24 January 1918 . They almost completely destroyed Guatemala City and severely damaged the ruins in Antigua Guatemala that had survived the 1773 Guatemala earthquakes . 250 people were killed in the earthquake, mostly in Guatemala City . The seismic activity started on November 17, 1917 and ruined several settlements around Amatitlán . Aftershocks occurred on 25 and 29 December of the same year, and on January 25, 1917 . The earthquake was centered 15°19′N 89°06′W.1°W﻿ / ﻿15.32°N 89.32 ; -89.32;

The 1918 Shantou earthquake occurred in Shantou, Guangdong, Republic of China . The earthquake occurred on February 13, 1918, at 14:07 in the afternoon . Serious damage and high casualty numbers were reported in Guangzhou and the surrounding provinces . It also caused some damage in what was then British Hong Kong, where the quake caused only minor damage and cracks to building . The 1852 Banda Sea earthquake struck on 26 November, 1852 at 07:40 local time, affecting coastal communities on the Banda Islands . The earthquake had an estimated moment magnitude of 7.5 or 8.4 to 8.8 . It caused violent shaking lasting five minutes, and was assigned IX on the Modified Mercalli intensity scale in the Maluku Islands . A tsunami measuring up to 8 meters slammed into the islands of Banda Neira, Saparua, Haruku and Ceram . The tsunami caused major damage, washing away many villages, ships and residents . The event produced extreme ground motions reaching causing severe ground effects . Sangkulirang-Mangkalihat Karst is a karstique area in Sub Kelay, Biatan, Talisayan, Batu Putih, and Biduk-biduk Berau districts of East Kalimantan province on the island of Borneo in Indonesia . It covers an area of 105,000 hectares, including the Mangkalahat Peninsula . It has been nominated for inclusion in the UNESCO World Heritage Site list in May 2015 . Carnot is located in the south west of the Central African Republic, in the prefecture of Mambéré-Kadéï . It has a population of 54,551 (2012 census), making it the fourth largest city in CAR by population . The city takes its name as a tribute to the assassinated French President Sadi Carnot . The region lacks a functioning health service and is affected by an extremely high mortality rate and a high disease burden of malaria, HIV and tuberculos . The 1921 Sevier Valley earthquake was a series of three earthquakes . The primary quake was a magnitude Mw6.3 earthquake that occurred on Thursday, 29 September 1921 at approximately 7:12 AM MT in Elsinore, Utah, United States . No people were killed in the quake or in the subsequent aftershocks . The first aftershock occeured in the evening on the same day, and the second aftershock occurred two days later on 1 October . This quake was preceded by sev.1 earthquake, which struck on September 29 September 21, 1921, lasting for 7–10 seconds . The 1897 Mindanao earthquakes occurred on September 20, 1897 and September 21, 1897 . The earthquakes were originally given estimated magnitudes of 8.6 and 8.7 on the surface wave magnitude scale by Charles Richter . The estimated epicentres of the two earthquakes are identical, lying just off the southwestern coast of Mindanaos in the Philippines, south of Basilan island . With few exceptions, all the masonry buildings in Zamboanga and Basilan were left in ruins.[4] Both earthquakes triggained a magnitude of 7.4 and 7.5 Ms, respectively, and both were reported to have been very strong or very strong . Serbia is in recent geologic time a part of the Eurasian Plate, but the bedrock lithologies are witness to a diverse geologic history . In a tectonic sense, Serbia is part of an orogenic system that is composed of the Alpine, Carpathian, and Dinaride belts . Its territory can be divided into five geotectonic units of differing genesis . The 2002 Hindu Kush earthquakes struck in northern Afghanistan during the month of March . At least 166 people were killed with a very large and intermediate-depth mainshock on March 3 . Three weeks later, at least a further thousand were killed during a large, but shallow aftershock that had a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong) aftershocks . The M7.4 and M6.1 reverse events were focused in the Hindu Kush mountain ra ra ra in the region of northern Afghanistan . The earthquakes struck on March 25 at 14:56, with a total of 1,000 dead, 200 injured in the aftermath of the aftershock . The reverse-earthquakes were

Only earthquakes with a magnitude of 6.0 or greater are listed, except for a few that had a moderate impact . Aftershocks are not included, unless they were of great significance or contributed to a death toll, such as the M 6.3 2011 Christchurch earthquake and the M 7.3 aftershock to the 1931 Hawke's Bay earthquake . Earthquakes occur frequently in New Zealand as the country is situated in the collision zone between the Indo-Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, part of the Pacific Basin Ring of Fire, where many earthquakes and volcanoes occur . Most events occur along the main ranges running from Fiord to Fiord, New Zealand's main fault lines .

An earthquake occurred off the northern coast of the Kamchatka Peninsula in the USSR, present-day Russia . The earthquake had a surface wave magnitude (Ms ) of 6.8 to 7.3 and an estimated moment magnitude (Mw) of 8.2 Mw[4] This event came just two months after a slightly larger Mw  8.4 earthquake, with the epicenter south of the April event, struck the area . Both earthquakes were tsunamigenic althth, and the death toll from the 1923 event was 36, with most of the victims being killed by a 30-metre-magnitude tsunami of up to 30 meters .

The 1922 Vallenar earthquake occurred with a moment magnitude of 8.5 in the Atacama Region of Chile, near the border with Argentina on 11 November at 04:32 UTC . It triggered a destructive tsunami that caused significant damage to the coast of Chile and was observed as far away as Australia . The earthquake took place along the boundary between the Nazca and South American tectonic plates, at a location where they converge at a rate of seventy millimeters a year . Chile has been at a convergent plate boundary th since the earthquake occurred at a time when the plates converged at a convergence rate of 70 millimeters per year . The quake triggered a tsunami that killed several hundred people

Papua New Guinea is located near the geologically-active Pacific Ring of Fire . No major damage or deaths have been reported from the earthquakes . The 1924 Pasinler earthquake occurred at 16:34 local time on 13 September . It had a surface wave magnitude of 6.8 and reached a maximum felt intensity of IX (Violent) on the Mercalli intensity scale . 60 people were killed in the earthquake, mostly in Erzurum, Eastern Anatolia Region of Turkey . The earthquake was the first in the history of the world's largest quakes, with 6.4 magnitude . It was the second in a series of quakes in the region, with the largest in the world, occurring in the 1920s and 1930s . It is the first earthquake in Turkey to occur in the series of earthquakes in the last century .

On January 23, 2018, at 00:31 AKST, an earthquake occurred in the Gulf of Alaska near Kodiak Island . The 1645 Luzon earthquake was one of the most destructive earthquakes to hit the Philippines . It occurred on November 30 at about 08:00 PM local time on Luzon Island in the northern part of the country . The island was struck by a 7.5 Ms tremor produced by the San Manuel and Gabaldon Faults (Nueva Ecija) in the central section of the island . Aftershocks continued a few days, then on December 4 at 11:00 pm, another event (allegedly equal or stronger than November 30) hit the area, causing further death and destruction . 1925 Dali earthquake occurred at 14:42 UTC on 16 March . It had an estimated magnitude of 7.0 on the surface wave magnitude scale and a maximum perceived intensity of at least IX (Violent) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The quake occurred in a tectonically complex zone affected by the ongoing collision between the Indian Plate and the Eurasian Plate . 226 BC is most often cited as the date of the quake, but sources variously cite 226 or 227 BC as dates when it occurred . The island of Rhodes lies on part of the boundary between the Aegean Sea and African plates . It is undergoing a counter-clockwise rotation (17°±5° in the last 800,000 years) associated with the south Aegeans sinistral strike-slip fault system . Following the earthquake, the Colossus of Rhodes lay in place for nearly eight centuries before being sold off by invaders . The Macquarie Fault Zone is a major right lateral-moving transform fault along the seafloor of the south Pacific Ocean . It is also the tectonic plate boundary between the Indo-Australian Plate to the northwest and the Pacific Plate . The fault zone includes a component of convergence which increases as it approaches the South Island of New Zealand . Many researchers conclude that the fault zone here is an incipient subduction zone, with oblique motion corresponding to the transition from lateral (strike-slip) motion to oblique (strike) motion . Region of eastern Indonesia on the island of New Guinea . Lying to the west of Papua New Guinea, it is the only Indonesian territory situated in the region . It is also known as Papua or Indonesian New Guinea since 1962, as Indonesia has controlled the region since 1962 . 1927 Crimean earthquakes occurred in the month of June and again in September in the waters of the Black Sea near the Crimean Peninsula . Each of the submarine earthquakes in the sequence triggered tsunami . The June event was moderate relative to the large September 11 event, which had at least one aftershock that also generated a tsunami . Natural gas that was released from the sea floor created flames that were visible along the co-section of the surface of the seabed floor . The 1927 Crimean earthquake killed 12 people and triggered a tsunami in the area of Yalta, Crimea, in the wake of the June event, and the September 11 aftershocks were foreshocks of 6.0 and 4.9

The 1927 Jericho earthquake shook Mandatory Palestine and Transjordan on July 11 at 15:04 local time . The epicenter of the earthquake was in the northern area of the Dead Sea . The cities of Jerusalem, Jericho, Ramle, Tiberias, and Nablus were heavily damaged and at least 287 were estimated to have been killed . At least 500 people were killed in the event, mostly in the region of Mandatory Palestine, and the Emirate of Transjord . The earthquake was a magnitude of 6.3 Mw and depth of 15km (9.3 mi) It was the largest earthquake ever recorded in the history of the world's history of quakes and quakes

The 1927 North Tango earthquake occurred in Kyoto Prefecture on 7 March with a moment magnitude of 7.0 . Up to 2,956 people were killed and 7,806 were injured . Almost all the houses in Mineyama (now part of Kyōtango) were destroyed as a result . The earthquake was felt as far away as Tokyo and Kagoshima as far as Tokyo . The quake was felt 11.3m (37ft) in Japan, with the depth of 10km (6mi) It was the first earthquake to hit Japan since the Great Depression in the mid-1940s . An earthquake occurred off the northern coast of the Kamchatka Peninsula in the USSR, present-day Russia . The earthquake had a surface wave magnitude (Ms ) of 6.8 to 7.3 and an estimated moment magnitude (Mw) of 8.2 Mw[4] This event came just two months after a slightly larger Mw  8.4 earthquake, with the epicenter south of the April event, struck the area . Both earthquakes were tsunamigenic althth, and the death toll from the 1923 event was 36, with most of the victims being killed by a 30-metre-magnitude tsunami of up to 30 meters .

The 1929 Grand Banks earthquake occurred on November 18, 1929 . The shock had a moment magnitude of 7.2 and a maximum Rossi–Forel intensity of VI (Strong tremor) The shock was centered in the Atlantic Ocean off the south coast of Newfoundland in the Laurentian Slope Seismic Zone . Total damage was $400,000 ($5.6 million in 2017) and 27 or 28 people were killed in the earthquake and tsunami . The 2017 Puebla earthquake struck at 13:14 CDT (18:14 UTC) on 19 September 2017 with an estimated magnitude of Mw7.1 and strong shaking for about 20 seconds . Its epicenter was about 55 km (34 mi) south of the city of Puebla . 370 people were killed and 6,011 were injured in the earthquake . The earthquake caused damage in Mexico and in the Greater Mexico City area, including the collapse of more than 40 buildings.[3] 370 people died in the disaster, including 6,000 injured and 370 were trapped in the region of Mexico City . 1928 Talca earthquake occurred on 1 December at 00:06 local time near Curepto, Maule Region, Chile . In Talca there were 108 dead, 67 in Constitución, and 50 in the surrounding villages . Damage was widespread in the Chilean Central Valley, and in the following cities: Talca, Curicó and San Fernando . Aftershocks were followed by severe damage on the coast from Cauquenes to Pichilemu, and severe damage in Talca and the surrounding areas . The quake lasted 1 minute 45 seconds, with a magnitude of 7.6 MW[3] 8.3 MS[1] and 7.9 ML[4]

Myanmar is one of the most seismically active regions in the world . Oblique subduction, block rotation, and a transform margin has been responsible for the seismic activities of the country . The Sagaing Fault is one the largest sources of earthquakes in the country, having produced deadly quakes in the past centuries . The Shan Plateau is another source of earthquakes, hosting many active strike-slip faults that accommodate block rotation of the Sunda Plate . The 2004 earthquake was the largest earthquake in Myanmar, with a magnitude of 6.0 magnitude of magnitude 9.0 in the region . The 1946 earthquake occurred near the Aleutian Islands, Alaska on April 1 . The shock had a moment magnitude of 8.6 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VI (Strong) It resulted in 165–173 casualties and over $26 million in damage . The seafloor along the fault was elevated, triggering a Pacific-wide tsunami with multiple destructive waves at heights from 45–130ft . The tsunami obliterated the Scotch Cap Lighthouse on Unimak Island, Alaska among others, and killed all five lighthouse keepers, including all five keepers . The earthquake killed five people and destroyed over $25 million worth of goods and damaged the coast of Alaska and Hawaii . The quake was

This list is a global list of notable earthquakes that occurred in the 20th century . After 1900 most earthquakes have some degree of instrumental records and this means that the locations and magnitudes are more reliable than for earlier events . To prevent this list becoming unmanageable, only those of magnitude 6 and above are included unless they are notable for some other reason . Earthquakes of magnitude 8.0 and greater from 1900 to 2018 are included in the list . The apparent 3D volumes of the bubbles are linearly proportional to their respective fatalities . The 1949 Queen Charlotte Islands earthquake struck the Pacific Northwest coast at 8:01 p.m. PDT on August 21, 1949 . The shock had a surface wave magnitude of 8.1 and a maximum Mercalli Intensity of VIII (Severe) It ruptured along the Queen Charlotte Fault both northward and southward more than 500 km (311 mi) Shaking was felt throughout British Columbia, parts of Washington, Oregon, Alberta, Alberta and the Yukon . Aftershocks were felt in British Columbia and parts of Oregon, Washington and Alberta, Yukon, Canada, and British Columbia . Tsunami was 2.61m (2ft 0in) [1]

The Hinatuan Enchanted River is a deep spring river on Mindanao in the Philippines . It flows into the Philippine Sea and the Pacific Ocean at its mouth . It earned the moniker "enchanted river" from the diplomat Modesto Farolan who described the river in his poem entitled "Rio Encantado" The river's mouth also offers a safe anchorage against storms and typhoons . It is found between the boundaries of Barangays of Talisay and Cambatong in the province of Surigao del Sur . Only earthquakes with a magnitude of 6.0 or greater are listed, except for a few that had a moderate impact . Aftershocks are not included, unless they were of great significance or contributed to a death toll, such as the M 6.3 2011 Christchurch earthquake and the M 7.3 aftershock to the 1931 Hawke's Bay earthquake . Earthquakes occur frequently in New Zealand as the country is situated in the collision zone between the Indo-Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, part of the Pacific Basin Ring of Fire, where many earthquakes and volcanoes occur . Most events occur along the main ranges running from Fiord to Fiord, New Zealand's main fault lines .

Bahram Akasheh is an Iranian geophysicist and seismologist . He is considered one of Iran's leading experts on earthquakes and seismic activity . He has stressed the importance of science and technology and the extent to which the effects of a potential disaster can be curbed . He also expressed a disagreement and disapproval with the notion in Iran that natural disasters are God given and that natural disaster is God's given . He said: "Earthquake education is very poor in Iran. Most people think that whatever God wills, will happen. This is absolutely wrong. This thinking is poisonous. 1906 Aleutian Islands earthquake occurred at 00:11 UTC on August 17 . It had an estimated seismic moment of 3.8 x 1028 dyn cm−1, equivalent to a magnitude of 8.35 on the moment magnitude scale . China has been the location of some of the most deadly earthquakes in history . Hundreds of thousands of people were killed by magnitude 8.0 earthquakes in 1303 in Hongdong and 1556 in Shaanxi . The 1930 Bago earthquake struck Burma on May 5 with a surface wave magnitude between 7.2 and 7.5 Ms’s . The earthquake was one of the most destructive to hit the country, and one of many earthquakes to affect the country between 1929 and 1931 . Extensive damage was reported in the southern part of the country . The 1931 Fuyun earthquake occurred on August 10 at 21:18 UTC . It was a Mw 8.0 earthquake with a surface rupture of 171 km along the Koktokay-Ertai fault zone . The rupture was caused by right-lateral strike-slip movement with normal component . Casualties from the earthquake were 10,000, with a maximal horizontal displacement of 14 m[5] The rupture is well preserved and becomes one of the main features of the Kokkokay National Geopark (可可托海-二台断裂带) located in Koktukay . The 2009 West Java earthquake occurred on September 2 at 14:55:01 local time in West Java, Indonesia . The magnitude 7.0 earthquake killed at least 79 people, injured over 1,250, and displaced over 210,000 . It was Indonesia's deadliest earthquake since the 2006 Pangandaran earthquake and tsunami . The quake was felt in the capital Jakarta, although damage there was minimal . The earthquake's focus lies close to the coast of Java, but damage was minimal, and damage to the city was minimal in Jakarta . The tsunami was 20cm wide . The death toll from the earthquake was 79 people; more than 140,000 people were displaced in Tasikmalaya regency

The Assam earthquake of 1897 occurred on 12 June 1897, in Assam, India at 11:06[2] UTC, and had an estimated moment magnitude of 8.2-8.3[1] It resulted in approximate 1,542 human casualties and caused catastrophic damage to infrastructure . Trembles were felt across India, reaching as far as Ahmedabad and Peshawar . Seiches were also observed in Burma and Burma . Damage from the earthquake extended into Calcutta, where dozens of buildings were severely damaged, with some buildings partially collapsing . The 1933 Long Beach earthquake took place on March 10 at 5:54 P.M. PST south of downtown Los Angeles . The epicenter was offshore, southeast of Long Beach, California, on the Newport–Inglewood Fault . The earthquake had a magnitude estimated at 6.4 Mw, with a depth of 10km (6.2 mi) Total damage was $40 million, with 115–120 people killed in the earthquake . The quake was the second on the same fault on Oct 2 1933, when a magnitude of M5.4 was recorded in the same place in October 1933 . The 1931 Fuyun earthquake occurred on August 10 at 21:18 UTC . It was a Mw 8.0 earthquake with a surface rupture of 171 km along the Koktokay-Ertai fault zone . The rupture was caused by right-lateral strike-slip movement with normal component . Casualties from the earthquake were 10,000, with a maximal horizontal displacement of 14 m[5] The rupture is well preserved and becomes one of the main features of the Kokkokay National Geopark (可可托海-二台断裂带) located in Koktukay . Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . Myanmar is one of the most seismically active regions in the world . Oblique subduction, block rotation, and a transform margin has been responsible for the seismic activities of the country . The Sagaing Fault is one the largest sources of earthquakes in the country, having produced deadly quakes in the past centuries . The Shan Plateau is another source of earthquakes, hosting many active strike-slip faults that accommodate block rotation of the Sunda Plate . The 2004 earthquake was the largest earthquake in Myanmar, with a magnitude of 6.0 magnitude of magnitude 9.0 in the region . Cuba is located in an area with several active fault systems which produce on average about 2000 seismic events each year . The island has been struck by a number of destructive earthquakes over the past four centuries, including several major quakes with a magnitude of 7.0 or above . 70% of seismic activity in Cuba emanates from the Oriente fault zone, located in the Bartlett-Cayman fault system which runs along the south-eastern coast of Cuba and marks the tectonic boundary between the North American Plate and the Caribbean Plate . The 1953 Suva earthquake occurred on 14 September at 00:26 UTC near Suva, Fiji, just off the southeast shore of Viti Levu . This earthquake had an estimated magnitude of Ms 6.8 and Mw 6.4 . The earthquake triggered a coral reef platform collapse and a submarine landslide that caused a tsunami . Eight people were reported killed; a wharf, bridges, and buildings were severely damaged in Suva . Fiji lies in a complex tectonic setting along the boundary between the Australian Plate and the Pacific Plate . The 1985 Mexico City earthquake struck in the early morning of 19 September at 07:17:50 (CST) with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a maximal Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent) The event caused serious damage to the Greater Mexico City area and the deaths of at least 5,000 people . Aftershocks 7.5 Mw’s were followed by 7.0 Mw aftershocks 30 April 1986 . The 2011 Puebla earthquake was the first major earthquake to hit Mexico City in the country since the 1985 earthquake occurred near Mexico City . The 1932 Jalisco earthquakes began on June 3 at 10:36 UTC with a megathrust event that registered 8.1 on the moment magnitude scale . With a maximum perceived intensity of X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale, at least 400 deaths were caused in Mexico and neighboring Guatemala . It was the first of a series of seismic events that affected parts of western Mexico during the month of June 1932, all reaching magnitude 7 or greater . The Mexican subduction zone, the Middle America Trench, is seismically active and has generated both destructive and non-destructive tsunamis . At least 400 people were killed by the 1932 earthquakes, most of them in Guatemala and Mexico .

1932 Cedar Mountain earthquake was one of the largest seismic events in the US state of Nevada . The 7.2 magnitude earthquake struck at the base of Cedar Mountain in Western Nevada . Shaking from this earthquake was felt as far as Oregon, Southern California, and the Rocky Mountains area . Nevada is the third most seismically active state in the U.S. due to ongoing rifting occurring within the North American Plate . The quake was felt in the area as far away as Oregon and Southern California . The Hansel Valley Earthquake was a Mw6.6 earthquake that occurred on March 12, 1934 at approximately 8:05 a.m. MST . It was either the first or second largest recorded earthquake in Utah by magnitude . Damage to chimneys was reported in Logan, Hooper, Kelton, Kosmo, Locomotive Springs, Monument, and Snowville . The 2014 Iquique earthquake struck off the coast of Chile on 1 April, with a moment magnitude of 8.2, at 20:46 local time (23:46 UTC) The megathrust earthquake triggered a tsunami of up to 2.11 metres (6.9 ft) that hit Iququique at 21:05 local time . The earthquake was followed by a number of moderate to very large aftershocks, including a M7.7 event on 3 April . 6 people were killed and 9 people were injured in Peru, Bolivia, Chile and Peru . Total damage was 2,500 homes damaged and total damage was 3,500 more than a million people were affected .

The 2010 Baja California earthquake occurred on April 4 (Easter Sunday) with a moment magnitude of 7.2 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong) The shock originated at 15:40:41 local time (3:40 PM PDT) south of Guadalupe Victoria, Baja California, Mexico . Total damage was $1.15 billion (2010 USD) and 2–4 people were killed and 100 were injured in the earthquake . The earthquake was centered 32°08′N 115°18′W.13°N 115.30°W﻿ / 32.13; -115.30; . The 1935 Digor earthquake occurred on 1 May at Digor, Kars in the Eastern Anatolia region of Turkey . It had a moment magnitude of 6.1 and caused 540 fatalities . It was the largest earthquake in the history of the world's largest quakes in the 1930s, with 7.5 magnitude and 7.1 magnitude . The 1935 Digor earthquake occurred on 1 May, killing 540 people, in the eastern Anatolian region of the country . The 1935 Helena earthquake occurred at 22:48:02 MDT on October 18 in Montana, with an epicenter near Helena . It had a magnitude of 6.2 on the surface wave magnitude scale and a maximum perceived intensity of VIII (Severe) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The temblor was the largest of a series of earthquakes that also included a large aftershock on October 31 of magnitude 6.0 . Two people died in the mainshock and two others died as a result of the October 31 aftershock of October 31 . Much large numbers of earthquakes of smaller magnitude occur very regularly due to the meeting of major tectonic plates in the region . USGS: Indonesia has had more than 150 earthquakes with magnitude > 7 in the period 1901–2017 . Six of the Top Ten strongest Indonesian earthquakes ≥ 8.3 Mw occurred near Sumatra and along the Java Trench, with six of the strongest earthquakes in the country's history occurring near the Sumatra Trench . Colombia is a seismically active country and has a large seismic risk in many areas of its territory due to its location at the boundaries of the Malpelo, Panama, Caribbean, North Andes and South American Plates along the Pacific Ring of Fire . The southeastern and extreme eastern portions of Colombia are not as seismic active as the rest of the country . The first recorded earthquake felt in Colombia occurred on September 11, 1530, around 10:00 AM, probably with the epicentre near Cumaná, Venezuela. The 2017 Puebla earthquake struck at 13:14 CDT (18:14 UTC) on 19 September 2017 with an estimated magnitude of Mw7.1 and strong shaking for about 20 seconds . Its epicenter was about 55 km (34 mi) south of the city of Puebla . 370 people were killed and 6,011 were injured in the earthquake . The earthquake caused damage in Mexico and in the Greater Mexico City area, including the collapse of more than 40 buildings.[3] 370 people died in the disaster, including 6,000 injured and 370 were trapped in the region of Mexico City . 1938 Banda Sea earthquake occurred on February 1 with an estimated magnitude of 8.4 on the moment magnitude scale and a Rossi–Forel intensity of VII (Very strong tremor) This oblique-slip event generated destructive tsunamis of up to 1.5 metres in the region . The 1933 Sanriku earthquake caused 1,522 deaths, 1,542 missing, 12,053 people injured . The main shock occurred at 02:31 AM local time on March 3, 1933 (17:31 UTC March 2, 193 JST) The earthquake was centered offshore, 290 kilometres (180 mi) east of the city of Kamaishi, Iwate, Japan . The associated tsunami caused widespread damage, with up to 28.7m (94 ft) in Ryori, Kesen, Tōhoku . The 1994 Mindoro earthquake had a moment magnitude of 7.1 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong) It is associated with a 35 kilometer-long ground rupture, called the Aglubang River fault . Seventy eight people were reported dead and 7,566 houses were damaged . The earthquake generated a tsunami and landslides on the Verde Island Passage, a strait separating Luzon and Mindoro . The epicenter of this earthquake was located in the Ver de Island Passage . The following is a list of the prominent or destructive earthquakes occurring in the Azores, or affecting the populace of the archipelago . The list includes the 16th century Vila Franca earthquake, the 18th century "Caída da Praia" earthquake and the 20th century São Miguel earthquake . The 1998 Ribeirinha earthquake was the first major earthquake to hit the islands . The Azores are the most uninhabited region of the world, with many of the islands being located in the region . The islands have been hit by earthquakes in the past, with the most destructive being the 1837 Graciosa earthquake in 1837 and the 1852 Horta earthquake .

The 1939 Erzincan earthquake struck eastern Turkey at 1:57:23 a.m. on 27 December local time with a moment magnitude of 7.8 Mw and a maximum Mercalli intensity of XII (Extreme) It was the second most powerful earthquake recorded in Turkey, after the 1668 North Anatolia earthquake . The 1965 Rat Islands earthquake occurred at 05:01 UTC, on 4 February (19:01, 3 February local time) It had a magnitude of 8.7 and triggered a tsunami of over 10 m on Shemya Island . The Rat Islands form part of the Aleutian Islands, a chain of volcanic islands forming an island arc, that results from the subduction of the Pacific Plate beneath the North American Plate . This plate boundary, the Alaska-Alaska-Alaskan Plate boundary, is located in Alaska . The 1941 Gloria Fault earthquake occurred at 18:03:57 UTC in the northern Atlantic Ocean on 25 November 1941 . It had a magnitude of 8.0 on the moment magnitude scale and a maximum perceived intensity of IX (Violent) on the Mercalli intensity scale . It triggered a small tsunami, which was observed at Newlyn, Cornwall . It was caused by movement on the Gloria Fault, part of the Azores–Gibraltar Transform Fault, which is part of a fault that crossed the Atlantic Ocean . The 1941 Chungpu earthquake occurred with a magnitude of 7.1 on December 17, 1941 . It was the fourth-deadliest earthquake of the 20th century in Taiwan, claiming 358 lives . The earthquake struck at 03:19 local time on 17 December 1941, with a focal depth of 12 kilometres (7mi) The epicentre was in Ta, Tainan Prefecture of Taiwan under Japanese rule, and the quake was felt throughout the island . The 1994 Mindoro earthquake had a moment magnitude of 7.1 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong) It is associated with a 35 kilometer-long ground rupture, called the Aglubang River fault . The epicenter of this earthquake was located in the Ver de Island Passage . The Motagua and Chixoy-Polochic fault complex cuts across Guatemala and forms the tectonic boundary between the Caribbean plate and the North American plate . The Cocos plate pushes against the Caribbean plates, forming a subduction zone known as the Middle America Trench located approximately 50 km off Guatemala's Pacific coast . The 1942 Peru earthquake occurred on August 24 at 17:50 local time and was located near the border of the departments of Ica and Arequipa, Peru . It had a magnitude of Mw 8.2 or Ms 8.4 . This is a megathrust earthquake which ruptured part of the boundary between the Nazca Plate and the South American Plate . Much of the rupture zone of the 1942 earthquake overlapped with that of the 1996 Nazca earthquake . The rupture zone was about 40 km longer than that of that of 199 Nazca earthquakes in the same area, with a convergence vector of about 7.6 cm/yr . The 1943 Alahan Panjang earthquakes occurred on June 8 and June 9 UTC (June 9, 1943, local time) in Sumatra, then under Japanese occupation . This was an earthquake doublet (the shocks occurred at the same location on consecutive days) The first mainshock occurred June 8 at 20:42 UTC, the second on June 9 at 03:06 UTC . It ruptured the Suliti segment of the Sumatran Fault Zone . The magnitude was given as Mw  7.5[1] or Ms 7.4[5] The earthquake damaged the Indonesian city of Sumatra in the ear . The 1943 Central Java earthquake occurred on July 23 at 14:53:09 UTC with a moment magnitude of 7.0 near Java, which was under Japanese occupation . The earthquake affected the Yogyakarta depression area in Central Java . It caused about 213 deaths and over 3,900 injuries . More than 12,600 houses collapsed, causing more than 3,600 injuries . The quake affected the area between the volcanic arc of the Central Java and the Java Trench . Myanmar is one of the most seismically active regions in the world . Oblique subduction, block rotation, and a transform margin has been responsible for the seismic activities of the country . The Sagaing Fault is one the largest sources of earthquakes in the country, having produced deadly quakes in the past centuries . The Shan Plateau is another source of earthquakes, hosting many active strike-slip faults that accommodate block rotation of the Sunda Plate . The 2004 earthquake was the largest earthquake in Myanmar, with a magnitude of 6.0 magnitude of magnitude 9.0 in the region . Myanmar has also suffered tsunamis, with the 2004 earthquake being the largest tsunami in Myanmar . The country has

The 1981 Irian Jaya earthquake killed more than 300 people in Indonesia . The earthquake was recorded as a moment magnitude of 6.7 . The quake occurred in eastern Indonesia on January 19, 1981 . Indonesia is one of the most seismically active places in the world, with a subduction zone and many faults . Such earthquakes pose a significant threat to life in the area through earthquakes and also tsunamis . The 1981 earthquake was registered as a magnitude of 6.7 and registered as an earthquake at 4°35′S 139°14′E.23°E﻿ / ﻿4.58°S 139.58; 139.23 °E＼

Three earthquakes occurred off the coast of Kamchatka Peninsula in far eastern Russia in 1737, 1923 and 1952 . They were megathrust earthquakes and caused tsunamis . They occurred where the Pacific Plate subducts under the Okhotsk Plate at the Kuril–Kamchatka Trench . The depth of the trench at the point of the earthquakes is 7,000–7,500 m. There are many more earthquakes and tsunami originating from the area, of which the most recent was the 1997 Kamchatk earthquake and Tsunami originating near the Kronotsky Peninsula in 1997 . The 1944 San Juan earthquake took place in the province of San Juan, in the center-west area of Argentina, a region highly prone to seismic events . It is acknowledged as the worst natural disaster in Argentine history . The moderate to strong earthquake destroyed a large part of the provincial capital and killed 10,000 of its inhabitants, 10% of its population at the time . The earthquake occurred at 8:52 pm on 15 January 1, 1944 . One third of the province population became homeless, one third of them became homeless . The 1992 Flores earthquake and tsunami occurred on December 12 on the island of Flores in Indonesia . With a magnitude of 7.8 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe), it was the largest and also the deadliest earthquake in 1992 . At least 2,500 people were killed or missing near Flores, including 1,49 people who were missing . Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The country is well known for its long history of disastrous earthquake activity . It is also known for the waste of valuable natural resources and the deaths of at least 125,000 people since 1900 . The 1966 Toro earthquake, or the 1966 Ruwenzori earthquake, occurred on March 20 at 01:42 UTC (04:42 Uganda local time) The earthquake was located near the border between Uganda and the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), to the south of Lake Albert . The earthquake had a magnitude of Mw 6.8[3]: 66  and a maximum perceived intensity of VIII (Severe) on the Mercalli intensity scale .157 people were killed in the April 18 aftershock, including 90 in the May 18 aftershap . The 1946 earthquake occurred near the Aleutian Islands, Alaska on April 1 . The shock had a moment magnitude of 8.6 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VI (Strong) It resulted in 165–173 casualties and over $26 million in damage . The seafloor along the fault was elevated, triggering a Pacific-wide tsunami with multiple destructive waves at heights from 45–130ft . The tsunami obliterated the Scotch Cap Lighthouse on Unimak Island, Alaska among others, and killed all five lighthouse keepers, including all five keepers . The earthquake killed five people and destroyed over $25 million worth of goods and damaged the coast of Alaska and Hawaii . The quake was

The 1946 Vancouver Island earthquake struck Vancouver Island on the coast of British Columbia, Canada, on June 23 at 10:15 a.m. with a magnitude estimated at 7.0 Ms[2] and 7.5 Mw . Main shock epicenter occurred in the Forbidden Plateau area northwest of Courtenay . Shaking was felt from Portland, Oregon, to Prince Rupert, British Columbia . This is one of the most damaging earthquakes in the history of the British Columbia region, but damage was restricted because there were no heavilies . The 1946 Sagaing earthquakes (also known as the Wuntho earthquakes) struck central Burma at 15:17 local time on September 12 . The first earthquake registered a magnitude of 8.0 Mw  and was followed-up by a 7.7 Mw main shock . Both events remain some of the largest in the country since the 1762 Arakan earthquake . Both the mainshock and aftershock occurred along the Sagaing Fault; a continental transform fault boundary that links the Andaman Spreading Center to the south and the Main Himalayan Thrust to the north . It defines the boundary between the B and B of the B fault lines in Burma . The Sagaing

The 1946 Ancash earthquake in the Andes Mountains of central Peru occurred on November 10 at 17:43 UTC . The earthquake had a surface wave magnitude of 7.0 and achieved a maximum Mercalli intensity scale rating of XI (Extreme) About 1,400 Peruvians are thought to have died from the event . The quake was triggered by slippage along a normal fault at a depth of 17.0 km with a magnitude of 6.9-7.3, as suggested by the focal mechanism . The fault was a shallow crustal structure on the South American Plate, as surface ruptures were observed with a maximum offset of 3.5 meters . This event also reactivated several

Magnitude 7.5-7.6 earthquake in Kyrgyzstan was the largest in the republic since 1911 . The quake had a maximum intensity of X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale, and IX on the MSK scale . The 1946 Hsinhua earthquake was a magnitude 6.1 earthquake which hit Tainan County, Taiwan, on 5 December 1946, at 06:47 CST . The quake claimed 74 lives and was the eighth deadliest earthquake in twentieth century Taiwan . The epicentre was in Hsinhui, which is now part of Tain an area of Hainan City . The earthquake struck as people in the area were waking up and preparing breakfast on December 5, 1946, when the quake struck . It was the 8th deadliest earthquake to hit Taiwan in the history of the country's history of quakes, with 74 deaths in all three years of the same period of the 20th century .

China has been the location of some of the most deadly earthquakes in history . Hundreds of thousands of people were killed by magnitude 8.0 earthquakes in 1303 in Hongdong and 1556 in Shaanxi . The 1950 Assam–Tibet earthquake is the largest recorded earthquake in China . In 2008 the magnitude 7.9 2008 Sichuan earthquake killed more than 87,000 people . The collision of India with the rest of Asia has led to seismic activity throughout western China . However these regions in comparison with Eastern China have a low population density . Only earthquakes with a magnitude of 6.0 or greater are listed, except for a few that had a moderate impact . Aftershocks are not included, unless they were of great significance or contributed to a death toll, such as the M 6.3 2011 Christchurch earthquake and the M 7.3 aftershock to the 1931 Hawke's Bay earthquake . Earthquakes occur frequently in New Zealand as the country is situated in the collision zone between the Indo-Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, part of the Pacific Basin Ring of Fire, where many earthquakes and volcanoes occur . Most events occur along the main ranges running from Fiord to Fiord, New Zealand's main fault lines .

Colombia is a seismically active country and has a large seismic risk in many areas of its territory due to its location at the boundaries of the Malpelo, Panama, Caribbean, North Andes and South American Plates along the Pacific Ring of Fire . The southeastern and extreme eastern portions of Colombia are not as seismic active as the rest of the country . The first recorded earthquake felt in Colombia occurred on September 11, 1530, around 10:00 AM, probably with the epicentre near Cumaná, Venezuela. The 1945 Balochistan earthquake occurred in British India at 1:26 PKT on 28 November 1945 with a moment magnitude of 8.1 and a maximum perceived intensity of X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . Deaths from the event were reported to be at least 300 and as many as 4,000 people were killed in the event . The earthquake's epicenter was 97.6 kilometers south-southwest of Pasni in Balochistani and a tsunami caused damage along the Makran coastal region of British India . The 2001 southern Peru earthquake occurred at 20:33:15 UTC (15:33 local time) on June 23 with a moment magnitude of 8.4 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) The quake affected the Peruvian regions of Arequipa, Moquegua and Tacna . It was the most devastating earthquake in Peru since the catastrophic 1970 Ancash earthquake and globally the largest earthquake since the 1965 Rat Islands earthquake . The earthquake was centered in the Arequipe region of Peru and was centered 32km (20 mi) away from the city of Alquimbo . The quake killed 74–145 and injured 2,687–2,713 people .

The 1948 Litang earthquake occurred on May 28, 1948 at 07:11 UTC . It was located near Litang, China . The earthquake had a magnitude of Mw 7.2[1] or Ms 7.3[2] This earthquake caused more than 800 deaths . More than 600 houses collapsed in the areas around Litang and Daocheng . Landslides, ground fissures and sandblows occurred in the region . The intensity of the earthquake reached MM X (Extreme) and the number of aftershocks caused additional damage .
