The Hindu Kush is an 800-kilometre-long (500 mi) mountain range in Central and South Asia to the west of the Himalayas . It stretches from central and western Afghanistan into northwestern Pakistan and far southeastern Tajikistan . The range forms the western section of the Hindu Kush Himalayan Region (HKH) to the north, nea . The highest peak in the range is at 7,708 m (25,289 ft) and the highest elevation is at Tirich Mir (Pakistan) The range is located near the border of Afghanistan and Pakistan, with its highest peak being at 7,708m (26,289ft) It is

The 1949 Olympia earthquake occurred on April 13 at 11:55:44 local time with a moment magnitude of 6.7 and a maximum Mercalli Intensity of VIII (Severe) It is the largest recorded earthquake to occur in the Puget Sound region of Washington . Eight people were killed, a minimum of 64 people were injured . The shock was located in the area between Olympia and Tacoma, and was felt throughout the state, as well as parts of Oregon, British Columbia, Idaho, Idaho and Montana . Total damage of $25 million is estimated at least $1.5 million . The earthquake was the largest ever recorded earthquake in the state of Washington, killing 8 people and injuring 64 others

The 2008 Qeshm earthquake occurred on 10 September in the Hormozgān Province of southern Iran, 850 kilometres (528 mi) south of Tehran . The earthquake measured 5.9 on the moment magnitude scale and 6 on the surface wave scale, killing seven people and injuring up to 45 . Causing both catastrophic and minor damage, the earthquake devastated up to 200 villages throughout southern Iran . The epicenter was near the port city of Bandar Abbas, where an earthquake two years prior had caused damage . Citizens reportedly panicked when the earthquake hit, emptyin emptyinin the area . The port city was almost unscathed by the earthquake, leaving it almost completely untouched by the disaster

1976–2005 conflict in Indonesia is the name of the Aceh War . The conflict ended in a peaceful conclusion . The Free Aceh Movement was supported by the United States and Libyans . Aceh was given special autonomy by the UN in the Helsinki Memorandum of Understanding . The United States supported Aceh in the conflict, but not the Free Arab Jamahiriya in the 1980s . The UN sided with the Free Aidean Movement in the 1970s and 1980s, and the Dutch sided with Aceh, ending the conflict with Indonesia in the 1990s and 2000s . A total of 25,000 Indonesian troops were deployed in Aceh during the conflict. The Free A

The 1881 Chios earthquake occurred at 13:40 local time (11:30 UTC) on 3 April . It caused severe damage on the island of Chios and also affected Çeşme and Alaçatı on the coast of Turkey . The earthquake had an estimated magnitude of 7.3 and there were an estimated 7,866 casualties . The devastation from the earthquake was the last of the three 'catastrophes' that affected Chios in the 19th century . The 2006 Tonga earthquake occurred on 4 May at 04:26:35 local time with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (very strong) One injury occurred and a non-destructive tsunami was observed . The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's Pacific Tsunami Warning Center in Hawaii issued a warning 17 minutes after the earthquake for coastal areas around the Pacific . An hour later, the center downgraded the warning to only the region within 600 miles . The warning was downgraded an hour later to just a region within the region of the Pacific Ocean . Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The country is well known for its long history of disastrous earthquake activity . It is also known for the waste of valuable natural resources and the deaths of at least 125,000 people since 1900 . Iran has a history of earthquakes that have killed thousands of people and waste valuable resources in the country's natural resources, such as the Zag

The 1960 Valdivia earthquake was 9.4–9.6 on the moment magnitude scale . It occurred in the afternoon (19:11 GMT, 15:11 local time) and lasted for approximately 10 minutes . The resulting tsunamis affected southern Chile, Hawaii, Japan, the Philippines, and the Philippines . The quake was the most powerful earthquake ever recorded in the history of the Great Chilean earthquake (Gran terremoto de Chile) in 1960 . It was recorded at the time of the earthquake on 22 May 1960 in Valdivia, Chile, Punta Arenas, Iquique, Santiago and Punta Arenas . The earthquake was the largest ever recorded earthquake in the world

China has been the location of some of the most deadly earthquakes in history . Hundreds of thousands of people were killed by magnitude 8.0 earthquakes in 1303 in Hongdong and 1556 in Shaanxi . The 1950 Assam–Tibet earthquake is the largest recorded earthquake in China . In 2008 the magnitude 7.9 2008 Sichuan earthquake killed more than 87,000 people . The collision of India with the rest of Asia has led to seismic activity throughout western China . However these regions in comparison with Eastern China have a low population density . The 2013 Okhotsk Sea earthquake occurred with a moment magnitude of 8.3 at 15:44:49 local time on 24 May . It had an epicenter in the Sea of Okhotski and affected primarily (but not only) Asian Russia, especially the Kamchatka Peninsula where the shaking lasted for five minutes . The quake was not particularly intense at the surface, but was felt over a very large area . Only earthquakes with a magnitude of 6.0 or greater are listed, except for a few that had a moderate impact . Aftershocks are not included, unless they were of great significance or contributed to a death toll, such as the M 6.3 2011 Christchurch earthquake and the M 7.3 aftershock to the 1931 Hawke's Bay earthquake . Earthquakes occur frequently in New Zealand as the country is situated in the collision zone between the Indo-Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, part of the Pacific Basin Ring of Fire, where many earthquakes and volcanoes occur . Most events occur along the main ranges running from Fiord to Fiord, New Zealand's main fault lines .

The South American Plate is moving over the Nazca Plate at a rate of 77mm (3.0in) per year . The same process has caused the rise of the Andes mountain range and the creation of the Peru–Chile Trench, as well as volcanism in the Peruvian highlands . The oldest rocks in Peru date to the Precambrian and are more than two billion years old . Along the southern coast, granulite and charnockite shows reworking by an ancient orogeny mountain-building event . Colombia is a seismically active country and has a large seismic risk in many areas of its territory due to its location at the boundaries of the Malpelo, Panama, Caribbean, North Andes and South American Plates along the Pacific Ring of Fire . The southeastern and extreme eastern portions of Colombia are not as seismic active as the rest of the country . The first recorded earthquake felt in Colombia occurred on September 11, 1530, around 10:00 AM, probably with the epicentre near Cumaná, Venezuela. The first documented earthquake was documented by Gonzalo Fernández de Oviedo y Valdés in his work La Historia general de las Indias and by fri

The 1949 Ambato earthquake was the largest earthquake in the Western Hemisphere in more than five years . It struck Ecuador's Tungurahua Province southeast of its capital Ambato and killed 5,050 people . Measuring 6.4 on the Ms scale, it originated from a hypocenter 15 km[3] beneath the surface . The nearby villages of Guano, Patate, Pelileo, and Pillaro were destroyed, and the city of Ambato suffered heavy damage . The earthquake flattened buildings and subsequent landslides caused damage throughout the Tunguahua, Chimborazo, and Cotopaxi Provinces . It disrupted water mains and disrupted water supplies .

The Motagua and Chixoy-Polochic fault complex cuts across Guatemala and forms the tectonic boundary between the Caribbean plate and the North American plate . The Cocos plate pushes against the Caribbean plates, forming a subduction zone known as the Middle America Trench located approximately 50 km off Guatemala's Pacific coast . The most destructive earthquake in recent Guatemalan history was the 197-year-old earthquake in which the most destructive quake was recorded at the time of the most significant earthquake in the country's history was recorded in the 1960s and 1970s . The 1931 Oaxaca earthquake affected portions of southern Mexico on January 14 at 18:50 MST . The state lies above the convergent boundary where the Cocos Plate is being subducted below the North American Plate at a rate of 6.4 cm/yr . The Gulf of Fonseca is a part of the Pacific Ocean . It is a gulf in Central America, bordering El Salvador, Honduras, and Nicaragua . It was discovered for Europeans in 1522 by Gil González de Ávila, and named by him after his patron, Archbishop Juan Fon Seca, the implacable enemy of Columbus . The Gulf was named after Archbishop Fon seca, an opponent of Columbus, who was killed by Columbus in the 15th century . The 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami occurred at 07:28:53 in local time (UTC+7) on 26 December, with an epicentre off the west coast of northern Suma . The earthquake was also known as the Boxing Day Tsunami and, by the scientific community, the Sumatra–Andaman earthquake[10] occurred at 7.58:58:53 local time . The quake was magnitude 9.1–9.3 Mw, with a depth of 30km (19mi) and a maximum of 15 to 30m (50 to 100 ft) The tsunami killed227,898 people, mostly in Sumatra and the Andaman region of Indonesia

The 1952 Kern County earthquake occurred on July 21 in the southern San Joaquin Valley and measured 7.3 on the moment magnitude scale . The main shock occurred at 4:52 am Pacific Daylight Time (11:52 UTC) It killed 12 people and injured hundreds, and caused an estimated $60 million in property damage . A small sector of damage near Bealville corresponded with the earthquake . The earthquake was centered at 34°52′N 119°06′W (34.86°N 119.10°W) and 34°.86; -119.10; . It was the largest earthquake in the history of earthquakes in the U.S. since the Great Depression .

Three earthquakes occurred off the coast of Kamchatka Peninsula in far eastern Russia in 1737, 1923 and 1952 . They were megathrust earthquakes and caused tsunamis . They occurred where the Pacific Plate subducts under the Okhotsk Plate at the Kuril–Kamchatka Trench . The depth of the trench at the point of the earthquakes is 7,000–7,500 m. There are many more earthquakes and tsunami originating from the area, of which the most recent was the 1997 Kamchatk earthquake and Tsunami originating near the Kronotsky Peninsula in 1997 . The 1953 Torud earthquake occurred at the northeastern border of the Great Salt Kavir in Torud, Semnan, Iran on 12 February . The shock had a moment magnitude of 6.6 and had a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) At least 800 people were killed and 140 were injured in the shock . The earthquake occurred in the northeastern part of the country at a depth of 15km (9.3 mi) The shock occurred at a time of 11:45:34 on February 12, 1953 . At least 973 people died in the earthquake, including 800 people who were killed by the shock, according to the International Seismological Centre and the USGS .

The 2003 Dominican Republic earthquake occurred on September 22 at 00:45:37 local time with a moment magnitude of 6.4 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of X (Extreme) The shock occurred on the northern coast of the Dominican Republic near the town of Luperon, Puerto Plata and 40 miles (64 km) north the city of Santiago de los Caballeros . 1953 earthquake centered in the southern Ionian Islands in western Greece . The event measured 6.8 on the moment magnitude scale . It raised the whole island of Kefalonia by 60cm (24in) and caused widespread damage . The most destructive was the August 12 earthquake, which killed445–800 . In mid-August there were over 113 recorded earthquakes in the region, and the most destructive of the event was that August 12 . The earthquake was centered near the Ionian islands of the southern Greek island of the Zakyntos region, which was also known as the Great Kefaalonia . It was the first earthquake to hit the region since the 1953 Ionian earthquake .

The 1953 Suva earthquake occurred on 14 September at 00:26 UTC near Suva, Fiji, just off the southeast shore of Viti Levu . This earthquake had an estimated magnitude of Ms 6.8 and Mw 6.4 . The earthquake triggered a coral reef platform collapse and a submarine landslide that caused a tsunami . Eight people were reported killed; a wharf, bridges, and buildings were severely damaged in Suva . Fiji lies in a complex tectonic setting along the boundary between the Australian Plate and the Pacific Plate . The North Andes block moves northeastwards relative to the South America at a rate of 6±2 mm/yr . The Nazca Plate is subducting beneath the South American Plate along the Colombia-Ecuador Trench . The 1954 Adelaide earthquake had its epicentre at Darlington, a suburb of Adelaide in South Australia, some 12 km (7.5 mi) to the south of the city centre . The quake took place at 3:40 am in the early morning of 1 March 1954 and had a reported magnitude of 5.6 . An area of more than 700 km2 sustained an intensity greater than V on the Mercalli intensity scale . 16 people were injured in the quake, including 16 people who were injured by the earthquake . The earthquake took place in the middle of a tectonic plate, but South Australia is relatively stable geologically . It is believed to have been caused by a fault

A magnitude 6.8 earthquake struck Myanmar 25 km (16 mi) west of Chauk on 24 August 2016 . Tremors from the earthquake were felt in Yangon, in the eastern cities of Patna, Guwahati, and Kolkata in India, in Bangkok in Thailand and in Dhaka, the capital of Bangladesh . The earthquake struck at 5:04 local time (10:34 UTC) and was centered in an isolated area . Four people were reported dead and several temples in the nearby ancient city of Bagan were damaged and four temples were damaged . 1954 Rainbow Mountain-Fairview Peak-Dixie Valley earthquakes occurred July 6, 1954 to March 23, 1959 . The state of Nevada was struck by a series of earthquakes that began with three M 6.0+ events in July and August that preceded the M 7.3 mainshock and M.9 aftershock, both on December 12 . All five earthquakes remain some of Nevada's most significant . Tonbak is a village in Taheri Rural District, in the Central District of Kangan County, Bushehr Province, Iran . At the 2006 census, its population was 286, in 67 families . For the village in Hormozgan Province, see TonBak, Hormuzgan.village. For the same reason, "Tonbak" can be found at GEOnet Names Server, at this link, by opening the Advanced Search box, entering "3087623"  in the "Unique Feature Id" form, and clicking on "Search Database" to find the name of the village. 1954 earthquake centered on the coast of Algeria (then a colony of France) The shock measured 6.7 on the moment magnitude scale and had a maximum Mercalli intensity of XI (Extreme) It destroyed Chlef, then named Orléansville, leaving over 1,243 people dead and 5,000 injured . The 1977 Sumba earthquake occurred 290 kilometres (180 mi) south of Bima, Sumbawa, and beneath the Indian Ocean, at 14:08 local time on 19 August . With a moment magnitude of 8.3, the earthquake is notable for having an unusually great magnitude for a shock with a normal faulting focal mechanism . The shock occurred near the southern section of the Sunda Trench where several other tsunami-generating earthquakes have occurred . The earthquake was at the time the largest outer-rise earthquake ever recorded in In In Indonesia . It was also known as the Sumbaw earthquake, which killed 180 people and injured more than 1,100 people in the region .

The March 2021 Miyagi earthquake struck offshore east of Tōhoku, Japan on March 20, 2021 at 18:09 JST (09:09 UTC) The magnitude 6.9 or 7.0 earthquake struck at a depth of 54.0 kilometers (33.6 mi) to 60 kilometers (37 mi) It had a maximum JMA intensity of Shindo 5+ while on the Mercalli intensity scale, it earned a rating of VII (very strong) on Mercalli Intensity of the earthquake . The earthquake was the first to strike since the February 2021 earthquake that happened in Fukushima Prefecture, see 2021 Fukushima earthquake . It was also the first earthquake to strike in Japan

This list includes notable earthquakes that have affected Greece during recorded history . This list is currently incomplete, representing only a fraction of the possible events . Greece is located at the complex boundary zone in the eastern Mediterranean between the African Plate and the Aegean Sea Plate . The northern part of Greece lies on the Eurasian Plate while the southern part lies on . These two plate boundaries give rise to two contrasting tectonic styles, exten . The southern convergent boundary forms the Hellenic arc, forming the Hellen arc of the plate boundaries . The 1881 Nicobar Islands earthquake occurred at about 07:49 local time (01:49 UTC) on 31 December, with an epicentre beneath Car Nicobar . It occurred as two separate ruptures, the largest of which had an estimated magnitude of 7.9 on the moment magnitude scale and triggered a tsunami that was observed around the Bay of Bengal . It is probably the earliest earthquake for which rupture parameters have been estimated instrumentally . The Nicobar islands are a series of volcanic islands that are part of an active volcanic region . The largest of the ruptures was estimated to be a magnitude of 7.9 Mw . The earthquake occurred in the Andaman Islands and Andaman

The 2013 Solomon Islands earthquake struck northeast of Australia on 6 February with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) Its epicenter was the Solomon Islands, at the boundaries of the Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, causing local evacuations and a tsunami of 1.5 m (4.9 ft) and killing at least nine people . Aftershocks were also felt in the region, with a total of 20 aftershocks of around 20,000 occurring during the event . The Santa Maria earthquake was the largest earthquake ever recorded in Oceania, killing 9 people and injuring 5 others, killing 5 and injuring 17 .

The 1955 Alexandria earthquake occurred on September 12 at 06:09 UTC . The epicenter was located in the eastern Mediterranean, offshore of Alexandria, Egypt . The earthquake had a magnitude of Ms 6.3, causing 18 deaths and 89 injuries . Damage was reported in the Nile Delta between Alexandria and Cairo . About 300 adobe houses were badly damaged around Lake Idku . 40 houses completely collapsed and about 420 houses ruined.[4] The earthquake could also be felt in Cyprus, Palestine, Syria, Greece, and Cyprus, Syria and Egypt . It was the first major earthquake in Egypt to occur in the country since 1959 . It caused 18 deaths, with 89 injuries, with 40 houses collapsed and 40 houses

Papua New Guinea is located near the geologically-active Pacific Ring of Fire . No major damage or deaths have been reported from the earthquakes . Landslides and a dozen homes collapsed in a series of aftershocks in the past . No tsunami has been reported in the region since the 2002-02-09 Sandaun Province, New Ireland, 2002-09-09Sandaun Province 7.6 Mw470Tsunami (local) Tsunami was reported in 2002-01-10 . The 1957 Guerrero earthquake occurred on 28 July at 08:40 UTC . It had a magnitude of 7.6 Mw and a maximum perceived intensity of VII (very strong) on the Modified Mercalli intensity scale . Mexico City and Chilpancingo were particularly badly affected . The 1956 Nicaragua earthquake occurred on October 24 at 14:42 UTC . The epicenter was located west of Masachapa, Managua Department, Nicaragua . It was an earthquake of magnitude Ms 7.3[3] or Mw 7.2 . Building damage was reported in the area . A tsunami was triggered by the earthquake, which triggered by a tsunami, was also triggered by an earthquake in the 1950s . The earthquake was the largest in the history of the Nicaraguan earthquake, with a depth of 25 km (Mw7.2) Building damage and building damage were reported in Nicaragua's capital, the largest earthquake ever recorded in the country's history of earthquakes in 1956 .

Ilirska Bistrica (pronounced [iˈliːɾska ˈbiːstɾitsa] (listen) is a town in the Inner Carniola region of Slovenia . The area is 34.8 km2 (13.4 sq mi) and has a population of 4,539 vehicles registered with KP climateCfb . The town is located in the traditional region of Littoral–Inner Carniola, and is known as Ilirska Bistrica in the Slovenian capital of Ljegegegelija, but it is also known as a tourist destination in the Slovenia .

Only earthquakes with a magnitude of 6.0 or greater are listed, except for a few that had a moderate impact . Aftershocks are not included, unless they were of great significance or contributed to a death toll, such as the M 6.3 2011 Christchurch earthquake and the M 7.3 aftershock to the 1931 Hawke's Bay earthquake . Earthquakes occur frequently in New Zealand as the country is situated in the collision zone between the Indo-Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, part of the Pacific Basin Ring of Fire, where many earthquakes and volcanoes occur . Most events occur along the main ranges running from Fiord to Fiord, New Zealand's main fault lines .

The 1956 Chim earthquake was a destructive multiple-shock event that occurred on March 16 in Lebanon along a strand of the Dead Sea Transform (DST) fault system . The epicenter was located in the south of Lebanon in the Chouf District . Six thousand homes were destroyed and another 17,000 were damaged . The number of persons killed was 136 . The DST is a 1,609 km (1,000 mi) long transform fault that runs in a mostly north-south direction from the northern end of the Red Sea along the Jordan Rift Valley to the Taurus Mountains complex in southern Turkey . 1956 earthquake and tsunami centered near the Greek island of Amorgos . It was the largest earthquake in Greece in the 20th century . It had a magnitude of 7.7 on the moment magnitude scale and a maximum perceived intensity of IX on the Mercalli intensity scale . The earthquake was followed by a magnitude 7.2 earthquake near Santorini 13 minutes later . The epicentre was to the south of the island of Amorgos, the easternmost island of the Cyclades in the Aegean Sea . There was significant damage on the island and the neighbouring island of Sotorini . The quake was the second largest in Greece since the 1950s and the third largest in

The 1956 Sagaing earthquake occurred on July 16, 1956, at 15:07 UTC . The earthquake was located near Sagaing, Burma . It had a magnitude of Mw 7.1 . Thirty-eight people died because of the earthquake . Several pagodas, including the Mingun Pagoda, were severely damaged . The intensity reached MM VIII to MM IX (Violent) near the epicenter . The focal mechanism remains undetermined, but the focal mechanism is still undetermined . The magnitude reached Mw VIII to EF (EF) and EF (FIVE) The earthquake occurred near the Shan-Sagaing Fault, close to the Burma-Myanmar fault line.[2]

The 1956 Anjar earthquake occurred at 15:32 UTC on 21 July, causing maximum damage in town of Anjar in Kutch, Gujarat, India . It had an estimated magnitude of 6.1 on the surface wave magnitude scale and a maximum perceived intensity of IX on the Mercalli intensity scale . The epicenter of the earthquake of 21 July 1956 was at somewhere between Anjar and Bhadresar, very close to that of 1819 Kutch earthquake, between 50 and 120 km away . The 1556 Shaanxi earthquake, or Huaxian earthquake, is the deadliest earthquake in recorded history . It occurred on the morning of 23 January 1556, during the Ming dynasty . According to imperial records, approximately 830,000 people lost their lives . The earthquake was the deadliest ever recorded event in the history of the world . It was the 12th day of the 12 month of the year Jiajing 34 in Chinese calendar, when the earthquake occurred . The quake was magnitude 8.0m (MW) and the depth of the quake was unknown . The area was affected by the earthquake, and the area was largely uninhabited by modern-day Shaanx province .

The 1957 Andreanof Islands earthquake took place on March 9 with a moment magnitude of 8.6 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) The event occurred along the Aleutian Trench, the convergent plate boundary that separates the Pacific Plate and the North American Plates near Alaska . A basin wide tsunami followed, with effects felt in Alaska and Hawaii . Total losses of $5 million were estimated to have been around $5million . The earthquake occurred south of the Andrean of Islands group, which is part of the Aleutian Islands arc, and occurred along a convergent fault boundary . Region of eastern Indonesia on the island of New Guinea . Lying to the west of Papua New Guinea, it is the only Indonesian territory situated in the region . Since Papua is alternatively named as Papua, the region is also called West Papua (Indonesian: Papua Barat) West Papua is Indonesia's western half of the island . It is also known as Papua or Indonesian New Guinea since 1962, as Indonesia has controlled the region since 1962 . Largest cities Jayapura, Sorong, Manokwari, Merauke, Timika and Wamena are located in Indonesia's West Papua Province, West Papua, as well as West Irian Jaya and West Papua .

Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The country is well known for its long history of disastrous earthquake activity . It is also known for the waste of valuable natural resources and the deaths of at least 125,000 people since 1900 . The 1957 Mongolia earthquake occurred on December 4 . Subsidence, faulting and fissures occurred in the Bahar Uula and Ih Bogd Uul Mountains . The largest fissure was 250 km (160 mi) long with as much as 9–11 m (30–36 ft) of vertical and 3 m (9.8 ft) of horizontal offset . The earthquake resulted in thirty deaths, and the destruction of all houses in Dzun Bogd and Bayan Gobi . This is perhaps the least damaging great earthquake to have occurred on land in the 20th century . Because of the extremely sparse population in the area, this is . perhaps the

Colombia is a seismically active country and has a large seismic risk in many areas of its territory due to its location at the boundaries of the Malpelo, Panama, Caribbean, North Andes and South American Plates along the Pacific Ring of Fire . The southeastern and extreme eastern portions of Colombia are not as seismic active as the rest of the country . The first recorded earthquake felt in Colombia occurred on September 11, 1530, around 10:00 AM, probably with the epicentre near Cumaná, Venezuela . The earthquake was documented by Gonzalo Fernández de Oviedo y Valdés and by friar Bartolomé de las Casas

The 1958 Lituya Bay earthquake occurred on July 9 at 22:15:58 with a moment magnitude of 7.8 to 8.3 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of XI (Extreme) The strike-slip earthquake took place on the Fairweather Fault and triggered a tsunami of524 m (1,720 ft) runup . The earthquake was the first off the Alaska coast to trigger a tsunami, which triggered a landslide of 1,720 m (524 ft) in the area . The quake was the largest in the history of geologic events off the coast of the Alaskan Peninsula . It was the second such event to trigger an earthquake in the region in the past .

The 1963 Kuril Islands earthquake occurred at 05:17 UTC, on October 13, 1963 . The earthquake had a magnitude of 8.5 and was followed by a Mw 7.8 event seven days later . Both earthquakes triggered tsunamis that were observed around the northern part of the Pacific Ocean . The Kuril islands form part of an island arc formed above the subduction zone, where the Pacific Plate is being subducted beneath the Eurasian Plate . This convergent boundary has been the site of many large megathrust earthquakes, including the 1963 Kuril Islands earthquake and the Soviet Union . The Soviet Union was the only country affected by the earthquake .

The 1953 Tumbes earthquake occurred on December 12 at 12:31:29 local time near the border between Peru and Ecuador . The shock had a moment magnitude of 7.5, a maximum Mercalli Intensity of VIII (Severe) The shock occurred in the northwestern offshore area of Tumbas, Peru . The North Andes block moves northeastwards relative to the South America at a rate of 6±2 mm/yr . The Nazca Plate is subducting beneath the South American Plate along the Colombia-Ecuador Trench . The subduction of the Carnegie Ridge into the Colombia and Ecuador Trench affececeses is a region of large crustal deformation

The 1959 Hengchun earthquake struck the southern tip of Taiwan on August 15 with a Richter magnitude 7.1 . It was the tenth deadliest earthquake in twentieth century Taiwan, killing 16 or 17 people . The shock had a focal depth of 20 kilometres (12 mi) The earthquake occurred at 16:57 CST on Saturday 15 August 1959, with an epicentre 50 kilometres (31 mi) east-southeast of Cape Eluanbi . The 1959 Hebgen Lake earthquake measured 7.2 on the Moment magnitude scale . The earthquake caused a huge landslide, resulted in over 28 fatalities and left US$11 million (equivalent to $97.66 million in 2020) in damage . The slide blocked the flow of the Madison River, resulting in the creation of Quake Lake . Quake Lake is now located 15 miles north of West Yellowstone, Montana, United States. Quake Lake was created in 1959 . Quake lake is now known as Quake Lake in Montana, Idaho, Wyoming, Idaho and Wyoming . Chuquibamba (Quechua: Chuqipampa, chuqi means "ore" and pampa means "plain") is a town in southern Peru, capital of the province Condesuyos in the region Arequipa . It is the location of the high school Colegio Nacional San Luis Gonzaga which is over 100 years old . The population of the town is 3,066 according to the 2005 census . The town is the seat of the Territorial Prelature of Chuqibamba, which is located in the Peruvian city of Arequipe . The mayor is Miguel Angel Manchego Llerena, who is also the

The South American Plate is moving over the Nazca Plate at a rate of 77mm (3.0in) per year . The same process has caused the rise of the Andes mountain range and the creation of the Peru–Chile Trench, as well as volcanism in the Peruvian highlands . The oldest rocks in Peru date to the Precambrian and are more than two billion years old . Along the southern coast, granulite and charnockite shows reworking by an ancient orogeny mountain-building event . The 1960 Valdivia earthquake was 9.4–9.6 on the moment magnitude scale . It occurred in the afternoon (19:11 GMT, 15:11 local time) and lasted for approximately 10 minutes . The resulting tsunamis affected southern Chile, Hawaii, Japan, the Philippines, and the Philippines . The quake was the most powerful earthquake ever recorded in the history of the Great Chilean earthquake (Gran terremoto de Chile) in 1960 . It was recorded at the time of the earthquake on 22 May 1960 in Valdivia, Chile, Punta Arenas, Iquique, Santiago and Punta Arenas . The earthquake was the largest ever recorded earthquake in the world

Papua New Guinea is located near the geologically-active Pacific Ring of Fire . No major damage or deaths have been reported from the earthquakes . Landslides and a dozen homes collapsed in a series of aftershocks in the past . No tsunami has been reported in the region since the 2002-02-09 Sandaun Province, New Ireland, 2002-09-09Sandaun Province 7.6 Mw470Tsunami (local) Tsunami was reported in 2002-01-10 . No deaths or major damage were reported in any of the recent quakes in Papua New Guinean . The region is located in the Pacific Ocean and is part of the Pacific Rim of Fire

Three earthquakes occurred off the coast of Kamchatka Peninsula in far eastern Russia in 1737, 1923 and 1952 . They were megathrust earthquakes and caused tsunamis . They occurred where the Pacific Plate subducts under the Okhotsk Plate at the Kuril–Kamchatka Trench . The depth of the trench at the point of the earthquakes is 7,000–7,500 m. There are many more earthquakes and tsunami originating from the area, of which the most recent was the 1997 Kamchatk earthquake and Tsunami originating near the Kronotsky Peninsula in 1997 . The 1960 Valdivia earthquake (Spanish: Terremoto de Valdivia) was the most powerful earthquake ever recorded . Various studies have placed it at 9.4–9.6 on the moment magnitude scale . It occurred in the afternoon (19:11 GMT, 15:11 local time) and lasted for approximately 10 minutes . The resulting tsunamis affected southern Chile, Hawaii, Japan, the Philippines, and the Philippines . There were 1,000–6,000 casualties and up to 25 m (82 ft) of landlides and landslides . The earthquake was the largest in the history of the world's most powerful quakes, with the greatest number of quakes ever recorded

The 1896 Sanriku earthquake was one of the most destructive seismic events in Japanese history . It resulted in two tsunamis which destroyed about 9,000 homes and caused at least 22,066 people dead or missing . The waves reached a then-record height of 38.2 metres (125 ft) in Ryori, Kesen, Iwate, Tōhoku . The 8.5 magnitude earthquake occurred at 19:32 (local time) on June 15, 1896, approximately 166 kilometres (103 mi) off the coast of Iwate Prefecture, Honshu . The tsunami wave reached a record height of 38.2m (125ft)in Ry

The Huaraz Province is one of twenty provinces of the Ancash Region in Peru . It was created on August 5, 1857 during the presidency of Ramón Castilla . Geographically, the province is located over the Callejón de Huaylas and the western slopes of the Cordillera Negra . The Regional Museum of Archaeology – known as the biggest lithic museum in South America – is located here . The Pumacayán hill, the hot springs of Monterrey and the Willkawayin ruins, are also highlights of the province . There is also a Museu Museu de Historia - known as "Museu de Mautino

The 1964 Niigata earthquake struck at 13:01 local time (04:01 UTC) on 16 June with a magnitude of either 7.5 or 7.6 . The epicenter was on the continental shelf off the northwest coast of Honshu, Japan . The earthquake caused liquefaction over large parts of the city, killing 36 people and injuring more than 400 . The quake was centered about 38°22′N 139°13′E﻿ / ﻿38.37°N 139.22°E - or 38.37; 139.37 ; . It was located about 50 kilometres (31 mi) north of city of Niigata .

This article is about the sovereign state . For the western component entity, see Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina . For other uses, see Bosnia (disambiguation) and BIH . The name of the state is "Bosnia" and "BiH" The state is a member of the Bosnian Serbic Republic, a parliamentary constitutional republic, and is a self-declared state . It is located in Sarajevo, Bosnia's capital and largest city, the city of Sarjevo . The country is part of the Republic of Bosnia, a constitutional constitutional republic . Bosnia is the largest country in Southeast Europe, and its capital city in the region

This list includes any notable historical earthquakes that have epicenters within the current boundaries of Turkey . This list is incomplete . Turkey is a seismically active area within the complex zone of collision between the Eurasian Plate and both the African and Arabian Plates . Much of the country lies on the Anatolian Plate, a small plate bounded by two major strike-slip fault zones . The western part of Turkey is also affected by the zone of the North and East Anolian Fault . Seismic hazard is a major concern for the country's geology and geology of the region . List of notable earthquakes in Turkey includes notable historical quakes that caused significant effects in this area . List

The Samos–İzmir earthquake occurred on 30 October 2020, with a moment magnitude of 7.0, about 14 km (8.7 mi) northeast of the Greek island of Sam . The earthquake killed 119 people and injured 1,053, with 15,000 homeless . Total damage of $400 million is estimated to have been caused by the earthquake, also known as the Samos-Samos earthquake . County in Razavi Khorasan Province, Iran, is the capital of Torbat-e Heydarieh . At the 2006 census, its population (including portions of the county) was 261,917, in 67,735 families . The county is subdivided into four districts (bakhsh): the Central District, Bay District, Central District and Bay District . The population of the counties was 195,711 in 2016, including portions of Zave County, which was later split from the county to form Zave . The capital of the country is Torbat-i-Heydariye, which is located 35°24′N 59°19′E

The 1946 earthquake occurred near the Aleutian Islands, Alaska on April 1 . The shock had a moment magnitude of 8.6 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VI (Strong) It resulted in 165–173 casualties and over $26 million in damage . The seafloor along the fault was elevated, triggering a Pacific-wide tsunami with multiple destructive waves at heights from 45–130ft . The tsunami obliterated the Scotch Cap Lighthouse on Unimak Island, Alaska among others, and killed all five lighthouse keepers, including all five keepers . The earthquake killed five people and destroyed over $25 million worth of goods and damaged the coast of Alaska and Hawaii . The quake was

The 1963 Marj earthquake occurred on February 21 in northern Libya . The earthquake occurred at 18:14:36 local time with a moment magnitude of 5.6 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) Financial losses totaled $5 million USD, with 290–375 deaths, 375–500 injuries, and 12,000 displaced by the earthquake . The quake occurred at a depth of 25km (16 mi) and a moment of 5.6m (magnitude) The earthquake was the largest in the history of seismic activity in the world, with the largest magnitude ever recorded at 5.4m (moment magnitude) and depth of 4.

1962 Buin Zahra earthquake occurred on September 1, 1962 . The shock had a Richter magnitude of 7.1 and resulted in 12,225 fatalities . The 1962 event originated on one of many faults in the area, called the Ipak Fault . The fault is extensive and could still pose a threat to locals . Iran's building codes, renowned for performing poorly during earthquakes, were recently evaluated by multiple world organizations . Most hope that the earthquake will improve their building codes . The earthquake originated on a fault that has been reactivated multiple times, believed to be active multiple times . The Ipak fault is believed to have been reactivating multiple times and could pose a danger to locals in Iran .

Mount Agung is an active volcano in Bali, Indonesia, southeast of Mount Batur volcano . It is the highest point on Bali and dominates the surrounding area, influencing the climate, especially rainfall patterns . From a distance, it is possible to see the peak of Mount Rinjani on the nearby island of Lombok, to the ea from the summit . The mountain appears to be perfectly conical, with its peak being 3,031 m (9,944 ft) It is ranked 87th in the world's top mountain category . The last eruption of the active volcano was in 2019, with the highest elevation of 3,000 metres (8,000 ft)

Slovenia is a member of the European Union . Country in Central Europe . Not to be confused with Slovakia . Republic is a parliamentary parliamentary constitutional republic . Ljubljana is the capital of the country's largest city . Slovenia is one of the most populous countries in the EU and has a population of 83.1% of the population . Country is located in Slovenia, Slovenia, Hungary, Croatia, Slovenia and the Czech Republic of Moldova, Moldova . 1963 earthquake in Skopje, SR Macedonia (now North Macedonia) killed over 1,070 people, injured between 3,000[4] and 4,000 . About 80 percent of the city was destroyed and 75–80% of it was destroyed . The earthquake was a 6.1 moment magnitude earthquake which occurred on July 26, 1963, which left more than 200,000 people homeless and 75% of city destroyed . The 2005 Kashmir earthquake occurred at 08:50:39 Pakistan Standard Time on 8 October in Pakistani-administered Azad Kashmir . It was the first major earthquake in South Asia since the 1555 Kashmir earthquake . It killed 86,000–87,351 people and displaced 2.8 million people . Aftershocks were followed by 6.4 Mw aftershocks of magnitude 7.6 and 5.9 Mw . Quake occurred in Pakistan, India, Afghanistan, Tajikistan, Pakistan, Afghanistan and Afghanistan . Quake was the largest earthquake in the world since the 1885 Kashmir earthquake, when it occurred in 1885 and 1885,000 people were killed in the same region .

The 1946 Ancash earthquake in the Andes Mountains of central Peru occurred on November 10 at 17:43 UTC . The earthquake had a surface wave magnitude of 7.0 and achieved a maximum Mercalli intensity scale rating of XI (Extreme) About 1,400 Peruvians are thought to have died from the event . The quake was triggered by slippage along a normal fault at a depth of 17.0 km with a magnitude of 6.9-7.3, as suggested by the focal mechanism . The fault was a shallow crustal structure on the South American Plate, as surface ruptures were observed with a maximum offset of 3.5 meters . This event also reactivated several

The 1963 Kuril Islands earthquake occurred at 05:17 UTC, on October 13, 1963 . The earthquake had a magnitude of 8.5 and was followed by a Mw 7.8 event seven days later . Both earthquakes triggered tsunamis that were observed around the northern part of the Pacific Ocean . The Kuril islands form part of an island arc formed above the subduction zone, where the Pacific Plate is being subducted beneath the Eurasian Plate . This convergent boundary has been the site of many large megathrust earthquakes, including the 1963 Kuril Islands earthquake and the Soviet Union . The Soviet Union was the only country affected by the earthquake .

Much large numbers of earthquakes of smaller magnitude occur very regularly due to the meeting of major tectonic plates in the region . USGS: Indonesia has had more than 150 earthquakes with magnitude > 7 in the period 1901–2017 . Six of the Top Ten strongest Indonesian earthquakes ≥ 8.3 Mw occurred near Sumatra and along the Java Trench, with six of the strongest earthquakes in the country's history occurring near the Sumatra Trench . For the major 2004 earthquake and tsunami, see 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and Tsunami, see the list of the most recent recorded major quakes in the world, as well as the most significant aftershocks in the history of Indonesian earthquakes .

The Tonga Trench is the deepest trench in the Southern hemisphere and the second deepest on Earth . It is the northern half of the Tonga-Kermadec subduction system, which extends 2,550 km (1,580 mi) between New Zealand and Tonga . The fastest plate-tectonic velocity on Earth is occurring at this location, as the Pacific Plate is being subducted westward in the trench . The Apollo 13 mission was aborted in 1970 following an explosion in an oxygen tank, and the heat source plunged into an area of the Pacific Ocean that is either in or near the Tongi Trench . No release of nuclear fuel occurred in the area, however

The 1964 Baihe earthquake measured 6.3 local magnitude . The earthquake killed 106 people, destroyed 10,924 buildings, and caused a great fire in Chiayi City . It was the sixth deadliest earthquake in 20th century Taiwan, and the third deadliest post-World War II earthquake after the 921 earthquake and the 2016 Taiwan earthquake . The hypocenter of the earthquake was 20 km (12.4 mi) The earthquake occurred at 20:04 CST (UTC+8) on January 18, 1964 in Baihe Township of Tainan County (now part of Taitan City, Taiwan) The quake was the 6th deadliest in Taiwan, after 921 and 921 .

The 1964 Alaskan earthquake occurred at 5:36 PM AKST on Good Friday, March 27, 1964 . It was the second most powerful earthquake in recorded history . 131 people were killed in the earthquake . The earthquake caused a tsunami of 67 m (220 ft) at Shoup Bay, Alaska . Total damage was $311 million (1964 USD) and total damage was $311 million in the United States, Canada . The 1959 Kamchatka earthquake occurred on May 4 at 19:15 local time with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a surface wave magnitude 8.2 . The maximum intensity was VIII (Damaging) on the Medvedev–Sponheuer–Karnik scale . Building damage was reported in Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky . The earthquake triggered a tsunami with .2 meters (7.9in) of runup that was recorded in Massacre Bay, Alaska, in the United States . The 1964 Manyas earthquake happened on October 6 on the southern coast of Marmara Sea near the city of Karacabey in Bursa Province, Turkey . The shock had a moment magnitude of 6.8 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent) Around $5 million in damage was caused, with 19–73 killed and 100–239 injured . Papua New Guinea is located near the geologically-active Pacific Ring of Fire . No major damage or deaths have been reported from the earthquakes . Landslides and a dozen homes collapsed in a series of aftershocks in the past . The 1965 Rat Islands earthquake occurred at 05:01 UTC, on 4 February (19:01, 3 February local time) It had a magnitude of 8.7 and triggered a tsunami of over 10 m on Shemya Island . The Rat Islands form part of the Aleutian Islands, a chain of volcanic islands forming an island arc, that results from the subduction of the Pacific Plate beneath the North American Plate . This plate boundary, the Alaska-Alaska-Alaskan Plate boundary, is located in Alaska . The earthquake caused very little damage but triggered a 10.7-m (35ft) tsunami of more than 10 m (35 ft) on the island of She

The 1960 Valdivia earthquake (Spanish: Terremoto de Valdivia) was the most powerful earthquake ever recorded . Various studies have placed it at 9.4–9.6 on the moment magnitude scale . It occurred in the afternoon (19:11 GMT, 15:11 local time) and lasted for approximately 10 minutes . The resulting tsunamis affected southern Chile, Hawaii, Japan, the Philippines, and the Philippines . There were 1,000–6,000 casualties and up to 25 m (82 ft) of landlides and landslides . The earthquake was the largest in the history of the world's most powerful quakes, with the greatest number of quakes ever recorded

The 1945 Mikawa earthquake occurred off Aichi prefecture, Japan at 03:38 AM on January 13 . The epicenter was offshore in Mikawa Bay at a depth of eleven kilometers . The city of Tsu recorded a magnitude of 6 on the Richter Scale . Areas in southern Aichi were closer to the epicenter, and suffered significant damage . As it occurred during World War II, information about the disaster was censored . Efforts at keeping the disaster secret hampered relief efforts and contributed to a high death toll of 2,306 . The 1985 Mexico City earthquake struck in the early morning of 19 September at 07:17:50 (CST) with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a maximal Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent) The event caused serious damage to the Greater Mexico City area and the deaths of at least 5,000 people . Aftershocks 7.5 Mw’s were followed by 7.0 Mw aftershocks 30 April 1986 . The 2011 Puebla earthquake was the first major earthquake to hit Mexico City in the country since the 1985 earthquake occurred near Mexico City . The 1966 Varto earthquake occurred on 19 August with a moment magnitude of 6.8 a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent) At least 2,394 were killed and up to 1,500 people were injured . The earthquake devastated all the structures in the town of Varto in the Muş Province of eastern Turkey . This disaster was preceded by an earthquake of magnitude 5.6 that killed 14 and wounded 75 people on 7 March 1966 killing 14 and wounding 75 people in the same region . The disaster was the first earthquake to hit the region in 1966, killing at least 3,000 people and injuring up to 2,400 others in the region of Turkey in that year

The 1966 Hualien earthquake occurred on March 13 at 00:31 local time of Taiwan . The epicenter was located in the offshore area between Yonaguni Island, Japan and Hualen, Taiwan . A tsunami with a run-up height of 50cm (20in) was observed . The magnitude of this earthquake was put at Ms 8.0, Mw 7.79[5] MJMA 7.8, or ML7.8 . This earthquake had a strike-slip faulting faulting focal mechanism . The earthquake released a seismic moment of 4.86×1020 Nm . Two people were reported dead and four were reported to be injured in Taiwan .

Colombia is a seismically active country and has a large seismic risk in many areas of its territory due to its location at the boundaries of the Malpelo, Panama, Caribbean, North Andes and South American Plates along the Pacific Ring of Fire . The southeastern and extreme eastern portions of Colombia are not as seismic active as the rest of the country . The first recorded earthquake felt in Colombia occurred on September 11, 1530, around 10:00 AM, probably with the epicentre near Cumaná, Venezuela. The 2013 Solomon Islands earthquake struck northeast of Australia on 6 February with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) Its epicenter was the Solomon Islands, at the boundaries of the Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, causing local evacuations and a tsunami of 1.5 m (4.9 ft) and killing at least nine people . Aftershocks were also felt in the region, with a total of 20 aftershocks of around 20,000 occurring during the event . The Santa Maria earthquake was the largest earthquake ever recorded in Oceania, killing 9 people and injuring 5 others, killing 5 and injuring 17 .

The 1967 Neiva earthquake occurred at 10:24 local time (UTC-05) on February 9 in Colombia . The epicentre of the earthquake was located in San Vicente del Caguán in the department of Caquetá . Magnitude 8 Earthquake affecting the Zhili (Greater Beijing) region, China on September 2, 1679 . It is the largest recorded surface rupture event to have occurred in the North China Plain . The earthquake struck sometime between 9am and 11am on Saturday, September 2 . The epicenter was located approximately 50 km (31 mi) east of the Imperial Palace in Beijing . The 1679 Sanhe-Pinggu earthquake (Chinese:  Sanhe-Pínggǔ dìzhèn) was a major quake that struck the . Zhili region in Qing China on the morning of September 2 , 1679. It is estimated that 45,500

The western coast of West Sulawesi was struck by a major earthquake on 23 February 1969 at 00:36 UTC . It had a magnitude of 7.0 Mw and a maximum felt intensity of VIII on the Modified Mercalli intensity scale . It triggered a major tsunami that caused significant damage along the coast of the Makassar Strait . At least 64 people were killed, with possibly a further 600 deaths caused by the tsunami . The earthquake was the first major earthquake to strike in the region since the 1960s; it was also the second largest in the world; it occurred in the same year as the Second World War I . The 1967 Mudurnu earthquake occurred at about 18:57 local time on 22 July in Bolu Province, north-western Turkey . The magnitude 7.4 Mw[7] earthquake (but only 6.0 on the mb scale) was one of a series of major and intermediate quakes that have occurred in modern times along the North Anatolian Fault since 1939 . There were only 86 fatalities, with only 86 people being killed by the earthquake . The earthquake occurred on July 22, 1967 in the north-west region of Bolu province of Turkey . The Samos–İzmir earthquake occurred on 30 October 2020, with a moment magnitude of 7.0, about 14 km (8.7 mi) northeast of the Greek island of Sam . The earthquake killed 119 people and injured 1,053, with 15,000 homeless . Total damage of $400 million is estimated to have been caused by the earthquake, also known as the Samos-Samos earthquake . There was a large resurgence in activity in 1968 . 22 magnitude 7.0+ earthquakes struck various parts of the planet . The largest of these was Japan, off the east coast of Honshu (Magnitude 8.2) The largest was Iran, South Khorasan Province, which killed 10,488 people in August 31 . The 1969 Portugal earthquake struck western Portugal and Morocco on February 28 at 02:40 UTC . Originating west of the Strait of Gibraltar, the earthquake registered a magnitude of 7.8 Mw . The maximum felt intensity was VII (Very strong) on the Mercalli intensity scale . In total, 13 people died and 80 were injured in the earthquake . A tsunami of 3.14m (3-ft 9in) was the largest ever recorded tsunami in the history of the Portuguese earthquake . Aftershocks of 6.3 Mw were followed by 6.4 Mw aftershocks that occurred at 04:25:35 UTC on Feb 28 at 4:25 GMT[3]

The 1968 Belice earthquake sequence took place in Sicily between 14 and 15 January . The largest shock measured 5.5 on the moment magnitude scale, with five others of magnitude 5+ . The maximum perceived intensity was X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The earthquake sequence killed at least 231 people, possibly more than 400, with between 632 and about 1,000 injured and left 100,000 homeless . It is known in Italy as Terremoto del Belice, or Terremotel Belice . It took place between Gibellina, Salaparuta and Poggioreale in Sicily, and is now known as Belice de Belice in Italy .

The 1968 Inangahua earthquake struck 25 kilometres (16 mi) west of Murchison, New Zealand . It struck at a depth of 12 kilometres (7.5 mi), being extremely shallow for an earthquake of its size . It resulted in the deaths of three people, with a further 14 people injured . The earthquake had a moment magnitude of 7.1, a local magnitude of 6.7, a surface wave magnitude 7.4[3] and a maximum Mercalli intensity of X (Exreme)Peak acceleration was 0.6 g[1] It is the fifth deadliest earthquake in New Zealand's history, with 3 dead, 14 injured[2] It

Region of eastern Indonesia on the island of New Guinea . Lying to the west of Papua New Guinea, it is the only Indonesian territory situated in the region . Since Papua is alternatively named as Papua, the region is also called West Papua (Indonesian: Papua Barat) West Papua is Indonesia's western half of the island . It is also known as Papua or Indonesian New Guinea since 1962, as Indonesia has controlled the region since 1962 . Largest cities Jayapura, Sorong, Manokwari, Merauke, Timika and Wamena are located in Indonesia's West Papua Province, West Papua, as well as West Irian Jaya and West Papua .

The 1931 Zangezur earthquake occurred on April 27 at 20:50:45 local time with a moment magnitude of 6.5 . The earthquake was located in the Zangzur Mountains near the boundary between southwestern Armenia and Azerbaijan's exclave, the Nakhichivan Autonomous Republic . The Pambak-Sevan-Sunik Fault extends in the NW–SE direction . The fault can be traced continuously for 400 km and consists of four major segments . The 1931 Zangangur earthquake occurred near the border between Armenia and Azerbaijian exclave . Both territories were part of the Soviet Union at the time of the earthquake .

The 1968 Casiguran earthquake occurred on August 2, 1968 with a moment magnitude of 7.3 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent) A small non-destructive tsunami was generated and at least 207 people were killed . Majority of the deaths occurred in the collapse of a six-story building in Manila . The thrust earthquake's epicenter was in Casiguran, Quezon (now part of Aurora province) The thrust quake's thrust earthquake was in the Philippines . This list considers every notable earthquake felt or with its epicenter within Mexico's current borders and maritime areas . Mexico lies within two seismically active earthquake zones . The Cocos Plate is subducting under the North American Plate at a rate of 67mm (0.220ft) per year . Southern Mexico also contains numerous faults, which causes that section of the country to have high tectonic activity . Northeastern Mexico and the Yucatan Peninsula are not as active as the area close to the boundary between the Cocos and Cocos plates . The Baja California peninsula lies near the boundary of the Pacific Plate and the Pacific and Rivera plates, while southern Mexico lies just north of the boundary

The western coast of West Sulawesi was struck by a major earthquake on 23 February 1969 at 00:36 UTC . It had a magnitude of 7.0 Mw and a maximum felt intensity of VIII on the Modified Mercalli intensity scale . It triggered a major tsunami that caused significant damage along the coast of the Makassar Strait . At least 64 people were killed, with possibly a further 600 deaths caused by the tsunami . The earthquake was the first major earthquake to strike in the region since the 1960s; it was also the second largest in the world; it occurred in the same year as the Second World War I . The Dasht-e Bayaz and Ferdows earthquakes occurred in Iran in late August and early September 1968 . The mainshock measured 7.4 on the moment magnitude scale and had a maximum perceived intensity of X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . Damage was heavy in the affected areas with thousands of lives lost in the first event and many hundreds more in the second strong event . The Iranian plateau is confined by the Turan platf and is confined to the Alborz and Caspian Depression . This list includes any notable historical earthquakes that have epicenters within the current boundaries of Turkey . This list is incomplete . Turkey is a seismically active area within the complex zone of collision between the Eurasian Plate and both the African and Arabian Plates . Much of the country lies on the Anatolian Plate, a small plate bounded by two major strike-slip fault zones . The western part of Turkey is also affected by the zone of the North and East Anolian Fault . Seismic hazard is a major concern for the country's geology and geology of the region . List of notable earthquakes in Turkey includes notable historical quakes that caused significant effects in this area . List

The Motagua and Chixoy-Polochic fault complex cuts across Guatemala and forms the tectonic boundary between the Caribbean plate and the North American plate . The Cocos plate pushes against the Caribbean plates, forming a subduction zone known as the Middle America Trench located approximately 50 km off Guatemala's Pacific coast . The most destructive earthquake in recent Guatemalan history was the 197-year-old earthquake in which the most destructive quake was recorded at the time of the most significant earthquake in the country's history was recorded in the 1960s and 1970s . Guatemala lies in a major fault zone, which is an important source of offshore earthquakes and is a major source of earthquakes .

The Western Australian town of Meckering was struck by an earthquake on 14 October 1968 . The earthquake occurred at 10:58:52 local time, with a moment magnitude of 6.5 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent) Total damage amounted to $2.2 million with 20–28 injured . The shallow fault was about 32 kilometres (20 mi) long around the western side of the town . It damaged roads including the Great Eastern Highway, the Eastern Goldfields Railway and the Goldfields water pipeline . Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The country is well known for its long history of disastrous earthquake activity . It is also known for the waste of valuable natural resources and the deaths of at least 125,000 people since 1900 . Santa Isabel Island is the longest in Solomon Islands, the third largest in terms of surface area . Choiseul lies to the north-west, Malaita to the south-east . The highest point in Santa Isabel is Mount Sasari, 1220 metres (3,675 ft) The Pacific Ocean lies in the north, Guadalcanal (Isatabu) to the southeast to the south . The Marutho river runs down Mount Sasar to the ocean at Hofi, and almost all rivers or streams run from that cent of the island's highest point . Santa Isabel has a population of 35,257 (2020), the largest island in Isabel Province

Northern Anatolia was struck by a large earthquake on 17 August 1668 in the late morning . It had an estimated magnitude in the range 7.8–8.0 Ms and the maximum felt intensity was IX on the Modified Mercalli intensity scale . The epicenter of the earthquake was on the southern shore of Ladik Lake . It caused widespread damage from at least Bolu in the west to Erzincan in the east and resulted in about 8,000 deaths . It remains the most powerful earthquake recorded in Turkey and remains most powerful quake recorded in the country . The South American Plate is moving over the Nazca Plate at a rate of 77mm (3.0in) per year . The same process has caused the rise of the Andes mountain range and the creation of the Peru–Chile Trench, as well as volcanism in the Peruvian highlands . The oldest rocks in Peru date to the Precambrian and are more than two billion years old . Along the southern coast, granulite and charnockite shows reworking by an ancient orogeny mountain-building event . The 1969 Yangjiang earthquake occurred on 26 July, at 6:49 am, Beijing local time (25 July 22:49 UTC) It struck the city of Yangjiang and caused over 10,700 houses to collapse, severely damaging a further 36,000 . The earthquake also caused landslides and sandblows along the coast and along some rivers . There were an unconfirmed total of 3,000 deaths, mostly from landslides, and the earthquake was also felt in Hong Kong . The 1969 Bohai earthquake occurred on July 18, 1969, at 13:24 local time . The magnitude of this earthquake is Ms 7.4 . The earthquake could be felt in Liaoning, Hebei, Beijing, Tianjin, Shanxi, Shandong, and Jiangsu . This earthquake caused ground surface subsidences of about 15.1cm ~ 15.8cm in the Yellow River Delta region . The mechanism of the earthquake was of dextral strike-slip faulting . It was located near the Tancheng-Lujiang fault zone (郯庐断裂带), some researchers think that this earthquake was dominated by this fault zone .

The 1970 Tonghai earthquake occurred at 01:00:41 local time on January 5 with a moment magnitude of 7.1 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of X (Extreme) The strike-slip rupture originated on the Red River Fault, which had not experienced an earthquake above magnitude 7 since 1700 . At least 10,000 people were killed, making it one of the deadliest in its decade . The tremor caused between US$5 to $25 million in damage, felt over an area of 8,781 km (6.8 mi) At least 26,783 people were injured in the tremor, which was felt in Tonghai County, Yunnan province, China . 2007 earthquake and tsunami centered off the coast of Ica Department, Peru . Quake measured 8.0 on moment magnitude scale and lasted two minutes . The 1960 Valdivia earthquake was 9.4–9.6 on the moment magnitude scale . It occurred in the afternoon (19:11 GMT, 15:11 local time) and lasted for approximately 10 minutes . The resulting tsunamis affected southern Chile, Hawaii, Japan, the Philippines, and the Philippines . The quake was the most powerful earthquake ever recorded in the history of the Great Chilean earthquake (Gran terremoto de Chile) in 1960 . It was recorded at the time of the earthquake on 22 May 1960 in Valdivia, Chile, Punta Arenas, Iquique, Santiago and Punta Arenas . The earthquake was the largest ever recorded earthquake in the world

The 1949 Queen Charlotte Islands earthquake struck the Pacific Northwest coast at 8:01 p.m. PDT on August 21, 1949 . The shock had a surface wave magnitude of 8.1 and a maximum Mercalli Intensity of VIII (Severe) It ruptured along the Queen Charlotte Fault both northward and southward more than 500 km (311 mi) Shaking was felt throughout British Columbia, parts of Washington, Oregon, Alberta, Alberta and the Yukon . Aftershocks were felt in British Columbia and parts of Oregon, Washington and Alberta, Yukon, Canada, and British Columbia . Tsunami was 2.61m (2ft 0in) [1]

Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The country is well known for its long history of disastrous earthquake activity . It is also known for the waste of valuable natural resources and the deaths of at least 125,000 people since 1900 . Batan Island is the main island of Batanes, an archipelagic province in the Philippines . It is the second largest of the Batanes Islands, the northernmost of the province . The island has a population of 12,758 (2015) with a population density of134/km2 (347/sq mi) at its highest density . The highest elevation of the island is 1,009 m (3310 ft) and its highest point is Mount Iraya . The 1971 Tuscania earthquake caused major destruction . 24 people were killed, 150 were injured and about 5,000 homeless . 40 homes were destroyed and 1,678 were damaged . Costs were $41 million (1971 rate) 60 percent of the city's buildings were destroyed . The medieval section of Tuscanian, a city of 8,000, was practically leveled . The 8th century St. Peter's Church and the 12th century Basilica of St. Mary Major were among the buildings that sustained serious damage, both recently restored, were destroyed in the event . The earthquake occurred on February 6, 1971 near the town of Tuscania in Lazio, Italy.[1]

The 1971 San Fernando earthquake (also known as the 1971 Sylmar earthquake) occurred in the early morning of February 9, 1971 . 58–65 dead, 200–2,000 injured and $505–553 million worth of damage was caused by the earthquake in the greater Los Angeles area . The earthquake was centered on the Sierra Madre Fault Zone, a fault fault in the western part of the San Fernando Valley . The Valparaíso Region of central Chile was struck by an earthquake of magnitude 7.8 Mw at 22:03 8 July 1971 local time (03:03 9 July UTC) It had a maximum felt intensity of IX (violent) on the Modified Mercalli intensity scale and caused the deaths of 83 people and injured a further 447 . Central Chile lies on the destructive plate boundary where the Nazca Plate is being subducted beneath the South American Plate . The rate of convergence at this boundary in central Chile is about 74 mm per year . It caused the earthquake to hit the region about 58km (36 mi) and caused a total of 83 deaths in 1971 .

Oceanic trench part of the Pacific Ring of Fire off northeast Japan . It is 8,046 metres (26,398 ft) at its deepest . It links the Kuril–Kamchatka Trench to the north and the Izu–Ogasawara Trench with a length of 800 kilometres (497 mi) It is created as the oceanic Pacific plate subducts beneath the continental Okhotsk Plate . The subduction process causes bending of the down going plate, creating a deep trench . The 1965 Rat Islands earthquake occurred at 05:01 UTC, on 4 February (19:01, 3 February local time) It had a magnitude of 8.7 and triggered a tsunami of over 10 m on Shemya Island . The Rat Islands form part of the Aleutian Islands, a chain of volcanic islands forming an island arc, that results from the subduction of the Pacific Plate beneath the North American Plate . This plate boundary, the Alaska-Alaska-Alaskan Plate boundary, is located in Alaska . The earthquake caused very little damage but triggered a 10.7-m (35ft) tsunami of more than 10 m (35 ft) on the island of She

The 1952 Severo-Kurilsk earthquake struck off the coast of the Kamchatka Peninsula in Russia . The 9.0 Mw earthquake triggered a major tsunami that hit the Kuril Islands, Sakhalin Oblast, Russian SFSR, USSR, on 4 November 1952 at 16:58 (UTC) This led to the destruction of many settlements and the death toll of 2,336 people . The main impact of the earthquake was that a tsunami of 18m (59ft) was 18 m (59 ft) The earthquake was the sixth most powerful on record; 6th most powerful earthquake on record in Russia, 6th highest on the world's list of quakes .

Shemya or Simiya is a small island in the Semichi Islands group of the Near Islands chain in the Aleutian Islands chain . It has a land area of 5.903 sq mi (15.29 km2) and is about 1,200 miles (1,900 km) southwest of Anchorage, Alaska . It is 2.73 miles (4.39 km) wide and 4.32 miles (6.95 km) long . The 1972 Qir earthquake occurred at 05:36 local time (02:06 UTC) on April 10, 1972 . It had a magnitude of 6.7 on the moment magnitude scale and a maximum perceived intensity of IX (Violent) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The earthquake caused the destruction of Qir and serious damage to towns and villages in the surrounding area . The estimated number of deaths is 5,374, with a further 1,710 injured . The quake occurred in the Fars Domain of the Zagros fold and thrust belt in southern Iran . It caused the death of 5,000 people and damage to the surrounding areas of the city of Fars in the region .

The 1994 Mindoro earthquake had a moment magnitude of 7.1 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong) It is associated with a 35 kilometer-long ground rupture, called the Aglubang River fault . Seventy eight people were reported dead and 7,566 houses were damaged . The earthquake generated a tsunami and landslides on the Verde Island Passage, a strait separating Luzon and Mindoro . The epicenter of this earthquake was located in the Ver de Island Passage . The Gupis-Yasin District is the westernmost district of the 14 districts of Pakistan-administered territory of Gilgit-Baltistan . It is bounded on the north and west by the Upper Chitral District of Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province, on the east by the Ghizer District, and on the south by the Swat District . The district was created in 2019 from the two western tehsils of the former, larger, larger Ghizer District . Lixouri is the main town on the peninsula of Paliki, and the second largest town in Kefalonia after Argostoli and before Sami . It is located south of Fiskardo and west of Argostolis . Since the 2019 local government reform it is one of the three municipalities on the island . It has one municipal unit: Paliki - the second municipal unit of the Ionian Islands . It's located in the eastern part of Greece's eastern Aegerean region, the largest Ionian Island of Greece, and is located in Greece's northern Adririanaia, Greece's second largest city after Sami and Fiskardos . This is a list of earthquakes in Japan with either a magnitude greater than or equal to 7.0 or which caused significant damage or casualties . The present list is not exhaustive, and reliable and precise magnitude data is scarce for earthquakes that occurred before the development of modern measuring instruments . The 1972 Nicaragua earthquake occurred at 12:29:44 a.m. local time (06:29  December 23, 1972) on December 23 near Managua, the capital of Nicaragua . It had a moment magnitude of 6.3 and a maximum MSK intensity of IX (Destructive) earthquake . The earthquake killed 4,000–11,000 and injured 20,000 . 300,000 people were displaced by the earthquake, causing thousands of thousands of dollars in losses and thousands of people to be displaced . The quake was the largest in the history of the world's history of quakes in the 1970s and '80s . It was the first major earthquake

Magnitude 7.6 earthquake in Mexico occurred January 30, 1973 . At least 56 people were killed and about 390 were injured . The earthquake struck 43 km beneath the Sierra Madre del Sur range in the Mexican states of Colima, Jalisco and Michoacán . On the Mercalli intensity scale, the earthquake reached a maximum intensity of X (Extreme), causing serious damage in the region . The event is commonly referred to as the Colima earthquake, commonly known as the "Colima earthquake" The event occurred at 15:01 (UTC–6) January 30 (GMT–6), at 15 (GMT-6) The earthquake was the largest in the history of the world .

1973 Point Mugu earthquake occurred at 06:45:57 local time on February 21 in southeastern Ventura County of southern California . It had a moment magnitude of 5.8 and a maximum Mercalli Intensity of VII (Very strong) This oblique-slip shock resulted in several injuries and $1 million in damage . The epicenter was near the Oxnard Plain and the northern terminus of the Santa Monica Mountains, in the California South Coast region . The earthquake was recorded at a depth of 10km (6.2 mi) and a moment of magnitude of 5.8m (MW) It was the second largest earthquake in the history of seismic activity in the United States .

Miss Venezuela 1973 was the 20th edition of the Miss Venezuela pageant held at Club de Sub-Oficiales in Caracas, Venezuela, on July 10, 1973 . The winner of the pageant was Desireé Rolando, Miss Carabobo . Edicta García (Miss Zulia) was the first runner-up, followed by Ana Cecilia Ramírez (Miss Distrito Federal) Hilda Carrero (Miss Táchira) Miss Fotogénica (Miss Photogenic) and Miss Congeniality (Miss Friendship) were the other two special awards . The pageant was broadcast live by Venevision, with 15 entrants and 15 placements in each

The 1973 Luhuo earthquake struck near the town of Zhaggo in the Garzê Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture of Sichuan Province, China on February 6 with a magnitude of 7.6 Ms. The earthquake had a maximum intensity of X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale, resulting in 2,199 deaths and a further 2,743 injuries . Serious and widespread destruction to villages was reported in the area as a result of the earthquake . Serious damage was reported to villages in Luhu County, China . The 1973 Veracruz earthquake, also known as El Terremoto de Orizaba, occurred at 3:50 a.m. local time (9:50 GMT) on August 28, with the epicenter located in the vicinity of Serdán in the Mexican state of Puebla . It registered 7.0 on the Richter magnitude scale and had a maximum perceived intensity of VIII (Severe) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The effects of the earthquake were felt in Mexico's southern states . The area that was damaged in the area is tropical and mountainous; the area was tropical . The earthquake killed 539–1,000 people and injured thousands of others .

The 2004 Baladeh earthquake occurred on May 28 in northern Iran . The dip-slip earthquake had a moment magnitude of 6.3 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) Total deaths for the event amounted to 35, with 278–400 injured, and $15.4 million in damage . Total damage from the event was $15 .4 million, with the total death toll of 35 people, 278 injuries and a total of 278 people injured from the event . The earthquake occurred in the area of 36°20′N 51°36′E﻿ / ﻿36.34°N 51.6°E

The Faial-Pico Channel is an 8.3 km (5.2 km) long channel that separates the islands of Faial and Pico in the central group of the archipelago of the Azores . The strait is divided into various depressions, calderas and micro-systems, referred to as Baixas . The Baixa do Norte reef is located 2 kilometres (1.1 nmi) from Ponta da Espalamaca, at a depth of approximately 100–150 metres (330-490 ft), to a depth reaching 17 metres (56 ft) below sea level . The 365 Crete earthquake occurred at about sunrise on 21 July 365 in the Eastern Mediterranean . Geologists today estimate the undersea earthquake to have been a magnitude 8.0 or higher . The earthquake was followed by a tsunami which devastated the southern and eastern coasts of the Mediterranean . It caused widespread destruction in the central and southern Diocese of Macedonia (modern Greece), Africa Proconsularis (northern Libya), Egypt, Cyprus, Sicily, and Hispania (Spain) On Crete, nearly all towns were destroyed; on Crete the earthquake killed "many thousands" Geologists believe the earthquake was a magnitude of 8.5+[1] The earthquake occurred in the eastern Mediterranean Sea

The 1974 Lima earthquake occurred on October 3 at 14:21 UTC (09:21 local time) It was located at about 80 km southwest of Lima, Peru . The magnitude of the earthquake was put at 8.1 Mw, or Ms 7.8.8 . The earthquake caused 78 deaths and about 2400 injured . The largest aftershock occurred on November 9, 1974, at 12:59 UTC (07:59 local time), with a magnitude of 8.2 Mw . 1974 Zhaotong earthquake occurred at 19:25 UTC on 10 May . It had a magnitude that was measured at 7.0 on the moment magnitude scale[4] and 7.1 on the surface wave magnitude scale . It caused between 1,641 and 20,000 deaths . The earthquake has been ascribed to slip on a thrust fault trending north-south with a dip of 60° to the east . The epicenter was located in Zhaotaong prefecture in Yunnan province and it caused up to 30,000 deaths . The 1974 earthquake occurred in China, Yunnan, Sichuan and China, with a maximum perceived intensity of IX (Violent)

The 1960 Valdivia earthquake was 9.4–9.6 on the moment magnitude scale . It occurred in the afternoon (19:11 GMT, 15:11 local time) and lasted for approximately 10 minutes . The resulting tsunamis affected southern Chile, Hawaii, Japan, the Philippines, and the Philippines . The quake was the most powerful earthquake ever recorded in the history of the Great Chilean earthquake (Gran terremoto de Chile) in 1960 . It was recorded at the time of the earthquake on 22 May 1960 in Valdivia, Chile, Punta Arenas, Iquique, Santiago and Punta Arenas . The earthquake was the largest ever recorded earthquake in the world

1974 Lesser Antilles earthquake occurred at 05:50:58 local time on October 8 with a moment magnitude of 6.9 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) Four people were injured in what the U.S. National Geophysical Data Center called a moderately destructive event . The northern and southern boundary of the Caribbean Plate are complex and diffuse, with zones of seismicity stretching several hundred kilometers across . The eastern boundary i i is the eastern boundary on the east coast of the continent's tectonic plate, which is also known as the Caribbean Volcanic arc . The earthquake occurred in the Lesser Antigua and Barbuda region of Antigua .
