The 1852 Banda Sea earthquake struck on 26 November, 1852 at 07:40 local time, affecting coastal communities on the Banda Islands . The earthquake had an estimated moment magnitude of 7.5 or 8.4 to 8.8 . It caused violent shaking lasting five minutes, and was assigned IX on the Modified Mercalli intensity scale in the Maluku Islands . A tsunami measuring up to 8 meters slammed into the islands of Banda Neira, Saparua, Haruku and Ceram . The tsunami caused major damage, washing away many villages, ships and residents . At least 60 people were killed in the earthquake and tsunami, including many of the villages and residents of the islands

The 1975 Kinnaur earthquake occurred in the early afternoon (local time) (08:02 UTC) of 19 January . It had a magnitude of 6.8 on the surface wave magnitude scale and a maximum perceived intensity of IX (Violent) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The earthquake caused 47 casualties and caused major damage to the Hindustan-Tibet Road in northern India . Landslides, rock falls and avalanches were also caused by the earthquake . It was the first major earthquake to hit India in the 1970s and caused extensive damage to India's Himalayan region, Himachal Pradesh and the Spiti Valley in the 1980s and 1970s . The Kin

The 1975 Near Islands earthquake occurred at 08:43 UTC on February 2 off the coast of Attu Island, Alaska . The earthquake had a surface wave magnitude of 7.6 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent) 15 people were injured . The runways of Shemya Air Force Base sustained cracks up to 16 inches (41 cm) wide, and crevices with as much as 54 feet (16.6 m) of displacement were observed on the island . The surface wave of the earthquake was 10km (6.2 mi) Depth of 10 km (10.2 km) The earthquake caused heavy damage on ShemyA Island, injuring 15 residents .

The 2019 Coquimbo earthquake is an earthquake that occurred 10 km south southwest of Coquimo in Chile, on January 19, 2019 at 22:32 (local time) The epicenter was located off the coast and had a moment magnitude of Mw6.7 . This list includes any notable historical earthquakes that have epicenters within the current boundaries of Turkey . This list is incomplete . Turkey is a seismically active area within the complex zone of collision between the Eurasian Plate and both the African and Arabian Plates . Much of the country lies on the Anatolian Plate, a small plate bounded by two major strike-slip fault zones . The western part of Turkey is also affected by the zone of the North and East Anolian Fault . Seismic hazard is a major concern for the country's geology and geology of the region . The U.S. state of Florida has a total of 4,510 islands that are ten acres or larger . This is the second-highest number of islands of any state of the United States; only Alaska has more . Major island chains include the Florida Keys, the Ten Thousand Islands, the Sea Islands and the barrier islands of the Atlantic coast, the Panhandle Gulf of Mexico coast, and the Tampa Bay Area and Southwest Florida Gulf coast . The Philippines lies along the Pacific Ring of Fire, which causes frequent seismic and volcanic activity . Many earthquakes of smaller magnitude occur very regularly due to the meeting of major tectonic plates in the region . The largest was the 1918 Celebes Sea earthquake with Mw8.3.0 . The 1976 Moro Gulf earthquake killed 5,000–8,000 people . Largest earthquake in the Philippines was the 18th-19th-century Celebes Sea quake, the largest in the country, with a magnitude of 8.3 . The country lies on the Pacific Rim of Fire and is located near the Philippines' southern tip of the U.S.-Pacific Ocean .

Earthquakes in Guam are infrequent but are often accompanied by tsunami . The event generated a large tsunami that was as high as 47 feet (14 m) on Hawai'i island and   U.S. mainland . The 1976 Guatemala earthquake struck on February 4 at 03:01:43 local time with a moment magnitude of 7.5 . The shock was centered on the Motagua Fault, about 160 km northeast of Guatemala City at a depth of 5 kilometers (3.1 mi) The earthquake struck during the early morning (at 3:01 am, local time) when most people were asleep . The earthquake killed 23,000 people, injuring 76,000 more than a year later . Most adobe type houses in the outlying areas of Guatemala city were destroyed . The quake was centered near the town of Los Amates in the department of Izabal, near the city of . Izabal .

The October 2015 Hindu Kush earthquake was a magnitude 7.5 earthquake that struck South Asia on 26 October 2015, at 13:39 AFT (14:09 PKT; 14:39 IST; 09:09 UTC) It was estimated that at least 399 people were killed, mostly in Pakista . The epicenter was 45 km north of `Alaqahdari-ye Kiran wa Munjan, Afghanistan, at a depth of 212.5 km (132.0 mi) by 5 November . Active tectonics of Ecuador is dominated by the effects of the subduction of the Nazca Plate beneath the South American Plate . Ecuador lies within the Northern Volcanic Zone . The subduction zone is moving at a rate of 7cm/yr to the east-northeast, significantly oblique to the trend of this segment of the Andes . The active tectonic zone has an overall dip of 25–30°, but varies rapidly along strike due to effects of subduction of the Carnegie Ridge . The Balkans is a geographic area in Southeast Europe with various geographical and historical definitions . The region takes its name from the Balkan Mountains that stretch throughout the whole of Bulgaria . It is bordered by the Adriatic Sea, the Ionian Sea, Aegean Sea in the south, the Turkish Straits in the east, and the Turkish straits . The population of the region is 55 million (32 million only the peninsula's part), with a population of 55 million . The area is located in 12 countries and has the highest elevation of 2,925 m (9596 ft) Highest point is Musala (Bulgaria), with the highest point being Musala in Musala .

The 1976 Papua earthquake occurred on 26 June with a surface wave magnitude of 7.1 in Papua, Indonesia . Total deaths for the event amounted to 422, including 70 who died in subsequent landslides . Papua lies within the Pacific Ring of Fire, a sector of the Pacific where several tectonic plates intersect . This movement between the plates results in extremely high volcanic and seismic activity.[2] Papua is constantly plagued by landslides and is frequently hit by natural disasters such as landslides, such as earthquakes and volcanoes . Over 5,000 people are still missing after the event, including over 4,000 who were killed by the earthquake in the region of Papua in the 1970s and 1980s

The 1976 Friuli earthquake took place on May 6, 1976, with a moment magnitude of 6.5 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of X (Extreme) The shock occurred in the Friuli region in northeast Italy near the town of Gemona del Friuli . 990 people were killed, up to 3,000 injured, and more than 157,000 were left homeless . Region of eastern Indonesia on the island of New Guinea . Lying to the west of Papua New Guinea, it is the only Indonesian territory situated in the region . Since Papua is alternatively named as Papua, the region is also called West Papua (Indonesian: Papua Barat) West Papua is Indonesia's western half of the island . It is also known as Papua or Indonesian New Guinea since 1962, as Indonesia has controlled the region since 1962 . Largest cities Jayapura, Sorong, Manokwari, Merauke, Timika and Wamena are located in Indonesia's West Papua Province, West Papua, as well as West Irian Jaya and West Papua .

Pozo Almonte (Spanish pronunciation: [poso alˈmonte] is a city and commune of Chile located in the interior of the Atacama Desert . It has been the capital of Tamarugal Province since this province was established in 2007 . The city is located at 52 km (32 mi) from Tacapacá Region's capital, Iquique . South Africa was relatively late in introducing television broadcasting to its population . The first proposal to introduce television was made by The Rank Organisation in 1953, but this was rejected by the National Party government . Television was introduced in South Africa in 1976, and the most-viewed channels are now the most watched channels in the country . The most viewed television channels are South Africa's most popular channels, with the most viewed channels being South Africa-based community television and satellite television . This list is a list of notable earthquakes that have affected the area currently defined as Tajikistan . Note: The inclusion criteria for adding events are based on WikiProject Eart . The list includes notable earthquakes in the Fergana Valley, Gorno-Badakhshan, Gissar, Ghatlon Province, Gholan Province, and Rushon District . The most recent earthquake was in the region of Rasht, killing livestock and damaging buildings . The largest earthquake in the country was in 2007, when it took place in the province of Gholn-Gholan, killing at least 20,000 people and injuring more than 100,000 livestock . The September 2007 Sumatra earthquakes were a series of megathrust earthquakes that struck the Sunda Trench off the coast of Sumatra, Indonesia, with three of magnitude 7 or greater . The most powerful of the series had a magnitude of 8.4, which makes it in the top 20 of the largest earthquakes ever recorded on a seismograph . A series of tsunami bulletins was issued for the area, with 23 people killed and a tsunami warning was issued . The series of earthquakes was the largest in the history of the world's largest ever recorded seismic activity, with the most powerful being the 8.3 magnitude . The 1917 Samoa earthquake occurred on June 26 at 05:49 UTC . The epicenter was located in the southwest of the Samoan Islands . The earthquake had a magnitude of Mw 8.5, or Ms 8.4, one of the strongest earthquakes ever recorded in this region . A tsunami was triggered by the earthquake, which affected both American Samoa and German Samoa, which was then under Allied occupation . Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The country is well known for its long history of disastrous earthquake activity . It is also known for the waste of valuable natural resources and the deaths of at least 125,000 people since 1900 . The 1977 Tonga earthquake took place on 22 June at 12:08:33 UTC some 200 km southwest of Tongatapu . The earthquake measured 8.0 on the moment magnitude scale and had a maximum intensity of VIII (Severe) on the Mercalli intensity scale . It caused considerable damage to the infrastructures and some fatalities in most Tongan islands, with the most damage in Tonga and ʻEua and the least damage in Ha'apai and Vava'u, which shocks infecting all islands of the kingdom of Tonga . White Carniola (Slovene: Bela krajina; German: Weißkrain or Weiße Mark) is a traditional region in southeastern Slovenia on the border with Croatia . Due to its smallness, it is often considered a subunit of the broader Lower Carniola region, although with distinctive cultural, linguistic, and historical features . During World War II, it was an important center of anti-Fascist resistance in Slovenia . It was part of Hungarian Slavonia until the 12th century, after which it shared historical fate with the Windic March and Lower Carniolan to the north . The 1977 San Juan earthquake, also known as Caucete earthquake, took place in the province of San Juan, Argentina, on 23 November at 09:26:26 AM . It measured 7.4 on the surface wave magnitude scale and had a maximum perceived intensity of IX (Violent) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The earthquake caused fatalities and severe damage to buildings throughout the province . At least 65 people died in the earthquake, mostly in the city of Caucet, where at least 65 were killed . The effects of the earthquake were felt as far away as Buenos Aires, where people were awakened by the earthquake that Wednesday by the quake . It also caused slight damage in the north

The 2003 Bam earthquake struck the Kerman province of southeastern Iran at 01:56 UTC (5:26 AM Iran Standard Time) on December 26 . The 2021 Kermadec Islands earthquakes were a series of earthquakes with magnitudes of 8.1 and 7.4 that occurred at 19:28:31 UTC on 4 March 2021 . The epicentres were located southeast of Raoul Island in the Kermadc Islands, part of the New Zealand Pacific islands . 1978 Thessaloniki earthquake occurred on 20 June at 23:03 local time . The shock registered 6.5 on the moment magnitude scale, had a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) It was the largest event in the area since the 1932 Ierissos earthquake . It is estimated that 49 people died, 37 of which were living in the same block of flats in the city center that collapsed . Total damage of $250 million – $1 billion was estimated to have been caused by the earthquake . Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . The 1960 Valdivia earthquake was 9.4–9.6 on the moment magnitude scale . It occurred in the afternoon (19:11 GMT, 15:11 local time) and lasted for approximately 10 minutes . The resulting tsunamis affected southern Chile, Hawaii, Japan, the Philippines, and the Philippines . The quake was the most powerful earthquake ever recorded in the history of the Great Chilean earthquake (Gran terremoto de Chile) in 1960 . It was recorded at the time of the earthquake on 22 May 1960 in Valdivia, Chile, Punta Arenas, Iquique, Santiago and Punta Arenas . The earthquake was the largest ever recorded earthquake in the world

1721 catastrophic earthquake centered near Tabriz, Iran . Magnitude7.7 Ms . Quake leveled some three-quarters of the city, and resulted in the deaths of tens of thousands of people . Quake was popularly interpreted as an omen of misfortune or a demonstration of godly wrath . The destruction that the earthquake caused was a significant factor in the successful Ottoman takeover of Tabriz in 1725, as well as contributory factors to the successful takeover of the town of Iran in the 1725 . Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . In 1849, the first earthquake following European settlement in WA was recorded . The strongest earthquake with its epicentre on land is the Meckering earthquake of 1968, which caused injuries to at least 17 people and extensive property damage . The previous largest earthquake documented occurred in 1941, at Meeberrie, in the Murchison region . The largest earthquake affecting Western Australia in modern times was an offshore earthquake in 2019, occurring 202 km west of Broome at a magnitude of 6.6 causing minor damage in the town itself . The Papua New Guinea earthquake was a magnitude 7.5 earthquake that occurred on 26 February 2018 (25 February UTC) The earthquake's epicenter was 10 kilometres (6.2 mi) west of the town of Komo . The maximum felt intensity was IX (Violent) on the Mercalli intensity scale . A total of 160 people were killed in the main shock, with 40 aftershocks . The 2003 Puerto Armuelles earthquake occurred on December 25 at 02:11 local time (07:11 UTC) The earthquake had a magnitude of Mw 6.5 . Two people were reported dead and 75 injured . Power outage lasted for about four hours . The maximal intensity was MM VIII in Finca Naranjo, Costa Rica, and the intensity of MM VII in Armuella, Panama, and Limón and the Central Valley, including San José, was the highest intensity of the earthquake in Costa Rica . This earthquake caused building damage in Panama and Costa Rica and caused power outages for four hours in Puerto Armuelles, Panama and the rest of the country .

The 1556 Shaanxi earthquake, or Huaxian earthquake, is the deadliest earthquake in recorded history . It occurred on the morning of 23 January 1556, during the Ming dynasty . According to imperial records, approximately 830,000 people lost their lives . The earthquake was the deadliest ever recorded event in the history of the world . It was the 12th day of the 12 month of the year Jiajing 34 in Chinese calendar, when the earthquake occurred . The quake was magnitude 8.0m (MW) and the depth of the quake was unknown . The area was affected by the earthquake, and the area was largely uninhabited by modern-day Shaanx province .

Region of eastern Indonesia on the island of New Guinea . Lying to the west of Papua New Guinea, it is the only Indonesian territory situated in the region . The 1953 Suva earthquake occurred on 14 September at 00:26 UTC near Suva, Fiji, just off the southeast shore of Viti Levu . This earthquake had an estimated magnitude of Ms 6.8 and Mw 6.4 . The earthquake triggered a coral reef platform collapse and a submarine landslide that caused a tsunami . Eight people were reported killed; a wharf, bridges, and buildings were severely damaged in Suva . Fiji lies in a complex tectonic setting along the boundary between the Australian Plate and the Pacific Plate . Colombia is a seismically active country and has a large seismic risk in many areas of its territory due to its location at the boundaries of the Malpelo, Panama, Caribbean, North Andes and South American Plates along the Pacific Ring of Fire . The southeastern and extreme eastern portions of Colombia are not as seismic active as the rest of the country . The first recorded earthquake felt in Colombia occurred on September 11, 1530, around 10:00 AM, probably with the epicentre near Cumaná, Venezuela. The 1979 Ghaenat earthquakes were a series of large earthquakes in Qaen County, Khorasan Province, northeast Iran, near the Afghanistan border . The first mainshock, known as the Korizan earthquake with a surface wave magnitude (Ms ) of 6.6, struck on November 14, while the second, the 7.2 Koli-Boniabad earthquake struck on Nobemver 27 . The 1979 Tumaco earthquake occurred at 02:59 local time on 12 December with a moment magnitude of 8.2 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent) The epicenter was just offshore from the border between Ecuador and Colombia . It triggered a major tsunami, which was responsible for most of the estimated 300–600 deaths . The hardest hit area was Colombia's Nariño Department . The quake damaged $8 million and killed 300-600 people in Colombia and Ecuador . The earthquake triggered a 20-m (20-ft) 20-meter (20ft) tsunami . The damage was estimated to have been $8million and the tsunami killed at least 300,000 .

Island in Indonesia is located in the Lesser Sunda Islands chain, with Lombok to the west, Flores to the east, and Sumba further to the southeast . Traditionally, the island is known as the source of sappanwood, as well as honey and sandalwood . Its savanna-like climate and vast grasslanlanlan are characteristic of the island's savanna style . There have been plans by the Indonesian government to split the island off into a separate province of West Nusa Tenggara, but there have been no plans for the split of the province . The 1980 Azores Island earthquake killed 61 people and injured over 400 in Portugal . Measuring 6.9 on the moment magnitude scale, it also shook the islands of Pico and Faial . A small tsunami was registered in Angra do Heroismo . The earthquake was caused by a strike slip fracture, typical of other historical Azorean earthquakes . In response to the earthquake, Portuguese president António Ramalhoho Eanes announced three days of national mourning, while relief efforts, including aid efforts, were launched in the wake of the earthquake . Izabal is one of the 22 departments of Guatemala . Its coastal areas form part of the homeland of the Garifuna people . The department is bordered to the north by Belize, the north east by the Gulf of Honduras, and to the east by Honduras and by the Guatemalan departments of Petén and Alta Verapa . Izabal (Spanish pronunciation: [isaˈβal) is a department of the Department of Guatemala. Izabal has a population of 408,688,000, with Puerto Barrios having 5.5 government offices . The capital of the capital is the capital of Guatemala's capital, the capital city of the province of Guatemala .

The 1980 Oaxaca earthquake occurred on October 24 at 08:53:36 local time with a moment magnitude of 7.2 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent) The dip-slip shock left up to 300 dead, many injured, and about 150,000 homeless . Damage (totaling $5 million) was focused in the Huajuapan de León region of the state of Oaxac in southern Mexico . Damage was felt throughout southern Mexico and in Guatemala, but damage was focused on the Huajaapan de León region, which is located in Oaxacas . The earthquake was the largest earthquake in the history of Mexico and Mexico .

The oldest rocks in Peru date to the Precambrian and are more than two billion years old . Along the southern coast, granulite and charnockite shows reworking by an ancient orogeny mountain-building event . Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The 2009 Samoa earthquake and tsunami took place on 29 September 2009 in the southern Pacific Ocean adjacent to the Kermadec-Tonga subduction zone . The submarine earthquake occurred in an extensional environment and had a moment magnitude of 8.1 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VI (Strong) It was the largest earthquake of 2009 . A tsunami was generated which caused substantial damage and loss of life in Samoa, American Samoa, and New Zealand . A total of 189 people were killed and hundreds were injured in the earthquake and a tsunami generated by the tsunami . Sindh, Punjab and Azad Jammu & Kashmir provinces lie . on the north-western edge . of the Indian plate in South Asia . The 1881 Nicobar Islands earthquake occurred at about 07:49 local time (01:49 UTC) on 31 December, with an epicentre beneath Car Nicobar . It occurred as two separate ruptures, the largest of which had an estimated magnitude of 7.9 on the moment magnitude scale and triggered a tsunami that was observed around the Bay of Bengal . It is probably the earliest earthquake for which rupture parameters have been estimated instrumentally . The Nicobar islands are a series of volcanic islands that are part of an active volcanic region . The largest of the ruptures was estimated to be a magnitude of 7.9 Mw . The 1982 Flores earthquake struck the island of Flores in Indonesia on December 25, 1982 . Registering a moment magnitude of 5.9, it created landslides and was reportedly accompanied by a tsunami . The earthquake killed 13 people and left 390 injured, also destroying 1,875 houses and 121 other buildings . The villages of Layahong and Oyong Barang were damaged by seven seconds of shaking . Island in Indonesia is located in the Lesser Sunda Islands chain, with Lombok to the west, Flores to the east, and Sumba further to the southeast . Traditionally, the island is known as the source of sappanwood, as well as honey and sandalwood . Its savanna-like climate and vast grasslanlanlan are characteristic of the island's savanna style . There have been plans by the Indonesian government to split the island off into a separate province of West Nusa Tenggara, but there have been no plans for the split of the province . The 1982 Urakawa earthquake is the 7.1 Mj earthquake that occurred off the coast of Urakaw, Japan on March 21, 1982 . The earthquake was the largest earthquake in the history of the region . The epicenter was 42°06′N 142°36′E﻿ / ﻿42.1°N 142.6°E . The quake left 167 people injured and caused casualties and damage in Tomakomai and Sapporo . It was the biggest earthquake in Japan's history, the largest in the region's history of quakes and caused many deaths and damage to land and buildings in Sapporo and Tomakomeomai, Japan . The

1937 Orizaba earthquake occurred on July 26 at 03:47 UTC . It had a magnitude of 7.3 on the surface wave magnitude scale . Thirty four people were reported dead . Damage was reported in Esperanza, Puebla . This was an intraplate earthquake within the subducting Cocos Plate . It occurred near Oozaba, Veracruz, Mexico . It was caused by a subduction of the Cocos plate, which is subducted beneath the surface surface of the surface of a plate . Hungary won the match 10–1, the biggest scoreline in men's FIFA World Cup finals history . Italy lies on the southern extent of the Eurasian Plate, surrounded by the Aegean Sea Plate, the Adriatic Plate, and the Anatolian Plate . The Apennine Mountains contain numerous faults that run along the entire Italian peninsula . Sicily and Calabria are located near the boundary where the African plate is subducting below the . Republic of Albania is a parliamentary parliamentary constitutional republic . Country in Southeastern Europe . Majority of Albanian population is Muslim; 59% Islam, 17% Christianity, 9% No Religion . Country is located in Albania's capital and largest city, Tirana . Republic was declared independence from the Ottoman Empire 28 November 1912 . Republic is based in Tirana, the capital of the country's capital city, and the capital city of Tirana . Albania is one of the most populous countries in the world and has a large population of about 60,000 people . Country has a history of independence, independence, and independence from Europe's most powerful European powers . Albania was declared a republic in 1912 .

The 1982 North Yemen earthquake hit near the city of Dhamar, North Yemen (now part of Yemen) on December 13, 1982 . Measuring 6.2 on the moment magnitude scale, with a maximum perceived intensity of VIII (Severe) on the Mercalli intensity scale, as many as 2,800 people were killed and another 1,500 injured . The shock occurred within several hundred kilometers of a plate boundary in a geologically complex region that includes active volcanoes and seafloor spreading ridges . Yemen has a history of destructive earthquakes, though this was the first instrumentally recorded event to be det detected by instrumentically recorded event in the country's history of quakes .

The 1996 Chimbote earthquake occurred on February 21 at 07:51 local time about 130 km off the coast of northern Peru, near the Peru–Chile Trench . It was an earthquake of magnitude Mw 7.4.4 . The mechanism inferred from data is a low-angle thrust of the Nazca Plate, which is subducting beneath the South American Plate . This earthquake was special in that it generated a disproportionally large tsunami . The 1983 Coalinga earthquake struck at 4:42 p.m. Monday, May 2 of that year, in California . The shock was felt from the greater Los Angeles Area north to Susanville in Lassen County, and between the Pacific Coast and western Nevada . More than 5,000 aftershocks were recorded through July 31, of which 894 had a magnitude of 2.5 or larger . The earthquake measured 6.2 on the moment magnitude scale and had a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (severe) (Severe) The earthquake was felt in the Los Angeles area and Susanville, California . 1983 earthquake and tsunami centered off the coast of Akita Prefecture, Japan . Out of the 104 fatalities, all but four were killed by the resulting tsunami . The 1983 Biga earthquake hit northwestern Turkey on 5 July 1983 . The earthquake measured 6.1 on the surface wave magnitude scale . It shook places as far away as eastern Greece . The United States Geological Survey listed the earthquake among the "Significant Earthquakes of the World" for 1983 . Five people were killed and 26 were injured in the Marmara region of Turkey . The Biga Peninsula is an area marked by active faults including strike-slip movement and en echelon divergent basins . The U.S. Geological Survey said the earthquake was one of the most significant in the world's history of quakes in 1983 and was listed as one of its most significant quakes

The 1964 Alaskan earthquake occurred at 5:36 PM AKST on Good Friday, March 27, 1964 . It was the second most powerful earthquake in recorded history . 131 people were killed in the earthquake . The earthquake caused a tsunami of 67 m (220 ft) at Shoup Bay, Alaska . Total damage was $311 million (1964 USD) and total damage was $311 million in the United States, Canada . It is the second largest earthquake ever recorded in the history of the world's history of quakes, with 9.2 magnitude (6.7 mb) and 9.3 magnitude (9.2 mw) The earthquake was also known as the Great Al

Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The country is well known for its long history of disastrous earthquake activity . It is also known for the waste of valuable natural resources and the deaths of at least 125,000 people since 1900 . The 1952 Severo-Kurilsk earthquake struck off the coast of the Kamchatka Peninsula in Russia . The 9.0 Mw earthquake triggered a major tsunami that hit the Kuril Islands, Sakhalin Oblast, Russian SFSR, USSR, on 4 November 1952 at 16:58 (UTC) This led to the destruction of many settlements and the death toll of 2,336 people . The main impact of the earthquake was that a tsunami of 18m (59ft) was 18 m (59 ft) The earthquake was the sixth most powerful on record; 6th most powerful earthquake on record in Russia, 6th highest on the world's list of quakes .

Serbia is in recent geologic time a part of the Eurasian Plate, but the bedrock lithologies are witness to a diverse geologic history . In a tectonic sense, Serbia is part of an orogenic system that is composed of the Alpine, Carpathian, and Dinaride belts . Its territory can be divided into five geotectonic units of differing genesis . Pannonian Plain, Dinaric Alps occupy western part of Central Serbia, stretching in general northwest-southeast direction .Serbian-Macedonian Massif is a belt stretching in north-south direction along the Great and South Morava valleys, into western North Macedonia and northern Greece (n)

The 1960 Valdivia earthquake was 9.4–9.6 on the moment magnitude scale . It occurred in the afternoon (19:11 GMT, 15:11 local time) and lasted for approximately 10 minutes . The resulting tsunamis affected southern Chile, Hawaii, Japan, the Philippines, and the Philippines . The quake was the most powerful earthquake ever recorded in the history of the Great Chilean earthquake (Gran terremoto de Chile) in 1960 . It was recorded at the time of the earthquake on 22 May 1960 in Valdivia, Chile, Punta Arenas, Iquique, Santiago and Punta Arenas . The earthquake was the largest ever recorded earthquake in the world

The Minahasa Peninsula is the long peninsula in northern Sulawesi, north of the Gulf of Tomini . It stretches north from the central part of the island . The peninsula is one of the four principal peninsulas on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi . The 1983 Erzurum earthquake occurred in northeastern Turkey on 30 October 1983 at 07:12 local time (04:12 UTC) It had a moment magnitude of 6.6 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent) About 1340 people have died and 50 settlements have been demolished by the earthquake . 50 settlements in the provinces of Erzürum and Kars were demolished in the quake . 1668 magnitude 8.5 earthquake in East China not to be confused with 1976 Tangshan earthquake . Quake had cataclysmic implications to the region, shaking intensity was estimated to reach XII (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale, the most destructive shak . Quake was the largest historical earthquake in Eastern China and one of the largest in the world on land . Quake occurred during the rule of the Qing Dynasty somewhere in Shandong Province on July 25 of the year 1668 . Quake killed 42,578–50,000+ people, aftershocks lasted for six years . Quake is the largest earthquake in China's history and is one of world's largest ever recorded quakes .

The 1868 Hawaii earthquake was the largest recorded in the history of Hawaiʻi island . The earthquake occurred at 4 p.m. local time on April 2, 1868 and caused a landslide and tsunami that led to 77 deaths . The aftershock sequence for this event has continued up to the present day . The island of Hawai'i (commonly called the "Big Island") is the currently active volcanic center of the Hawaiian Isle . On December 22, 1983 an earthquake with a magnitude of 6.3 struck northern Guinea, killing around 300 people, and injuring 1,500 . An earthquake of this magnitude was unusual for this region of West Africa, previously believed by most seismologists to be aseismic . The earthquake destroyed 5,000 houses and caused cracks in the ground, and an entire cavern to collapse . The Hindu Kush is an 800-kilometre-long (500 mi) mountain range in Central and South Asia to the west of the Himalayas . It stretches from central and western Afghanistan into northwestern Pakistan and far southeastern Tajikistan . The range forms the western section of the Hindu Kush Himalayan Region (HKH) to the north, nea . The 1984 Morgan Hill earthquake (also Halls Valley earthquake) occurred on April 24 at 1:15 p.m. local time in the Santa Clara Valley of Northern California . The shock had a moment magnitude of 6.2 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) The epicenter was located near Mount Hamilton in the Diablo Range of the California Coast Ranges . This list includes any notable historical earthquakes that have epicenters within the current boundaries of Turkey . This list is incomplete . Turkey is a seismically active area within the complex zone of collision between the Eurasian Plate and both the African and Arabian Plates . Much of the country lies on the Anatolian Plate, a small plate bounded by two major strike-slip fault zones . The western part of Turkey is also affected by the zone of the North and East Anolian Fault . Seismic hazard is a major concern for the country's geology and geology of the region . An earthquake occurred off the northern coast of the Kamchatka Peninsula in the USSR, present-day Russia . The earthquake had a surface wave magnitude (Ms ) of 6.8 to 7.3 and an estimated moment magnitude (Mw) of 8.2 Mw[4] This event came just two months after a slightly larger Mw  8.4 earthquake, with the epicenter south of the April event, struck the area . Both earthquakes were tsunamigenic althth, and the death toll from the 1923 event was 36, with most of the victims being killed by a 30-metre-magnitude tsunami of up to 30 meters .

The 1839 Martinique earthquake occurred on the morning of January 11 with an estimated magnitude of 7.8 Ms , the largest in the Lesser Antilles since 1690 . The maximum intensity of this earthquake was assigned IX on both the Mercalli and MSK intensity scales, which left the cities of Saint-Pierre and Fort Royal almost completely destroyed . Garuda Indonesia is Indonesia's flag-carrier airline . It was founded in 1947 as KLM Interinsulair Bedrijf . The airline is based in Soekarno–Hatta International Airport, Tangerang, Banten, Indonesia . It has a fleet of 112 destinations and has a frequent-flyer program . Its revenues are US$4.57 billion (Rp74.53 trillion) (2019) and operating income is US$1.2 billion (US$2.5 billion) Garuda is one of Indonesia's largest airlines . It is the largest carrier in the world, with a fleet fleet of 112 destinations .

China has been the location of some of the most deadly earthquakes in history . Hundreds of thousands of people were killed by magnitude 8.0 earthquakes in 1303 in Hongdong and 1556 in Shaanxi . Honiara is the capital and largest city of the Solomon Islands . It is situated on the northwestern coast of Guadalcanal . As of 2017, it had a population of 84,520 people . The South American Plate is moving over the Nazca Plate at a rate of 77mm (3.0in) per year . The same process has caused the rise of the Andes mountain range and the creation of the Peru–Chile Trench, as well as volcanism in the Peruvian highlands . The oldest rocks in Peru date to the Precambrian and are more than two billion years old . Along the southern coast, granulite and charnockite shows reworking by an ancient orogeny mountain-building event . The 2005 Kashmir earthquake occurred at 08:50:39 Pakistan Standard Time on 8 October in Pakistani-administered Azad Kashmir . It was the first major earthquake in South Asia since the 1555 Kashmir earthquake . It killed 86,000–87,351 people and displaced 2.8 million people . Aftershocks were followed by 6.4 Mw aftershocks of magnitude 7.6 and 5.9 Mw . Quake occurred in Pakistan, India, Afghanistan, Tajikistan, Pakistan, Afghanistan and Afghanistan . Quake was the largest earthquake in the world since the 1885 Kashmir earthquake, when it occurred in 1885 and 1885,000 people were killed in the same region .

It has a height of 936 m (3,070 ft) and an average daytime temperature of 22.7 ° C (72.86 °F) With a population of 10,800, it is the largest population center of the Sierra de Falcán, measured in the 2000 census . One of its most traded dairy products is its reputed cheese, but also has mineral resources such as clay and s clay . This list includes any notable historical earthquakes that have epicenters within the current boundaries of Turkey . This list is incomplete . Turkey is a seismically active area within the complex zone of collision between the Eurasian Plate and both the African and Arabian Plates . Much of the country lies on the Anatolian Plate, a small plate bounded by two major strike-slip fault zones . The western part of Turkey is also affected by the zone of the North and East Anolian Fault . Seismic hazard is a major concern for the country's geology and geology of the region . The 1986 Vrancea earthquake killed more than 150 people, injured over 500, and damaged over 50,000 homes . The second largest earthquake in the area since the modernization of earthquake monitoring devices, it was felt north to Poland and south to Italy and Greece . Pakistan is one of the most seismically active countries in the world . Earthquakes in Pakistan occur often and are destructive . Balochistan, the Federally Administered Tribal Areas, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Gilgit-Baltistan provinces lie on the southern edge of the Eurasian Plate on the Iranian Plateau . Sindh, Punjab and Azad Jammu & Kashmir provinces lie . on the north-western edge . of the Indian plate in South Asia . This region is prone to violent earthquakes, as the two tectonic plates collide . Pakistan geologically overlaps both the . Eurasian and Indian plates . The largest earthquake was 8.1 Mw 1945 Baloch

Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . The 1998 Papua New Guinea earthquake occurred on July 17 with a moment magnitude of 7.0 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) The event occurred on a reverse fault near the north coast region of PNG, 25 kilometers (16 mi) from the coast near Aitape . The event caused a large undersea landslide which caused a tsunami that hit the coast, killing between at least 2,183 and 2,700 people and injuring thousands . The 1987 Edgecumbe earthquake measured 6.5 on the moment magnitude scale and struck the Bay of Plenty region of New Zealand at 1:42pm on 2 March . It was the most damaging earthquake New Zealand had experienced since the 1968 Inangahua earthquake . The epicentre was 2.24 kilometres (1.39 mi) south-south-east of the town of Matata, and 15 kilometres (9.3 mi) north-north-west of Edgeumbe, on the Rangitaiki Plains . The 1987 Ecuador earthquakes occurred over a six-hour period on March 6 . The sequence of shocks measured 6.7, 7.1, and 6.0 on the moment magnitude scale . Miyazaki is the capital city of Miyazaki Prefecture on the island of Kyushu in Japan . The city was founded on April 1, 1924 . As of 1 June 2019, the city had an estimated population of 398,215 and a population density of 619 persons per person . The Philippines lies along the Pacific Ring of Fire, which causes frequent seismic and volcanic activity . Many earthquakes of smaller magnitude occur very regularly due to the meeting of major tectonic plates in the region . The largest was the 1918 Celebes Sea earthquake with Mw8.3.0 . The 1976 Moro Gulf earthquake killed 5,000–8,000 people . Largest earthquake in the Philippines was the 18th-19th-century Celebes Sea quake, the largest in the country, with a magnitude of 8.3 . The country lies on the Pacific Rim of Fire and is located near the Philippines' southern tip of the U.S.-Pacific Ocean .

The 2013 Solomon Islands earthquake struck northeast of Australia on 6 February with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) Its epicenter was the Solomon Islands, at the boundaries of the Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, causing local evacuations and a tsunami of 1.5 m (4.9 ft) and killing at least nine people . Aftershocks were also felt in the region, with a total of 20 aftershocks of around 20,000 occurring during the event . The 1877 Iquique earthquake occurred at 21:16 local time on 9 May (0:59 on 10 May UTC) It had a magnitude of 8.5 on the surface wave magnitude scale . The 1868 Arica earthquake occurred on 13 August 1868, near Arica, then part of Peru, now part of Chile, at 21:30 UTC . It had an estimated magnitude between 8.5–9.0 Mw (est.) A tsunami (or multiple tsunamis) in the Pacific Ocean was produced by the earthquake, which was recorded in Hawaii, Japan, Australia, and New Zealand . The USS Wateree beached at Arica 430 yards (390 m) inland . A total of 25,000 people were killed in the 1868 earthquake and tsunami . The earthquake was centered in Peru and northern Chile, which is now in the region of Chile and Peru

The Porto San Giorgio Altarpiece was a 1470 multi-panel tempera and gold on panel altarpiece by Carlo Crivelli . The work was a fundamental step in his evolution away from the Paduan Renaissance towards a more delicate and realist style . It was split up in the 19th century and sold in separate lots, meaning its panels are now split between a number of European and American museums . The 1949 Ambato earthquake was the largest earthquake in the Western Hemisphere in more than five years . It struck Ecuador's Tungurahua Province southeast of its capital Ambato and killed 5,050 people . Measuring 6.4 on the Ms scale, it originated from a hypocenter 15 km[3] beneath the surface . The nearby villages of Guano, Patate, Pelileo, and Pillaro were destroyed, and the city of Ambato suffered heavy damage . The earthquake flattened buildings and subsequent landslides caused damage throughout the Tunguahua, Chimborazo, and Cotopaxi Provinces . It disrupted water mains and disrupted water supplies .

Santiago de Chuco Province is one of twelve provinces of the La Libertad Region in Peru . The province is divided into eight districts . Series of earthquakes in Alaska, USA, USA were recorded in September 1899 . The most powerful of these occurred on September 10 at about noon, local time . The area was sparsely populated and no fatalities were recorded, but the earthquakes were notable for the degree of elevation recorded, up to 47 feet, and for the effects on the glaciers in the region . Fieldwork on the effects of the earthquake was carried out between 1905 and 1910, and a    study was conducted in 1905 to find out the effects the earthquake had on the region's glaciers . The earthquakes occurred in the area around Yakutat Bay, Alaska, which was uplifted by 47 feet in the 1899 earthquakes . No fatalities

The 2012 Chiba earthquake occurred along the northeastern coast of Chiba Prefecture, Japan at 21:05 JST (12:05 UTC) on Wednesday, 14 March 2012 . The shallow magnitude 6.1 Mj earthquake produced considerable shaking inland through much of the Bōsō Peninsula and lower Ibaraki Prefecture . It occurred as a result of normal faulting in a seismically quiet region, possibly in response to the magnitude 9.0 Mw 2011 Tōhoku ea . The epicentre lay just offshore near Chōshi city, but the earthquake produced significant shaking inland . The earthquake killed 1 people and injured 1 others, with most of them seriously injured .

The Dasht-e Bayaz and Ferdows earthquakes occurred in Iran in late August and early September 1968 . The mainshock measured 7.4 on the moment magnitude scale and had a maximum perceived intensity of X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . Damage was heavy in the affected areas with thousands of lives lost in the first event and many hundreds more in the second strong event . The Iranian plateau is confined by the Turan platf and is confined to the Alborz and Caspian Depression . The 1994 Mindoro earthquake had a moment magnitude of 7.1 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong) It is associated with a 35 kilometer-long ground rupture, called the Aglubang River fault . The 1988 Nepal earthquake occurred in Nepal near the Indian border and affected much of northern Bihar . The magnitude 6.9 earthquake shook the region on August 21, killing at least 709 persons and injuring thousands . The earthquake struck in two installments of 10 seconds and 15 seconds each and left cracks in 50,000 buildings, including Raj Bhavan and the old Secretariat Building in Patna, Bihar . At least 1,450 people were killed and 6,553 injured in the earthquake, including 709 people who were injured in two separate installments of 15 seconds and 10 seconds each . Sarah Palin is the 29th Governor of Alaska . She was elected to office in 2006 and 2009 . She has been married to Todd Palin since 1988 . She is also a member of the Wasilla City Council from Ward E . Sarah Palin was a candidate for Vice President of the United States in 2008 . She served as Alaska's 9th and 29th Governor Frank Murkowski in the 1990s . Her husband Todd Palin is a former Governor of the State of Alaska from 2007 to 2009 . The Mona Passage (Spanish: Canal de la Mona) is a strait that separates the islands of Hispaniola and Puerto Rico . The 80 mi stretch of sea between the two islands is one of the most difficult passages in the Caribbean . It is fraught with variable tidal currents created by the large islands on either side of it, and by sand banks that extend out for many miles from both coasts . The strait connects the Atlantic Ocean to the Caribbean Sea, and is an important shipping route between the Atlantic and the Panama Canal . The island is Hispaniola, Puerto Rico, Dominican Republic, Lesser Antilles and the Dominican Republic . See als for more information on the Mona

The following is a list of the prominent or destructive earthquakes occurring in the Azores, or affecting the populace of the archipelago . The list includes the 16th century Vila Franca earthquake, the 18th century "Caída da Praia" earthquake and the 20th century São Miguel earthquake . The 1998 Ribeirinha earthquake was the first major earthquake to hit the islands . The Azores are the most uninhabited region of the world, with many of the islands being located in the region . The islands have been hit by earthquakes in the past, with the most destructive being the 1837 Graciosa earthquake in 1837 and the 1852 Horta earthquake .

The 1988 Saguenay earthquake struck Quebec, Canada with a moment magnitude of 5.9 on November 25 . It is one of the largest recorded earthquakes in eastern Canada and eastern North America during the 20th century . The earthquake was felt by millions, and damaged some buildings . It could be felt as far as Toronto, Halifax, and Boston . The quake was triggered by faults associated with the Saguanay Graben . It was one of Canada's largest ever recorded quakes in 20th-century history, and one of its largest ever to hit Canada and the U.S. It was also one of North America's largest quakes ever recorded in the history of quakes .

The 1988 Armenian earthquake, also known as the Spitak earthquake, occurred on December 7 at 11:41 local time with a surface wave magnitude of 6.8 and a maximum MSK intensity of X (Devastating) The shock occurred in the northern region of Armenia (then par par par with the Soviet Union) The earthquake killed 38,000 people, with 31,000 injured and 5,000 aftershocks of 5.8 ML . The surface wave of the earthquake was centered in Nalband, Armenian SSR, Soviet Union (present-day Shirakamut, Lori Province, Armenia)'s Spitak . The Molucca Sea (Indonesian: Laut Maluku) is located in the western Pacific Ocean, around the vicinity of Indonesia . It is bordered by the Indonesian Islands of Celebes (Sulawesi) to the west, Halmahera to the east, and the Sula Islands to the south . It has a total surface area of 77,000 square miles (200,000 km) and has a Max. depth of 4,810 m (15,781 ft) It is rich in coral and has many diving sites due to the deepness of its waters . Turkey is a seismically active area within the complex zone of collision between the Eurasian Plate and both the African and Arabian Plates . Much of the country lies on the Anatolian Plate, a small plate bounded by two major strike-slip fault zones . The western part of Turkey is also affected by the zone of the North and East Anolian Fault . Seismic hazard is a major concern for the country's geology and geology of the region . Papua New Guinea is located near the geologically-active Pacific Ring of Fire . No major damage or deaths have been reported from the earthquakes . Landslides and a dozen homes collapsed in a series of aftershocks in the past . Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The country is well known for its long history of disastrous earthquake activity . It is also known for the waste of valuable natural resources and the deaths of at least 125,000 people since 1900 . The HonourableHenry Puna is the current Prime Minister of the Cook Islands . He is also the 10th Secretary General of the Pacific Islands Forum . He has served as the 11th Prime Minister . He was succeeded by Meg Taylor in 2010 . The Cook Islands are the most populous and most populous of the islands in the Pacific . They are the largest and most populated of the island chain in the world, with many of the largest economies in the region . 1721 catastrophic earthquake centered near Tabriz, Iran . Magnitude7.7 Ms . Quake leveled some three-quarters of the city, and resulted in the deaths of tens of thousands of people . Quake was popularly interpreted as an omen of misfortune or a demonstration of godly wrath . The destruction that the earthquake caused was a significant factor in the successful Ottoman takeover of Tabriz in 1725, as well as contributory factors to the successful takeover of the town of Iran in the 1725 . The 1556 Shaanxi earthquake, or Huaxian earthquake, is the deadliest earthquake in recorded history . It occurred on the morning of 23 January 1556, during the Ming dynasty . According to imperial records, approximately 830,000 people lost their lives . The earthquake was the deadliest ever recorded event in the history of the world . It was the 12th day of the 12 month of the year Jiajing 34 in Chinese calendar, when the earthquake occurred . The quake was magnitude 8.0m (MW) and the depth of the quake was unknown . The area was affected by the earthquake, and the area was largely uninhabited by modern-day Shaanx province .

The Philippines lies along the Pacific Ring of Fire, which causes frequent seismic and volcanic activity . Many earthquakes of smaller magnitude occur very regularly due to the meeting of major tectonic plates in the region . The largest was the 1918 Celebes Sea earthquake with Mw8.3.0 . The 1976 Moro Gulf earthquake killed 5,000–8,000 people . Largest earthquake in the Philippines was the 18th-19th-century Celebes Sea quake, the largest in the country, with a magnitude of 8.3 . The country lies on the Pacific Rim of Fire and is located near the Philippines' southern tip of the U.S.-Pacific Ocean .

The 1990 Bohol Sea earthquake occurred on February 8, 1990 at 15:15:32 (UTC +8) The earthquake had a magnitude of 6.8 on the moment magnitude scale and VII (Very strong) on the Modified Mercalli intensity scale . Most of the damage was observed in the province of Bohol and the island of Camiguin . There were 6 deaths, over 200 injuries and an estimated ₱15 million ($7 million) in damage . The Lenin Peak disaster occurred on 13 July 1990 when 43 climbers were killed during an avalanche on the 7,134-meter-high mountain peak in northeast Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan . The deadly avalanche was triggered by the 1990 Hundu Kush earthquake; a moment magnitude 6.4 earthquake which struck at a depth of 216.8 km beneath the Hindu Kush mountains in neighbouring Afghanistan . The incident is believed to be the deadliest mountaineering disaster in history, with 43 climbers dead and two injured in the disaster . The Minahasa Peninsula is the long peninsula in northern Sulawesi, north of the Gulf of Tomini . It stretches north from the central part of the island . The peninsula is one of the four principal peninsulas on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi . Active tectonics of Ecuador is dominated by the effects of the subduction of the Nazca Plate beneath the South American Plate . Ecuador lies within the Northern Volcanic Zone . The subduction zone is moving at a rate of 7cm/yr to the east-northeast, significantly oblique to the trend of this segment of the Andes . The active tectonic zone has an overall dip of 25–30°, but varies rapidly along strike due to effects of subduction of the Carnegie Ridge . The 1879 Gansu earthquake occurred at about 04:00 local time on 1 July . It had an estimated magnitude of 8.0 on the Ms scale and a maximum perceived intensity of XI (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The earthquake may have been caused by movement on the SSW-NNE trending Fanjiaba-Linjiang Fault . It caused widespread damage and killed an estimated 22,000 people, mostly from landslides and foreshocks . The meizoseismal area extends 70 km in a SSW/NNE direction and is 30 km across . The epicenter was in Wudu District, close to the border with Sichuan

Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . Myanmar is one of the most seismically active regions in the world . Oblique subduction, block rotation, and a transform margin has been responsible for the seismic activities of the country . The Sagaing Fault is one the largest sources of earthquakes in the country, having produced deadly quakes in the past centuries . The Shan Plateau is another source of earthquakes, hosting many active strike-slip faults that accommodate block rotation of the Sunda Plate . The 2004 earthquake was the largest earthquake in Myanmar, with a magnitude of 6.0 magnitude of magnitude 9.0 in the region . Rioja is the capital of Rioja Province in the San Martín Region in northern Peru . There are 24,263 inhabitants according to the 2007 census . The town is 848 metres above sea level and has a semi-humid subtropical climate . It is situated to the west of Moyobamba and is located in Rioja District . Badakhshan Province is one of the 34 provinces of Afghanistan . It is located in the northeastern part of the country . The Hindu Kush is an 800-kilometre-long (500 mi) mountain range in Central and South Asia to the west of the Himalayas . It stretches from central and western Afghanistan into northwestern Pakistan and far southeastern Tajikistan . The range forms the western section of the Hindu Kush Himalayan Region (HKH) to the north, nea . Battle of Tskhinvali was part of the Russo-Georgian War . Russian and South Ossetian forces won the battle 8-11 August 2008 . Georgian forces withdrew fully from the city . Russian forces were outnumbered by Georgian forces 10,000–11,000, including special forces . North Ossetia was a Russian battalion serving as peacekeepers at the time of the battle . The battle took place in August 2008, during the war between Russia and Georgia . It was the first major battle of the war to take place in the region since the fall of the Soviet Union in 1991 . The 1812 Caracas earthquake measured 7.7 on the Richter magnitude scale . It caused extensive damage in Caracas, La Guaira, Barquisimeto, San Felipe, and Mérida . An estimated 15,000–20,000 people perished as a result of the earthquake . The seismic movement was so significant that in a zone named Valecillo, a new lake was formed and the river Yurubí was dammed up. Numerous rivulets changed their course in the Caracas valley, which was flooded with dirty water . The following is a list of notable earthquakes and tsunamis which had their epicenter in areas that are now part of the United States . The latter affecting areas of the U.S.  Those in italics were not part of United States at the time of the event . The list includes notable earthquakes, including those in the Aleutian Islands, Alaska and the Cascadia earthquakes, which occurred in 1755, 1755 and 1812 . The most recent earthquake in California was December 8, 1812, and Ventura, 1823, and Kilauea, Hawaii were the most recent in the list of major earthquakes and tsunami events in the country's history of the past .

Only earthquakes with a magnitude of 6.0 or greater are listed, except for a few that had a moderate impact . Aftershocks are not included, unless they were of great significance or contributed to a death toll, such as the M 6.3 2011 Christchurch earthquake and the M 7.3 aftershock to the 1931 Hawke's Bay earthquake . Earthquakes occur frequently in New Zealand as the country is situated in the collision zone between the Indo-Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, part of the Pacific Basin Ring of Fire, where many earthquakes and volcanoes occur . Most events occur along the main ranges running from Fiord to Fiord, New Zealand's main fault lines .

The 1917 Guatemala earthquake was a sequence of tremors that lasted from 17 November 1917 through 24 January 1918 . They almost completely destroyed Guatemala City and severely damaged the ruins in Antigua Guatemala that had survived the 1773 Guatemala earthquakes . 250 people were killed in the earthquake, mostly in Guatemala City . The seismic activity started on November 17, 1917 and ruined several settlements around Amatitlán . Aftershocks occurred on 25 and 29 December of the same year, and on January 25, 1917 . The earthquake was centered 15°19′N 89°06′W.1°W﻿ / ﻿15.32°N 89.32 ; -89.32;

The 1992 Flores earthquake and tsunami occurred on December 12 on the island of Flores in Indonesia . With a magnitude of 7.8 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe), it was the largest and also the deadliest earthquake in 1992 . At least 2,500 people were killed or missing near Flores, including 1,49 people who were missing . The 1992 Roermond earthquake occurred on 13 April, around 3:20 AM (1:20 UTC) with a moment magnitude of 5.3 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) Striking on the Peel Boundary Fault, it was the strongest recorded earthquake in the Netherlands and in Northwestern Europe . A series of aftershocks followed, with one person dead and 46 injured . The earthquake caused substantial damage to older buildings in Netherlands and adjacent countries of Belgium and Germany . It is the strongest earthquake recorded in Europe and is the most powerful in the region, striking on a normal fault near the Dutch town of Roelmond, and causing significant damage to buildings in Belgium and

The 1992 Cape Mendocino earthquakes (or 1992 Petrolia earthquakes) occurred along the Lost Coast of Northern California on April 25 and 26 . The three largest events were the M7.2 thrust mainshock that struck near the unincorporated community of Petrolia midday on April 26 and two primary strike-slip aftershocks measuring 6.5 and 6.6 that followed early the next  the next day . Total damage was $48.3–75 million, with 98–356 injuries, and total earthquake damage estimated at $50.3 to $75 million . The earthquake occurred near San Francisco, Eureka and Monterey, California .

The 2008 Kyrgyzstan earthquake struck on October 5 at 21:52 local time (15:52 UTC) with a moment magnitude of 6.6 . The center of the earthquake was near the town of Nura, which was destroyed in the quake . The shock destroyed donzens of buildings in the area and destroyed the nearby village of Kura . Minor damage also occurred in nearby Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region . A magnitude 5.7 aftershock in Xinjiang followed the earthquake . The 1897 Mindanao earthquakes occurred on September 20, 1897 and September 21, 1897 . The earthquakes were originally given estimated magnitudes of 8.6 and 8.7 on the surface wave magnitude scale by Charles Richter . The estimated epicentres of the two earthquakes are identical, lying just off the southwestern coast of Mindanaos in the Philippines, south of Basilan island . With few exceptions, all the masonry buildings in Zamboanga and Basilan were left in ruins.[4] Both earthquakes triggained a magnitude of 7.4 and 7.5 Ms, respectively, and both were reported to have been very strong or very strong . The 1992 Kohat earthquake struck Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province in Pakistan on May 20, 1992 . The Mw  6.3 earthquake inflicted significant damage in the nearby city Kohat . An estimated 36 people died and 100 were injured in the Peshawar and Kohat districts . Four-hundred (400) homes were wiped out, affecting 2,100 residents in the region . Cuba is located in an area with several active fault systems which produce on average about 2000 seismic events each year . The island has been struck by a number of destructive earthquakes over the past four centuries, including several major quakes with a magnitude of 7.0 or above . 70% of seismic activity in Cuba emanates from the Oriente fault zone, located in the Bartlett-Cayman fault system which runs along the south-eastern coast of Cuba and marks the tectonic boundary between the North American Plate and the Caribbean Plate . The 2013 Solomon Islands earthquake struck northeast of Australia on 6 February with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) Its epicenter was the Solomon Islands, at the boundaries of the Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, causing local evacuations and a tsunami of 1.5 m (4.9 ft) and killing at least nine people . Aftershocks were also felt in the region, with a total of 20 aftershocks of around 20,000 occurring during the event . Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The country is well known for its long history of disastrous earthquake activity . It is also known for the waste of valuable natural resources and the deaths of at least 125,000 people since 1900 . The Hokuriku region was located in the northwestern part of Honshu, the main island of Japan . It lay along the Sea of Japan within the Chūbu region, which it is currently a part of . It is almost equivalent to Koshi Province and Hokurikudō area in pre-modern Japan . Since the Heian period until the Edo period the region was a core recipient of population, the population grew to be much larger proportionately than it is today, despite the rural character . Earthquakes in Fiji are infrequent and sometimes accompanied by tsunami . The group of islands are positioned at the Australian–Pacific plate margin . The inclusion criteria for adding events are based on WikiProject Earthquakes' notability guideline that was developed for stand alone articles . The principles described also apply to lists. China has been the location of some of the most deadly earthquakes in history . Hundreds of thousands of people were killed by magnitude 8.0 earthquakes in 1303 in Hongdong and 1556 in Shaanxi . The 1950 Assam–Tibet earthquake is the largest recorded earthquake in China . In 2008 the magnitude 7.9 2008 Sichuan earthquake killed more than 87,000 people . The collision of India with the rest of Asia has led to seismic activity throughout western China . However these regions in comparison with Eastern China have a low population density . The South American Plate is moving over the Nazca Plate at a rate of 77mm (3.0in) per year . The same process has caused the rise of the Andes mountain range and the creation of the Peru–Chile Trench, as well as volcanism in the Peruvian highlands . The oldest rocks in Peru date to the Precambrian and are more than two billion years old . Along the southern coast, granulite and charnockite shows reworking by an ancient orogeny mountain-building event . They occurred where the Pacific Plate subducts under the Okhotsk Plate at the Kuril–Kamchatka Trench . The depth of the trench at the point of the earthquakes is 7,000–7,500 m. Most events occur along the main ranges running from Fiord to Fiord, New Zealand's main fault lines .

The 1993 Klamath Falls earthquakes took place on September 20, 1993 . The doublet earthquake registered respective magnitudes of 6.0 and 5.9 on the moment magnitude scale . The earthquakes were located at a depth of 5.6 miles (9km) and tremors continued to be felt more than three months after the initial shocks . Total damage of $10 million was caused by the earthquakes . The earthquake was the largest in the history of seismic activity in the United States since the Second Century of the Earth's Tectonic Era of Tectonics and previous activity . This article is about the Nepal earthquake that took place on 13 April 2015 . For the major aftershock on 12 May 2015, see May 2015 Nepal earthquake . The April 2015 earthquake (also known as the Gorkha earthquake) killed 8,964 people and injured 21,952 injured . Aftershocks of 4 Mw and above as of 24 May 2016 have been followed by459 aftershocks since the April 2015 quake . Total damage was $280 million–1.3 billion . 9,748 people were killed and 30,000 injured in the earthquake . The 2003 Bachu earthquake occurred on 24 February at 10:03 local time in the Xinjiang Autonomous Region in northwest China . The epicentre was located 105 km east of Kashgar and 310 km west of Aksu . At least 261 people died as a result of the earthquake, and more than 4,000 were injured . Almost 10,000 homes were levelled by the earthquake . A further 5 people were killed in powerful aftershocks which occurred on 26 February 2003 . The earthquake occurred near to the town of Jiashi and Bachu County, about 105 km from Kashgar in Xinjiang . It was the first earthquake to occur in the region since the 1960s

The 1994 Java earthquake occurred on June 3 at 01:17:37 local time on June 2, at 18:17 GMT off the coast of Indonesia . The epicenter was off the eastern part of the southern Java coast, near the east end of the Java Trench . The earthquake occurred with a moment magnitude of 7.8 in a region which is characterized as having a weak seismic coupling . The tsunami reached Java and Bali, with runups up to 14 m (46 ft) on the island of Bali . 250 people were killed in the earthquake, mostly in Java and the southern part of Indonesia, in which the earthquake was classified as a tsunami earthquake . The 1994 Liwa earthquake occurred on February 16 at 00:07 local time . It was located in southern Sumatra, Indonesia . The magnitude of the earthquake was put at Mw 6.9, Mw  7.0, or Ms 7.2, according to different sources . The earthquake caused 207 deaths and 2000 injuries . Six-thousand buildings were damaged or destroyed by landslides in the Liwa area . There was damage from landslides, mudslides, and fires in Lampung Province . Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The country is well known for its long history of disastrous earthquake activity . It is also known for the waste of valuable natural resources and the deaths of at least 125,000 people since 1900 . The 1994 Taiwan Strait earthquake occurred on 16 September 1994, at 14:20 local time (06:20 UTC) in the southern Taiwan Strait . The magnitude of this earthquake was given as Mw 6.8 by USGS[1] and Ms 7.3 by Fujian Seismological Bureau . The epicenter was located about 150 to 180 km from the coast of the border of Guangdong and Fujian, and about 150 km southwest of Taiwan . The earthquake occurred in the transition zone from the continental margin to the continent-ocean transitional crust . The Kuril Islands dispute, known as the Northern Territories dispute in Japan, is a territorial dispute between Japan and the Russian Federation over the ownership of the four southernmost Kuril islands . The islands are a chain of islands that stretch between the Japanese island of Hokkaido at their southern end and Russian Kamchatka Peninsula at their northern end . The four disputed islands are Habomai Islands, Shikotan, Kunashiri (Kunashir) and Etorofu (Iturup) Southern Kuril Island seen from the International Space Station . Since 1945 all islands northeast of Japan have been administered by Russia . The dispute is over sovereignty of the southernmost of the Kur

The 1994 Kuril Islands earthquake – also known as the Hokkaido Toho-oki earthquake – occurred on October 5 at 00:23:00 local time . The magnitude of this earthquake was put at Mw8.3, or MJMA8.1 . The epicenter was located at about 70 km east of Shikotan Island . The shaking and tsunami caused road and building damage . At least 10 people were reported dead . The earthquake was an intra-slab earthquake within the Pacific Plate which is subducting beneath the surface . The quake was caused by a subducted subduction of the Earth's Pacific Plate, and caused a tsunami of magnitude 8.3

The 1994 Mindoro earthquake had a moment magnitude of 7.1 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong) It is associated with a 35 kilometer-long ground rupture, called the Aglubang River fault . Seventy eight people were reported dead and 7,566 houses were damaged . The earthquake generated a tsunami and landslides on the Verde Island Passage, a strait separating Luzon and Mindoro . The epicenter of this earthquake was located in the Ver de Island Passage . Earthquake in Japan on January 17, 1995, was 6.9 Mw . Total damage was $200 billion (USD) and 5,502-6,434 people were killed and 43,792 injured . The quake was the largest earthquake in Japan ever recorded in the history of the Great Hanshin earthquake . The earthquake was centered in the city of Kobe, Japan, and measured at 6.6m (km) Its depth was 17.6km (10.9m) The earthquake occurred in Japan at the same time as the 9/11/11 earthquake in the U.S. It was the first major earthquake to strike in Japan since 1964, with a magnitude of 6.

Colombia is a seismically active country and has a large seismic risk in many areas of its territory due to its location at the boundaries of the Malpelo, Panama, Caribbean, North Andes and South American Plates along the Pacific Ring of Fire . The southeastern and extreme eastern portions of Colombia are not as seismic active as the rest of the country . The first recorded earthquake felt in Colombia occurred on September 11, 1530, around 10:00 AM, probably with the epicentre near Cumaná, Venezuela. The 1222 Cyprus earthquake occurred at about 06:15 UTC on 11 May . It had an estimated magnitude of 7.0–7.5 and triggered a tsunami that was recorded in Libya and Alexandria . The strongest shaking was felt in Nicosia, Limassol and Paphos . Many people died, although there are no estimates for the total number of casualties . The estimated location of the earthquake is on the southwestern coast of Cyprus and is thought to be associated with the Cyprus arc . The Cyprus arc is part of the plate boundary zone that accommodates the motion of the African Plate relative to the Anatolian Plate . The relative motion of this plate is that of the . African Plate

The 1981 Irian Jaya earthquake killed more than 300 people in Indonesia . The earthquake was recorded as a moment magnitude of 6.7 . The quake occurred in eastern Indonesia on January 19, 1981 . Indonesia is one of the most seismically active places in the world, with a subduction zone and many faults . Such earthquakes pose a significant threat to life in the area through earthquakes and also tsunamis . The 1981 earthquake was registered as a magnitude of 6.7 and registered as an earthquake at 4°35′S 139°14′E.23°E﻿ / ﻿4.58°S 139.58; 139.23 °E＼

The 1964 Niigata earthquake struck at 13:01 local time (04:01 UTC) on 16 June with a magnitude of either 7.5 or 7.6 . The epicenter was on the continental shelf off the northwest coast of Honshu, Japan . The earthquake caused liquefaction over large parts of the city, killing 36 people and injuring more than 400 . The quake was centered about 38°22′N 139°13′E﻿ / ﻿38.37°N 139.22°E - or 38.37; 139.37 ; . It was located about 50 kilometres (31 mi) north of city of Niigata .

The 2009 Samoa earthquake and tsunami took place on 29 September 2009 in the southern Pacific Ocean adjacent to the Kermadec-Tonga subduction zone . The submarine earthquake occurred in an extensional environment and had a moment magnitude of 8.1 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VI (Strong) It was the largest earthquake of 2009 . A tsunami was generated which caused substantial damage and loss of life in Samoa, American Samoa, and New Zealand . A total of 189 people were killed and hundreds were injured in the earthquake and a tsunami generated by the tsunami . The 1995 Neftegorsk earthquake occurred on 28 May at 1:04 local time[4] on northern Sakhalin Island in the Russian Far East . It was the most destructive earthquake known within the current territory of Russia . 1,989 of its 3,977 citizens were killed, and another 750 injured . 90% of the victims were killed by the collapse of 17 five-story residential buildings . The 1879 Gansu earthquake occurred at about 04:00 local time on 1 July . It had an estimated magnitude of 8.0 on the Ms scale and a maximum perceived intensity of XI (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The earthquake may have been caused by movement on the SSW-NNE trending Fanjiaba-Linjiang Fault . It caused widespread damage and killed an estimated 22,000 people, mostly from landslides and foreshocks . The meizoseismal area extends 70 km in a SSW/NNE direction and is 30 km across . The epicenter was in Wudu District, close to the border with Sichuan

The 2007 Tocopilla earthquake occurred on November 14 at 12:40:50 local time . The earthquake had a moment magnitude of 7.7 and lasted about 3 minutes and 35 seconds . Seventeen aftershocks of magnitude greater than 5.3, including one of magnitude 7.1 and two others of magnitude 6.3 or higher, were recorded . The quake killed 2 people and injured 65 others, with a tsunami of 25.5 cm (10-cm) in the area .

The 1995 Guerrero earthquake occurred on September 14, 1995, at 14:04 UTC (08:04 local time) The earthquake had a magnitude of Mw 7.4, with the epicenter being located in the state of Guerrero, Mexico . The earthquake could be felt strongly along the coast from Michoacán to Chiapas . The intensity in Copala reached MM VII (very strong) in the intensity of the earthquake . Three people were reported dead, with many houses with adobe of poor quality suffering heavier damage . It was an interplate earthquake. The 1995 Dinar earthquake occurred on 1 October in Dinar (District), Afyonkarahisar, Turkey . It had an Mw magnitude of 6.2[3] with an epicenter close to the Dinar-Çivril fault . The earthquake occurred at a time of political instability in Turkey, with large strikes by public sector workers taking place just 11 days earlier . The disaster was preceded by a number of smaller earthquakes of up to 5.1 magnitude, the last of which had occurred on 26 September 1995 . The 1995 Kerinci earthquake struck near Sungai Penuh in Jambi Province on the island of Sumatra, Indonesia . The earthquake measured 6.8 Mw on the surface wave magnitude scale and 6.9–7.0 Ms on the moment magnitude scale . Between 84 and possibly 100 people were killed in the earthquake . An extimated 4,000 buildings collapsed or were seriously damaged while a further 5,000 suffered some damage . 2,073 people were injured in the quake, which occurred at 02:18 WIB (UTC +7) local time on October 7 at 2:18 a.m. local time in Sumatra .
