The 1960 Valdivia earthquake was 9.4–9.6 on the moment magnitude scale . It occurred in the afternoon (19:11 GMT, 15:11 local time) and lasted for approximately 10 minutes . The resulting tsunamis affected southern Chile, Hawaii, Japan, the Philippines, and the Philippines . The quake was the most powerful earthquake ever recorded in the history of the Great Chilean earthquake (Gran terremoto de Chile) in 1960 . It was recorded at the time of the earthquake on 22 May 1960 in Valdivia, Chile, Punta Arenas, Iquique, Santiago and Punta Arenas . The earthquake was the largest ever recorded earthquake in the world

The 1995 Gulf of Aqaba earthquake (also known as Nuweiba earthquake) occurred on November 22 at 06:15 local time (04:15 UTC) and registered 7.3 on the Mw scale . At least 8 people were killed and 30 were injured in the meizoseismal area . The earthquake occurred along the Dead Sea Transform (DST) fault . The epicenter was located in the central segment of the Gulf of aqaba, the narrow body of water that separates Egypt's Sinai Peninsula from the western border of Saudi Arabia . The Minahasa Peninsula is the long peninsula in northern Sulawesi, north of the Gulf of Tomini . It stretches north from the central part of the island . The peninsula is one of the four principal peninsulas on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi . The 1996 Lijiang earthquake measured 6.6 on the moment magnitude scale and had a maximum Mercalli intensity of X (Extreme) Up to 322 people died and more than 17,000 were injured in the earthquake . About 358,000 buildings were destroyed, and 320,000 people were made homeless . The earthquake destroyed many structures and buildings in the regio of China's southwestern Yunnan region . The shock was the largest earthquake ever recorded in the history of the world's history of quakes and aftershocks . It was the first major earthquake in the region to hit China in more than 20 years, killing at least 309 people and injuring at least 16,000 . The quake was the

The 1996 Biak earthquake, or the 1996 Irian Jaya earthquake, occurred on February 17 at 14:59:30 local time near Biak Island, Indonesia . The earthquake had a moment magnitude of 8.2 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) The run-up height of the generated tsunami reached 7 meters (23 ft) One-hundred and sixty-six people were reported dead, 423 were injured, and 5,090 were made homeless . The 1996 Chimbote earthquake occurred on February 21 at 07:51 local time about 130 km off the coast of northern Peru, near the Peru–Chile Trench . It was an earthquake of magnitude Mw 7.4.4 . The mechanism inferred from data is a low-angle thrust of the Nazca Plate, which is subducting beneath the South American Plate . This earthquake was special in that it generated a disproportionally large tsunami . Earthquakes with slow rupture velocities are the most efficiequakes that are most effective in producing a large tsunamis . The 2003 Bachu earthquake occurred on 24 February at 10:03 local time in the Xinjiang Autonomous Region in northwest China . The epicentre was located 105 km east of Kashgar and 310 km west of Aksu . At least 261 people died as a result of the earthquake, and more than 4,000 were injured . Almost 10,000 homes were levelled by the earthquake . A further 5 people were killed in powerful aftershocks which occurred on 26 February 2003 . The earthquake occurred near to the town of Jiashi and Bachu County, about 105 km from Kashgar in Xinjiang . It was the first earthquake to occur in the region since the 1960s

The 1949 Ambato earthquake was the largest earthquake in the Western Hemisphere in more than five years . It struck Ecuador's Tungurahua Province southeast of its capital Ambato and killed 5,050 people . Measuring 6.4 on the Ms scale, it originated from a hypocenter 15 km[3] beneath the surface . The nearby villages of Guano, Patate, Pelileo, and Pillaro were destroyed, and the city of Ambato suffered heavy damage . The earthquake flattened buildings and subsequent landslides caused damage throughout the Tunguahua, Chimborazo, and Cotopaxi Provinces . It disrupted water mains and disrupted water supplies .

Anomalies in gas radon and water mercury were observed before the earthquake but not in Linhe, Baynnur, but the earthquake occurred near western Baotu, Inner Mongolia, but it was considered a typical urban earthquake . The Walls of Ston (Croatian: Stonske zidine) are a series of defensive stone walls, originally more than 7 kilometres (4.3 mi) long, that  surrounded and protected the city of Ston, in Dalmatia, in what is now southern Croatia . Their construction was begun in 1358 and construction was completed in the 15th century . Today it is one of the longest preserved fortification systems in the world . The walls were known as the "European Great Wall of China" The walls are located at 42°50′17″N 17°41′49″E﻿ / ﻿42°42.838°

The 1996 Nazca earthquake occurred on November 12 at 16:59 UTC (11:59 local time) The earthquake was located offshore near Nazca, Peru . It has a magnitude of Mw 7.7 . Fourteen people were reported dead . Four-thousand houses collapsed and 11,000 were partially damaged . The intensity of the earthquake was VIII (Severe) in Nazca . A tsunami was triggered by this earthquake . The earthquake occurred at the plate interface and is associated with the subducti of the Nazca Plate . The Nazca plate is subducting beneath the South American Plate . This earthquake occurred in this area and is at plate interface with the Subducti .

This list considers every notable earthquake felt or with its epicenter within Mexico's current borders and maritime areas . Mexico lies within two seismically active earthquake zones . The Cocos Plate is subducting under the North American Plate at a rate of 67mm (0.220ft) per year . Southern Mexico also contains numerous faults, which causes that section of the country to have high tectonic activity . Northeastern Mexico and the Yucatan Peninsula are not as active as the area close to the boundary between the Cocos and Cocos plates . The Baja California peninsula lies near the boundary of the Pacific Plate and the Pacific and Rivera plates, while southern Mexico lies just north of the boundary

1997 doublet earthquake centered in Harnai, Pakistan . Quake was caused by the collision between the Indian Plate and the Eurasian Plate . Mountain villages near Quetta, the capital of Balochistan province, suffered most of the damage . Quake occurred on February 27 at 21:08 UTC, and felt throughout much of central Balochistan with a magnitude estimated at 7.0 on the Mw scale[3] A 2016 study[5] determined that this was a doublet quake, the Ms 6.4 shock that hit 22 minutes later was a continuation of the initial main shock . Quake caused by collision of the Indian plate and Eurasian plate; no fatalities were reported .

The Santa Cruz Islands are a group of islands in the Pacific Ocean, part of Temotu Province of the nation of Solomon Islands . They lie approximately 250 miles (400 km) to the southeast of the Solomon Islands archipelago . They are considered part of the Vanuatu rain forests ecoregion . The group of the islands once known as the Queen Charlotte Islands is now known as Haida Gwaii . They were discovered in 1767 by Philip Carteret, based on exploration by Philip Carteret in 1767 . The 1997 Umbria and Marche earthquake occurred on September 26, 1997 . It was preceded by a foreshock almost as strong as the main quake . The mainshock was assigned X (Extreme) and foreshock VIII (Severe) on the Mercalli intensity scale . There were several thousands of foreshocks and aftershocks from May 1997 to April 1998, more than 10,000 in the wake of the main earthquake . The 1997 Manyi earthquake occurred on November 8 at 10:02 UTC . The epicenter was in Nagqu Prefecture in northern Tibet, China . The focal mechanism indicates a lift-lateral strike-slip movement . This earthquake ruptured up to 20 km (12 mi) of the top part of the local continental crust . The earthquake had a surface rupture of 17 km (11 mi) long with up to 7 m (23 ft) of slip along the Manyi fault, a westward continuation of the Kunlun fault, offset about 100 km (62 mi) to the south . 1953 earthquake centered in the southern Ionian Islands in western Greece . The event measured 6.8 on the moment magnitude scale . It raised the whole island of Kefalonia by 60cm (24in) and caused widespread damage . The most destructive was the August 12 earthquake, which killed445–800 . In mid-August there were over 113 recorded earthquakes in the region, and the most destructive of the event was that August 12 . The earthquake was centered near the Ionian islands of the southern Greek island of the Zakyntos region, which was also known as the Great Kefaalonia . It was the first earthquake to hit the region since the 1953 Ionian earthquake .

The 1997 Chittagong earthquake (also known as the Bandarban earthquake) occurred on 21 November at 11:23 UTC in the Bangladesh-India-Myanmar border region . It had a magnitude of Mw 6.1 . The epicenter was located in southern Mizoram, India . No fatalities were reported in Bangladesh, but 23 people were killed when a five-story building collapsed in Bangladesh . The shaking could also be felt in Dhaka, Bangladesh, as well as Dhaka . The earthquake was also felt in the Dhaka area, where the shaking was felt in parts of the Indian-Bangladesh border region and the Myanmar-Banglanese border region of Myanmar

The 1999 Oaxaca earthquake occurred on September 30 at 11:31 local time (16:31 UTC) The epicenter was located near San Agustin Loxicha, 60 km NNW of Puerto Ángel . It had a magnitude of Mw 7.4 . Thirty-five people were reported dead . The archeological site of the ancient Zapotec city of Monte Alban also suffered damage in this earthquake . This was an intraplate earthquake in the Cocos Plate, with a normal-fault fault . The maximum intensity reached MM VIII in southwestern Oaxac, and could be felt strongly in Mexico City . Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . The 1998 Aiquile earthquake occurred on May 22 at 00:48:53 local time in Bolivia . The strike-slip earthquake had a moment magnitude of 6.6 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) Damage was severe, with at least 95 deaths, 50–150 injuries, and 6,900 homeless . Damage was so severe that at least 105 people were killed and 50 people were injured by the earthquake . The earthquake occurred in Bolivia at a depth of 25km (16 mi) The earthquake was the first to occur in the world's largest earthquake to hit Bolivia in the last century . An earthquake occurred in northern Afghanistan on 30 May 1998, at 06:22 UTC in the Takhar Province with a moment magnitude of 6.5 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong) At the time, the Afghan Civil War was underway; the affected area was controlled by the United Islamic Front for the Salvation of Afghanistan (the "Northern Alliance") This earthquake was the second large earthquake in the area in 1998 after another earthquake on February 4 . The Faial-Pico Channel is an 8.3 km (5.2 km) long channel that separates the islands of Faial and Pico in the central group of the archipelago of the Azores . The strait is divided into various depressions, calderas and micro-systems, referred to as Baixas . The Baixa do Norte reef is located 2 kilometres (1.1 nmi) from Ponta da Espalamaca, at a depth of approximately 100–150 metres (330-490 ft), to a depth reaching 17 metres (56 ft) below sea level . Puerto Barrios (Spanish pronunciation: [ˈpweɾ.to ˈβa.rjos] is a city in Guatemala, located within the Gulf of Honduras . The Minoan eruption was a major catastrophic volcanic eruption that devastated the Aegean island of Thera (also called Santorini) in around 1600 BCE . It destroyed the Minoan settlement at Akrotiri, as well as communities and agricultural areas on nearby islands and the coast of Crete with subsequent earthquakes and tsunamis . With a VEI magnitude between 6 and 7, resulting in an ejection of about 7,000 tons of volcanic material, the eruption was the largest in the history of the world's history of eruptions . The Banggai Islands Regency was hit by an earthquake of magnitude 7.5 Mw on 4 May 2000 at 12:21 WITA (04:21 UTC) The earthquake triggered a local tsunami of up to 6 m in height that caused significant damage east of Luwuk on the mainland and   Luwuk on the mainland . Eighty percent of the buildings on the Bangsai Islands were destroyed . The earthquake was the worst hit by a tsunami in Indonesia, killing 46 people and causing significant damage to the region . The 921 Earthquake Museum of Taiwan is a national museum in Wufeng District, Taichung, Taiwan . The museum is dedicated to the 7.3 earthquake that struck the center of Taiwan at 01:47:12.6 TST on Tuesday, 21 September 1999 . It is located on the site of the former Guangfu Junior High School[zh]. The shell of the building forms the exterior walls of the museum and the Museum's Museum's interior walls . The 7.4-minute earthquake hit Taiwan on September 21, 1999 . The Chelungpu Fault Gallery is located in the former school's sports field and the museum's museum's interior is located at 24°02′32

The 2000 Enggano earthquake struck at 23:28 local time on June 4 with a moment magnitude of 7.9 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VI (Strong) The event occurred off the coast of southern Sumatra, Indonesia . There were more than 100 fatalities and up to 2,585 injuries . Over 730 aftershocks shocked the area afterwards, one just eleven minutes after the mainshock . This was the first and southernmost in a series of very large to great Sumatran earthquakes in the 2000s to rupture almost the entire wester westerly westerland region of Sumatra . The event was the most recent to occur in the region of Indonesia .

This list includes any notable historical earthquakes that have epicenters within the current boundaries of Turkey . This list is incomplete . Turkey is a seismically active area within the complex zone of collision between the Eurasian Plate and both the African and Arabian Plates . Much of the country lies on the Anatolian Plate, a small plate bounded by two major strike-slip fault zones . The western part of Turkey is also affected by the zone of the North and East Anolian Fault . Seismic hazard is a major concern for the country's geology and geology of the region . Colombia is a seismically active country and has a large seismic risk in many areas of its territory due to its location at the boundaries of the Malpelo, Panama, Caribbean, North Andes and South American Plates along the Pacific Ring of Fire . The southeastern and extreme eastern portions of Colombia are not as seismic active as the rest of the country . The first recorded earthquake felt in Colombia occurred on September 11, 1530, around 10:00 AM, probably with the epicentre near Cumaná, Venezuela. The first documented earthquake was documented by Gonzalo Fernández de Oviedo y Valdés in his work La Historia general de las Indias and by fri

The 2000 New Ireland earthquakes occurred off the coast of New Ireland Province, Papua New Guinea . The mainshock was a magnitude 8.0 Mw[2] strike-slip event that occurred on November 16 at 04:54 UTC, and ruptured a section of the transform boundary between the north and south Bismarck plates . A 7.8 magnitude thrust earthquake followed at 07:42 UTC with its epicenter 175 km south of the first earthquake at the southern end . 2 killed in the first and second quakes; as of December 31 2000, 2 people were killed by the quakes . The second and third quakes were followed by numerous aftershocks .

The 2000 Turkmenistan earthquake took place at 8:11 p.m. Moscow Time on December 6 and had a magnitude of 7.0 . The intensity of the earthquake reached VIII at its epicenter, and VI at the Turkmen capital of Ashgabat . The 2011 Yunnan earthquake was a 5.4 magnitude earthquake that occurred on 10 March 2011 at 12:58 CST, with its epicenter in Yingjiang County, Yunnan, People's Republic of China, near the Burmese border . A total of 26 people died and 313 were injured with 133 in serious condition . Up to seven aftershocks, measuring up to a magnitude of 4.7, followed the initial quake, which caused a total of 127,000 people to be evacuated to nearby shelters . The 2001 southern Peru earthquake occurred at 20:33:15 UTC (15:33 local time) on June 23 with a moment magnitude of 8.4 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) The quake affected the Peruvian regions of Arequipa, Moquegua and Tacna . It was the most devastating earthquake in Peru since the catastrophic 1970 Ancash earthquake and globally the largest earthquake since the 1965 Rat Islands earthquake . The earthquake was centered in the Arequipe region of Peru and was centered 32km (20 mi) away from the city of Alquimbo . The quake killed 74–145 and injured 2,687–2,713 people .

The Hindu Kush is an 800-kilometre-long (500 mi) mountain range in Central and South Asia to the west of the Himalayas . It stretches from central and western Afghanistan into northwestern Pakistan and far southeastern Tajikistan . The range forms the western section of the Hindu Kush Himalayan Region (HKH) to the north, nea . The Cotabato Trench is an oceanic trench in the Pacific Ocean, off the southwestern coast of Mindanao in the Philippines . It forms part of a linkedset of trenches along the western side of the Philippines formed over east-dipping subduction zones, including the Manila Trench and Negros Trench . At its northern end the rate of convergence across this boundary is about 100 mm per year . It is a relatively young structure, forming during the late Miocene to Pliocene . The Gau Cologne-Aachen was an administrative division of Nazi Germany from 1933 to 1945 . Before that, from 1931 to 1933, it was the regional subdivision of the Nazi Party in that area . The Gau (plural Gaue) system was originally established in a party conference on 22 May 1926, in order to improve administration of the party structure . From 1933 onwards, after the Nazi seizure of power, the Gaue increasingly replaced the German states as administrative subdivisions in Germany . The 2009 Andaman Islands earthquake occurred on August 11 at 19:55 UTC . The earthquake magnitude was recorded as 7.5 Mw . The epicentre was 260 km north of Port Blair . The Pacific Tsunami Warning Center issued a tsunami watch to India, Myanmar, Bangladesh, Indonesia and Thailand, but it was later lifted . No casualties or injuries were reported, although there were no deaths or injuries from the earthquake . The quake was the strongest in the region since the 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami in the Indian Ocean since 2004, when the 2004 tsunami hit the region . The 1968 Belice earthquake sequence took place in Sicily between 14 and 15 January . The largest shock measured 5.5 on the moment magnitude scale, with five others of magnitude 5+ . The maximum perceived intensity was X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The earthquake sequence killed at least 231 people, possibly more than 400, with between 632 and about 1,000 injured and left 100,000 homeless . It is known in Italy as Terremoto del Belice, or Terremotel Belice . It took place between Gibellina, Salaparuta and Poggioreale in Sicily, and is now known as Belice de Belice in Italy .

San Giuliano di Puglia is a small town and comune in the province of Campobasso, in the region of Molise, in Italy . Its name still recalls its former administrative and cultural association with Apulia (Puglia) Even though it is now part of the province, its name is still associated with the region . It is mainly an agriculturally rich region of Apulia, with a population of 1,027 . The 2002 Sumatra earthquake occurred at 01:26 UTC on November 2, 2002 . It had a magnitude of 7.4 on the moment magnitude scale with an epicenter just north of Simeulue island . The island of Sumatra lies on the convergent plate boundary between the Indo-Australian Plate and the Eurasian Plate . This earthquake is regarded as a foreshock of the 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake, which occurred about 60 km to the northwest . The earthquake is believed to have foreshakened the 2004 earthquake in the Indian Ocean, which was 60km further south of the coast . Three people were killed and 65 were injured in the 2002 earthquake in Sumatra, Sumatra .

Vanuatu lies atop a complex and active plate boundary in the southwestern Pacific Ocean . The primary tectonic feature of the 1,200 km (750 mi) island chain is the New Hebrides Subduction Zone, the convergent boundary of the Australian and Pacific Plates . Volcanic activity is also present along this north-northwest trending and northeast-dipping oceanic trench . The area adjacent to the d'Entrecasteaux Ridge does not experience intermediate-depth earthquakes along a Wadati–Benioff zone that dips steeply at 70° . There is a corresponding g in the area surrounding the ridge, but there is no corresponding earthquake activity .

The 2002 Hindu Kush earthquakes struck in northern Afghanistan during the month of March . At least 166 people were killed with a very large and intermediate-depth mainshock on March 3 . Three weeks later, at least a further thousand were killed during a large, but shallow aftershock that had a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong) aftershocks . The M7.4 and M6.1 reverse events were focused in the Hindu Kush mountain ra ra ra in the region of northern Afghanistan . Honiara is the capital and largest city of the Solomon Islands . It is situated on the northwestern coast of Guadalcanal . As of 2017, it had a population of 84,520 people . The airport area was the site of a battle between the U.S. and the Japanese during World War II, the Battle of Henderson Field of 1942, from which America emerged victorious . The 2003 Colima earthquake occurred on 21 January with a moment magnitude of 7.6 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) The earthquake was felt as far away as Mexico City and in southern parts of the United States . The epicenter was located on the Pacific coast in the Mexican state of Colima . The earthquake resulted in the death toll of 29 people and 300 injured in the 2003 earthquake . The quake was the largest earthquake in the history of the world's history of high-magnitude quakes . Island in Indonesia is located in the Lesser Sunda Islands chain, with Lombok to the west, Flores to the east, and Sumba further to the southeast . Traditionally, the island is known as the source of sappanwood, as well as honey and sandalwood . Its savanna-like climate and vast grasslanlanlan are characteristic of the island's savanna style . There have been plans by the Indonesian government to split the island off into a separate province of West Nusa Tenggara, but there have been no plans for the split of the province . This list includes any notable historical earthquakes that have epicenters within the current boundaries of Turkey . This list is incomplete . Turkey is a seismically active area within the complex zone of collision between the Eurasian Plate and both the African and Arabian Plates . Much of the country lies on the Anatolian Plate, a small plate bounded by two major strike-slip fault zones . The western part of Turkey is also affected by the zone of the North and East Anolian Fault . Seismic hazard is a major concern for the country's geology and geology of the region . List of notable earthquakes in Turkey includes notable historical quakes that caused significant effects in this area . List

The 2003 Bachu earthquake occurred on 24 February at 10:03 local time in the Xinjiang Autonomous Region in northwest China . The epicentre was located 105 km east of Kashgar and 310 km west of Aksu . At least 261 people died as a result of the earthquake, and more than 4,000 were injured . Almost 10,000 homes were levelled by the earthquake . A further 5 people were killed in powerful aftershocks which occurred on 26 February 2003 . The earthquake occurred near to the town of Jiashi and Bachu County, about 105 km from Kashgar in Xinjiang . It was the first earthquake to occur in the region since the 1960s

The 1992 Big Bear earthquake occurred at 08:05:33 PDT on June 28 in Big Bear Lake, California, with a moment magnitude of 6.5 and a maximum perceived intensity of VIII (Severe) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The quake occurred at a relatively shallow depth of 5 kilometers (3.1 miles) The earthquake killed 63 people and damaged $60 million . The earthquake occurred in the Inland Empire, Southern California, at a depth of 3.1 kilometers (4 miles) It was the largest earthquake ever recorded in the history of the Big Bear earthquakes . The 2009 West Java earthquake occurred on September 2 at 14:55:01 local time in West Java, Indonesia . The magnitude 7.0 earthquake killed at least 79 people, injured over 1,250, and displaced over 210,000 . It was Indonesia's deadliest earthquake since the 2006 Pangandaran earthquake and tsunami . The quake was felt in the capital Jakarta, although damage there was minimal . The earthquake's focus lies close to the coast of Java, but damage was minimal, and damage to the city was minimal in Jakarta . The tsunami was 20cm wide . The death toll from the earthquake was 79 people; more than 140,000 people were displaced in Tasikmalaya regency

The 1992 Flores earthquake and tsunami occurred on December 12 on the island of Flores in Indonesia . At least 2,500 people were killed or missing near Flores, including 1,49 people who were missing . Laurie Island is the second largest of the South Orkney Islands . The island is claimed by Argentina as part of Argentine Antarctica, and by the United Kingdom as the British Antarctic Territory . Under the Antarctic Treaty System all sovereignty claims are frozen, as the island lies south of the parallel 60°. Buchanan Point at the north-eastern end of the island, with Cape Whitson on its south coast, are Important Bird Areas . Buchanan Point is located at Buchanan Point in the north east of Laurie Island . Buchanan point is an Important Bird Area in the south-east of the islands . The 2003 Fiordland earthquake struck the South Island of New Zealand on 22 August 2003 . At 7.2 Ms magnitude it was one of the largest quakes in the country for some time . The epicentre was 12 km deep, and was thought to be near Secretary Island at the entrance to Doubtful Sound . There was an aftershock two hours later at 2.12 am, followed over several days by frequent small tremors . Up to 21 September there were 6365 aftershocks, and there was no one person to be seriously injured . The quake was the largest shallow quake in New Zealand since the 1968 Inangahua earthquake . Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . The 2003 San Simeon earthquake struck at 11:15 PST (19:15 UTC) on December 22 on the Central Coast of California . With a moment magnitude 6.6 Mw, the quake was felt as far away as Los Angeles . The most violent ground movement was within 50 miles of the epicenter, though the earthquake was felt 50 miles away . The earthquake was caused by thrust faulting and the rupture propagated southeast from the hypocenter for 12 miles (19 km) away . The 2005 Kashmir earthquake occurred at 08:50:39 Pakistan Standard Time on 8 October in Pakistani-administered Azad Kashmir . It was the first major earthquake in South Asia since the 1555 Kashmir earthquake . It killed 86,000–87,351 people and displaced 2.8 million people . Aftershocks were followed by 6.4 Mw aftershocks of magnitude 7.6 and 5.9 Mw . Quake occurred in Pakistan, India, Afghanistan, Tajikistan, Pakistan, Afghanistan and Afghanistan . Quake was the largest earthquake in the world since the 1885 Kashmir earthquake, when it occurred in 1885 and 1885,000 people were killed in the same region .

1861 Sumatra earthquake occurred on February 16, 1861 . It was the last in a sequences of earthquakes that ruptured adjacent parts of the Sumatran segment of the Sunda megathrust . The earthquake was felt as far away as the Malay peninsula and the eastern part of Java . The rupture area for the 2005 Nias–Simeulue earthquake is similar to that estimated for the 1861 event . It caused a devastating tsunami which led to several thousand fatalities, including several thousand people being killed by a tsunami . The 2005 event was similar to the 1861 quake, with the rupture area of the 2005 event being similar to this event's rupture area . The 2011 earthquake was also similar to 1861

The 1966 Toro earthquake, or the 1966 Ruwenzori earthquake, occurred on March 20 at 01:42 UTC (04:42 Uganda local time) The earthquake was located near the border between Uganda and the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), to the south of Lake Albert . The earthquake had a magnitude of Mw 6.8[3]: 66  and a maximum perceived intensity of VIII (Severe) on the Mercalli intensity scale .157 people were killed in the April 18 aftershock, including 90 in the May 18 aftershap . The 2004 Al Hoceima earthquake occurred on 24 February at 02:27:47 local time near the coast of northern Morocco . The strike-slip earthquake measured 6.3 on the moment magnitude scale and had a maximum perceived intensity of IX (Violent) on the Mercalli intensity scale . Between 628 and 631 people were killed, 926 were injured, and up to 15,000 people were made homeless . Up to 12,539–15,000 were displaced in the area . The earthquake was centered 35°14′N 4°01′W 4.02°W﻿ / ﻿35°14.23°N 4 .02°

The 1918 Shantou earthquake occurred in Shantou, Guangdong, Republic of China . The earthquake occurred on February 13, 1918, at 14:07 in the afternoon . Serious damage and high casualty numbers were reported in Guangzhou and the surrounding provinces . It also caused some damage in what was then British Hong Kong, where the quake caused only minor damage and cracks to building . The epicenter location is believed to be centered off Nan'ao Island or about 300 km northeast of the territory of Hong Kong . The quake was centered about 23°32′N 117°14′E﻿ / ﻿23.54°N 117.24°E . The 2002 Hindu Kush earthquakes struck in northern Afghanistan during the month of March . At least 166 people were killed with a very large and intermediate-depth mainshock on March 3 . Three weeks later, at least a further thousand were killed during a large, but shallow aftershock that had a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong) aftershocks . The M7.4 and M6.1 reverse events were focused in the Hindu Kush mountain ra ra ra in the region of northern Afghanistan . The first of the 2009 Sumatra earthquakes (Indonesian: Gempa bumi Sumatra 2009) occurred on 30 September off the coast of Sumatra, Indonesia with a moment magnitude of 7.6 at 17:16:10 local time . The epicenter was 45 kilometres (28 mi) west-northwest of Padang, West Sumatra and 220 kilometres (140 mi) southwest of Pekanbaru, Riau . 1,115 dead, 1,214 severely injured and 1,688 slightly injured; 2,180 injured . The most recent Sumatra earthquake was the 9th Sumatra quake, which was centered off the west coast of the Indonesian island .

Much large numbers of earthquakes of smaller magnitude occur very regularly due to the meeting of major tectonic plates in the region . USGS: Indonesia has had more than 150 earthquakes with magnitude > 7 in the period 1901–2017 . Six of the Top Ten strongest Indonesian earthquakes ≥ 8.3 Mw occurred near Sumatra and along the Java Trench, with six of the strongest earthquakes in the country's history occurring near the Sumatra Trench . The 1962 Buin Zahra earthquake occurred on September 1, 1962 . The shock had a Richter magnitude of 7.1 and resulted in 12,225 fatalities . Qazvin Province lies in an area of Iran that experiences large earthquakes . The 1962 event originated on one of many faults in the area, called the Ipak Fault . The fault is believed to have been reactivated multiple times and could still pose a threat to locals . Iran's building codes, renowned for performing poorly during earthquakes, were recently evaluated by multiple world organizations . Most hope that the earthquake will lead to better building codes in the country's earthquake-prone building codes that have been evaluated by the world's most respected organizations .

FC Sakhalin Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk are a Russian football club . They play in the Russian Professional Football League, the third tier of Russian football . The club won the East zone of the PFL in the 2017–18 season, but did not apply for the license to the second-level Russian National Football League for 2018–19 . The team was founded in 2004 and changed their name to Sakhalin-Tourist Yuzhna-Sakalinsk in 2005 . Series of earthquakes in California, US Activity snapshot 35 hours after Sept 28, 2004 large earthquake . Six successive magnitude 6 earthquakes occurred on the San Andreas fault at unusually regular intervals, between 12 and 32 years apart (with an average of every 22 years), between 1857 and 1966 . Location is midway on a fault segment between a locked segment to the south (last major earthquake 1857) and a creeping segment to north where two tectonic plates are continuously moving without major earthquakes . The most recent significant earthquake to occur here happened on September 29, 2004 . Location about midway on fault segment is about midway between locked segment and creeping segment of the north . This list includes any notable historical earthquakes that have epicenters within the current boundaries of Turkey . This list is incomplete . Turkey is a seismically active area within the complex zone of collision between the Eurasian Plate and both the African and Arabian Plates . Much of the country lies on the Anatolian Plate, a small plate bounded by two major strike-slip fault zones . The western part of Turkey is also affected by the zone of the North and East Anolian Fault . Seismic hazard is a major concern for the country's geology and geology of the region . The first of the 2009 Sumatra earthquakes (Indonesian: Gempa bumi Sumatra 2009) occurred on 30 September off the coast of Sumatra, Indonesia with a moment magnitude of 7.6 at 17:16:10 local time . The epicenter was 45 kilometres (28 mi) west-northwest of Padang, West Sumatra and 220 kilometres (140 mi) southwest of Pekanbaru, Riau . 1,115 dead, 1,214 severely injured and 1,688 slightly injured; 2,180 injured . The most recent Sumatra earthquake was the 9th Sumatra quake, which was centered off the west coast of the Indonesian island .

For the period 1850–2004, there was about one potentially damaging event per year on average, though many of these did not cause serious consequences or loss of life . This article is about the earthquake and tsunami that impacted Sulawesi in September 2018 . For the tsunami that followed an eruption of the Anak Krakatau volcano, see 2018 Sunda Strait tsunami . Not to be confused with 2018 West Java earthquake. 2018 earthquake and Tsunami centered in Donggala Regency, Sulawsesi, Indonesia . The quake and tsunami killed 4,340 people and injured 10,679 injured and left millions of people missing . In the long-term, 206,524 people were evacuated from their homes in Indonesia. In the longer term, more than 200,000 people were affected by the earthquake in the longer-term period of December 31, 2018 .

The 2005 Miyagi earthquake struck the east coast of the Japanese island of Honshū at 11.46 am (02:46 UTC) on August 16, 2005 . The event registered 7.2 on the moment magnitude scale . It triggered a tsunami warning, and buildings shook 200 miles away in the capital, Tokyo . It was initially estimated to have affected Japan's northeastern coast . The earthquake occurred on Tuesday, August 16 and affected areas of Japan's northeast coast . Damage and casualties were caused by the earthquake, and 39 people were injured in the event . The tsunami was initially thought to have been the largest in the world, with a 10cm (10cm) tsunami warning issued .

10,749 people were killed, 5,640 people were missing and thousands of people became homeless when a tsunami triggered by the 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake struck the southern coast of India on 26 December 2004 . The earthquake registered 9.1–9.3 Mw and was the largest in five decades . It was followed by strong aftershocks on the Andaman and Nicobar Islands . The death toll of the earthquake was 1,500 people, according to official estimates in India . The tsunami was triggered by a quake near the Indonesian island of Sumatra, which struck the Indian Ocean coast on December 26, 2004, near the Indian coast of Sri Lanka . The 2005 Ruichang earthquake occurred at 8:49 am local time on 26 November . The United States Geological Survey reported the event's moment magnitude as 5.2 . At least 14 people died, including five in Ruichan, seven in neighboring Jiujiang, and two across the river in Wuxue, Hubei . The 1959 Hebgen Lake earthquake measured 7.2 on the Moment magnitude scale . The earthquake caused a huge landslide, resulted in over 28 fatalities and left US$11 million (equivalent to $97.66 million in 2020) in damage . The slide blocked the flow of the Madison River, resulting in the creation of Quake Lake . Quake Lake is now located 15 miles north of West Yellowstone, Montana, United States. Quake Lake was created in 1959 . Quake lake is now known as Quake Lake in Montana, Idaho, Wyoming, Idaho and Wyoming . The 2000 New Ireland earthquakes occurred off the coast of New Ireland Province, Papua New Guinea . The mainshock was a magnitude 8.0 Mw[2] strike-slip event that occurred on November 16 at 04:54 UTC, and ruptured a section of the transform boundary between the north and south Bismarck plates . A 7.8 magnitude thrust earthquake followed at 07:42 UTC with its epicenter 175 km south of the first earthquake at the southern end . 2 killed in the first and second quakes; as of December 31 2000, 2 people were killed by the quakes . The second and third quakes were followed by numerous aftershocks .

Dabbahu Volcano is part of the Afar Triangle (Afar Depression), a highly active volcanic region which includes Erta Ale . An eruption on September 26, 2005 created a large fissure in the ground . The 2005 Kashmir earthquake occurred at 08:50:39 Pakistan Standard Time on 8 October in Pakistani-administered Azad Kashmir . It was the first major earthquake in South Asia since the 1555 Kashmir earthquake . It killed 86,000–87,351 people and displaced 2.8 million people . Aftershocks were followed by 6.4 Mw aftershocks of magnitude 7.6 and 5.9 Mw . Quake occurred in Pakistan, India, Afghanistan, Tajikistan, Pakistan, Afghanistan and Afghanistan . Quake was the largest earthquake in the world since the 1885 Kashmir earthquake, when it occurred in 1885 and 1885,000 people were killed in the same region .

The 2006 Kīholo Bay earthquake occurred on October 15 at 07:07:49 local time with a magnitude of 6.7 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) The shock was centered 21 kilometers (13 mi) southwest of Puakō and 21 km (13 mi) north of Kailua-Kona, Hawai'i, at a depth of 38.2 kilometers (23.7 mi) It produced several aftershocks, including one that measured a magnitude 6.1 seven minutes after the main shock . No one was seriously injured in the earthquake, which occurred in Hawaii, U.S. The area was affected by the earthquake .

The South American Plate is moving over the Nazca Plate at a rate of 77mm (3.0in) per year . The same process has caused the rise of the Andes mountain range and the creation of the Peru–Chile Trench, as well as volcanism in the Peruvian highlands . The oldest rocks in Peru date to the Precambrian and are more than two billion years old . Along the southern coast, granulite and charnockite shows reworking by an ancient orogeny mountain-building event . Northern Morocco lies close to the boundary between the African Plate and the Eurasian Plate, the Azores–Gibraltar Transform Fault . Most of the seismicity in Morocco is related to movement on that plate boundary, with the greatest seismic hazard in the north of the country close to that boundary . This zone of right-lateral strike-slip becomes transpressional at its eastern end with the development of large thrust faults to the east of the Strait of Gibraltar, in the Alboran Sea the boundary becomes collisional in type . The most significant earthquakes in Morocco have had their epicentres in Morocco or had a significant impact in the country . This list is a list of significant earthquakes

The 2006 Pangandaran earthquake and tsunami occurred on July 17 at 15:19:27 local time along a subduction zone off the coast of west and central Java, a large and densely populated island in the Indonesian archipelago . The shock had a moment magnitude of 7.7 and a maximum perceived intensity of IV (Light) The earthquake killed668 people, 65 missing and 9,299 injured . Total damage was $44.7 million, with total damage estimated at $44 million . The 1977 Sumba earthquake occurred 290 kilometres (180 mi) south of Bima, Sumbawa, and beneath the Indian Ocean, at 14:08 local time on 19 August . With a moment magnitude of 8.3, the earthquake is notable for having an unusually great magnitude for a shock with a normal faulting focal mechanism . The shock occurred near the southern section of the Sunda Trench where several other tsunami-generating earthquakes have occurred . The earthquake was at the time the largest outer-rise earthquake ever recorded in In In Indonesia . It was also known as the Sumbaw earthquake, which killed 180 people and injured more than 1,100 people in the region .

Mae Chan Fault is an active 118 km long west-southwest–east-northeast trending left lateral strike-slip fault in Northern Thailand that extends into western Laos . It was responsible for a 6.3 magnitude quake in Laos on May 16, 2007, that caused property damage as far as Chiang Rai in Thailand . A part of it stretches from Mae Chan to Mae Ai for 40 km along the highway, then goes through Fang, Chiang Dao, Mae Rim and San Kamphaeng districts of Chiang Mai, to Mae Tha district of Lamphun . The Indian subcontinent has a history of earthquakes . The Indian plate drives into Asia at a rate of approximately 47mm/year . This list includes any notable historical earthquakes that have epicenters within the current boundaries of Turkey . This list is incomplete . Turkey is a seismically active area within the complex zone of collision between the Eurasian Plate and both the African and Arabian Plates . Much of the country lies on the Anatolian Plate, a small plate bounded by two major strike-slip fault zones . The western part of Turkey is also affected by the zone of the North and East Anolian Fault . Seismic hazard is a major concern for the country's geology and geology of the region . 1953 earthquake centered in the southern Ionian Islands in western Greece . The event measured 6.8 on the moment magnitude scale . It raised the whole island of Kefalonia by 60cm (24in) and caused widespread damage . The most destructive was the August 12 earthquake, which killed445–800 . In mid-August there were over 113 recorded earthquakes in the region, and the most destructive of the event was that August 12 . The earthquake was centered near the Ionian islands of the southern Greek island of the Zakyntos region, which was also known as the Great Kefaalonia . It was the first earthquake to hit the region since the 1953 Ionian earthquake .

The 1959 Hebgen Lake earthquake measured 7.2 on the Moment magnitude scale . The earthquake caused a huge landslide, resulted in over 28 fatalities and left US$11 million (equivalent to $97.66 million in 2020) in damage . The slide blocked the flow of the Madison River, resulting in the creation of Quake Lake . Quake Lake is now located 15 miles north of West Yellowstone, Montana, United States. Quake Lake was created in 1959 . Quake lake is now known as Quake Lake in Montana, Idaho, Wyoming, Idaho and Wyoming . Active tectonics of Ecuador is dominated by the effects of the subduction of the Nazca Plate beneath the South American Plate . Ecuador lies within the Northern Volcanic Zone . The subduction zone is moving at a rate of 7cm/yr to the east-northeast, significantly oblique to the trend of this segment of the Andes . The active tectonic zone has an overall dip of 25–30°, but varies rapidly along strike due to effects of subduction of the Carnegie Ridge . The 2009 Papua earthquakes occurred on January 4 local time in Indonesia's West Papua province . The 2008 Lake Kivu earthquake shook several countries in Africa's Great Lakes region at 07:34:12 (GMT) on February 3 . It measured 5.9 on the moment magnitude scale . The earthquake occurred in the Western Rift of the East African rift system . The epicentre was 20 kilometres (12 mi) north of Bukavu in the Democratic Republic of Congo . Total damage from the earthquake was severe, with 44 dead, 349+ injured in the region . The quake occurred in a diffuse, approximately 3000-km-long, zone of crustal extension that passes through the rift system in the eastern part of the continent . The area was affected by the earthquake in 2008 .

The 2008 Qeshm earthquake occurred on 10 September in the Hormozgān Province of southern Iran, 850 kilometres (528 mi) south of Tehran . The earthquake measured 5.9 on the moment magnitude scale and 6 on the surface wave scale, killing seven people and injuring up to 45 . Causing both catastrophic and minor damage, the earthquake devastated up to 200 villages throughout southern Iran . The epicenter was near the port city of Bandar Abbas, where an earthquake two years prior had caused damage . Citizens reportedly panicked when the earthquake hit, emptyin emptyinin the area . The port city was almost unscathed by the earthquake, leaving it almost completely untouched by the disaster

The Near East earthquakes of 1759 were a series of devastating earthquakes that shook a large portion of the Levant in October and November of that year . The ruins of Baalbek, a settlement in the Beqaa Valley of Lebanon east of the Litani River, were badly damaged . These events, along with the earlier 1202 Sy earthquakes, were also known as the '1759 earthquakes of the Middle East' The area was at the time under the rule of the Ottoman Empire (now includes portions of Syria, Lebanon, Turkey, Israel and Palestine) The ruins were badly damaged . The 2013 Aceh earthquake struck the Indonesian island of Sumatra on July 2 with a moment magnitude of 6.1 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) The strike-slip earthquake killed at least 35 people and injured 276 others . About 4,300 homes were damaged or destroyed in the province of Aceh where approximately 4,292 houses were damaged . Aftershocks occurred 4.3, 5.5 and 5.2 magnitude 6.1 Mw, with a number of aftershocks of magnitude of 5.3 and 6.2 Mw . The quake is common in Sumatra as it is located on the northern end of the island

The first of the 2009 Sumatra earthquakes (Indonesian: Gempa bumi Sumatra 2009) occurred on 30 September off the coast of Sumatra, Indonesia with a moment magnitude of 7.6 at 17:16:10 local time . The epicenter was 45 kilometres (28 mi) west-northwest of Padang, West Sumatra and 220 kilometres (140 mi) southwest of Pekanbaru, Riau . 1,115 dead, 1,214 severely injured and 1,688 slightly injured; 2,180 injured . The most recent Sumatra earthquake was the 9th Sumatra quake, which was centered off the west coast of the Indonesian island .

The 2008 Market Rasen earthquake occurred at 00:56:47.8s GMT on 27 February 2008 . The duration of the earthquake was confirmed as roughly 10 seats[edit] The earthquake was recorded at a depth of 18.6km (18.6 km) The earthquake occurred in the UK at a time of approximately 10 minutes (10 minutes) The quake was recorded as a magnitude of 5.2 by the British Geological Survey

Sobral fault is a major fault in the Borborema geological province of northeastern Brazil . It is commonly correlated with the Kandi fault in Benin, east of the West African craton . The fault lies in the northwest of Ceará state . It appears to have formed late in the orogeny when the West Africa craton engaged with the Congo craton, and to have allowed significant dextral strike-slip movement . It was reactivated when South America was breaking away from Africa . A sinistral shear movement of about 100 km seems to have taken place during and after the break-up of the break up of the craton in this phase .

Oxapampa belongs to the natural region known as Selva Alta or high jungle . 80 kilometres (50 mi) northward down the valley of the Huancabamba River is the settlement of Poz . The city is located in the eastern part of the Pasco Region in Peru . The population is 14,304, with a population of 1,814m (5,951 ft) in elevation . The capital is Oxapampampa, which was founded in 1891, and is the largest city in the country . It is also the capital of Oxampampa District and Oxampamp Province in the province of Oxappampa District, Oxampam District .

Turkey is a seismically active area within the complex zone of collision between the Eurasian Plate and both the African and Arabian Plates . Cyclone Nargis was an extremely destructive and deadly tropical cyclone that caused the worst natural disaster in the recorded history of Myanmar during early May 2008 . The cyclone made landfall in Myanmar on Friday, 2 May 2008, sending a storm surge 40 kilometres up the densely populated Irrawaddy delta . The storm cost $12.9 billion (2008 USD), second costliest cyclone recorded in the Indian Ocean . The Cyclone caused a total of 138,373 deaths, the fifth-deadliest on record, with $138,373 worth of damage and $12,9 billion in damage . The North Indian Ocean cyclone was the most destructive in the region of the world in 2008 .

The epicenter of the 7.7 Mw earthquake was in Pandora, Valle La Estrella, in the Caribbean region of Limon, Costa Rica, 225 kilometres (140 mi) southeast of San José . The 2005 Kashmir earthquake occurred at 08:50:39 Pakistan Standard Time on 8 October in Pakistani-administered Azad Kashmir . It was the first major earthquake in South Asia since the 1555 Kashmir earthquake . It killed 86,000–87,351 people and displaced 2.8 million people . Aftershocks were followed by 6.4 Mw aftershocks of magnitude 7.6 and 5.9 Mw . Quake occurred in Pakistan, India, Afghanistan, Tajikistan, Pakistan, Afghanistan and Afghanistan . Quake was the largest earthquake in the world since the 1885 Kashmir earthquake, when it occurred in 1885 and 1885,000 people were killed in the same region .

The 2009 Samoa earthquake and tsunami took place on 29 September 2009 in the southern Pacific Ocean adjacent to the Kermadec-Tonga subduction zone . The submarine earthquake occurred in an extensional environment and had a moment magnitude of 8.1 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VI (Strong) It was the largest earthquake of 2009 . A tsunami was generated which caused substantial damage and loss of life in Samoa, American Samoa, and New Zealand . A total of 189 people were killed and hundreds were injured in the earthquake and a tsunami generated by the tsunami . The 2009 Fiordland earthquake struck the South Island of New Zealand with a magnitude of 7.8[1] at 9:22 pm (NZST) on 15 July . Myanmar is one of the most seismically active regions in the world . Oblique subduction, block rotation, and a transform margin has been responsible for the seismic activities of the country . The Sagaing Fault is one the largest sources of earthquakes in the country, having produced deadly quakes in the past centuries . The Shan Plateau is another source of earthquakes, hosting many active strike-slip faults that accommodate block rotation of the Sunda Plate . The 2004 earthquake was the largest earthquake in Myanmar, with a magnitude of 6.0 magnitude of magnitude 9.0 in the region . The 2002 Mindanao earthquake struck the Philippines at 05:16 Philippine Standard Time on March 6 (21:16 Coordinated Universal Time) It registered a magnitude of 7.5 and was a megathrust earthquake . It originated near the Cotabato Trench, a zone of deformation situated between the Philippine Sea Plate and the Sunda Plate, and occurred very near to the Philippines' strongest earthquake . 15 people were killed and 100 were injured in the earthquake . The earthquake was the world's sixth most powerful earthquake of the year, registering a magnitude 7.0 magnitude . It occurred near the Philippines’ strongest earthquake, the most recent earthquake to hit the country in the past decade .

The 2009 Bhutan earthquake occurred on 21 September at 14:53 BTT (08:53 UTC) in the eastern region of Bhutan with moment magnitude of 6.1 . The epicenter was situated at 180 kilometres (110 mi) east of the capital Thimphu, in Monggar District . Bangladesh and northern India also felt it, with buildings in Guwahati, Assam, cracking up . The tremors were felt as far as Tibet . At least eleven people are reported to have been killed, seven in Bhutan, four in India and at least fifteen were wounded in the earthquake . The earthquake was felt in China, Bangladesh, India, Bangladesh and Tibet .

The 2013 Solomon Islands earthquake struck northeast of Australia on 6 February with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) Its epicenter was the Solomon Islands, at the boundaries of the Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, causing local evacuations and a tsunami of 1.5 m (4.9 ft) and killing at least nine people . Aftershocks were also felt in the region, with a total of 20 aftershocks of around 20,000 occurring during the event . The 2008 Qeshm earthquake occurred on 10 September in the Hormozgān Province of southern Iran, 850 kilometres (528 mi) south of Tehran . The earthquake measured 5.9 on the moment magnitude scale and 6 on the surface wave scale, killing seven people and injuring up to 45 . Causing both catastrophic and minor damage, the earthquake devastated up to 200 villages throughout southern Iran . The epicenter was near the port city of Bandar Abbas, where an earthquake two years prior had caused damage . Citizens reportedly panicked when the earthquake hit, emptyin emptyinin the area . The 1977 Sumba earthquake occurred 290 kilometres (180 mi) south of Bima, Sumbawa, and beneath the Indian Ocean, at 14:08 local time on 19 August . With a moment magnitude of 8.3, the earthquake is notable for having an unusually great magnitude for a shock with a normal faulting focal mechanism . The shock occurred near the southern section of the Sunda Trench where several other tsunami-generating earthquakes have occurred . The earthquake was at the time the largest outer-rise earthquake ever recorded in In In Indonesia . It was also known as the Sumbaw earthquake, which killed 180 people and injured more than 1,100 people in the region .

In 1849, the first earthquake following European settlement in WA was recorded . The 1999 Chamoli earthquake occurred on 29 March in the Chamoli district in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh (now in Uttarakhand) Approximately 103 people died in the earthquake . The Himalaya Range has been undergoing crustal shortening along the 2,400 km long northern edge of the Indian Plate which resulted in the formation of several thrust faults including the Main Central Thrust (MCT), the Main Boundary Thrust (MBT) and the Main Frontal Thrust (FT) The MCT consists of three sub-thr. The South American Plate is moving over the Nazca Plate at a rate of 77mm (3.0in) per year . The same process has caused the rise of the Andes mountain range and the creation of the Peru–Chile Trench, as well as volcanism in the Peruvian highlands . The oldest rocks in Peru date to the Precambrian and are more than two billion years old . Along the southern coast, granulite and charnockite shows reworking by an ancient orogeny mountain-building event . The 1881 Nicobar Islands earthquake occurred at about 07:49 local time (01:49 UTC) on 31 December, with an epicentre beneath Car Nicobar . It occurred as two separate ruptures, the largest of which had an estimated magnitude of 7.9 on the moment magnitude scale and triggered a tsunami that was observed around the Bay of Bengal . It is probably the earliest earthquake for which rupture parameters have been estimated instrumentally . The Nicobar islands are a series of volcanic islands that are part of an active volcanic region . The largest of the ruptures was estimated to be a magnitude of 7.9 Mw . The Indian subcontinent has a history of earthquakes . The Indian plate drives into Asia at a rate of approximately 47mm/year . The reason for the intensity and high frequency of earthquakes is the Indian plate driving into Asia . The 2010 Central Canada earthquake occurred with a moment magnitude of 5.0 in Central Canada on 23 June at about 13:41:41 EDT and lasted about 30 seconds . The epicentre was situated in Buckingham, Quebec, approximately 56 kilometres (35 mi) north of Ottawa, Ontario . Canada's capital, Ottawa, declared this earthquake as being its most powerful in 65 years . It was felt across most of Ontario[8] and Quebec, as well as parts of the northeastern U.S. and New York, United States . Iran is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults that cover at least 90% of the country . The Iranian Plate is bordered by the Indian Plate, the Eurasian Plate, and the Arabian Plate (to the south and west) Since 1900, at least 126,000 fatalities have resulted from earthquakes in Iran . The country is well known for its long history of disastrous earthquake activity . It is also known for the waste of valuable natural resources and the deaths of at least 125,000 people since 1900 . The 2010 Canterbury earthquake struck the South Island of New Zealand with a moment magnitude of 7.1[1] at 4:35 am local time on 4 September . Some damaging aftershocks followed the main event, the strongest of which was a magnitude 6.3 shock known as the Christchurch earthquake . Aftershocks were the strongest, with a maximum perceived intensity of X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale . The quake was centered near Darfield, New Zealand, and was centered 43°33′S 172°11′E﻿ / ﻿43.55°S 172.18°E.55; 172.55 ; -43.

Only earthquakes with a magnitude of 6.0 or greater are listed, except for a few that had a moderate impact . Aftershocks are not included, unless they were of great significance or contributed to a death toll, such as the M 6.3 2011 Christchurch earthquake and the M 7.3 aftershock to the 1931 Hawke's Bay earthquake . Earthquakes occur frequently in New Zealand as the country is situated in the collision zone between the Indo-Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, part of the Pacific Basin Ring of Fire, where many earthquakes and volcanoes occur . Most events occur along the main ranges running from Fiord to Fiord, New Zealand's main fault lines .

Sindh, Punjab and Azad Jammu & Kashmir provinces lie . on the north-western edge . of the Indian plate in South Asia . The 2010 Mentawai earthquake occurred with a moment magnitude of 7.8[1] on 25 October off the western coast of Sumatra at 21:42 local time (14:42 UTC) The earthquake occurred on the same fault that produced the 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake . It was widely felt across the provinces of Bengkulu and West Sumatra and resulted in a substantial localized tsunami that struck the Mentawoa Islands . The Philippines lies along the Pacific Ring of Fire, which causes frequent seismic and volcanic activity . Many earthquakes of smaller magnitude occur very regularly due to the meeting of major tectonic plates in the region . The largest was the 1918 Celebes Sea earthquake with Mw8.3.0 . The 1976 Moro Gulf earthquake killed 5,000–8,000 people . Largest earthquake in the Philippines was the 18th-19th-century Celebes Sea quake, the largest in the country, with a magnitude of 8.3 . The country lies on the Pacific Rim of Fire and is located near the Philippines' southern tip of the U.S.-Pacific Ocean .

The 1950 Assam–Tibet earthquake is the largest recorded earthquake in China . In 2008 the magnitude 7.9 2008 Sichuan earthquake killed more than 87,000 people . The collision of India with the rest of Asia has led to seismic activity throughout western China . However these regions in comparison with Eastern China have a low population density . The 1946 earthquake occurred near the Aleutian Islands, Alaska on April 1 . The shock had a moment magnitude of 8.6 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VI (Strong) It resulted in 165–173 casualties and over $26 million in damage . The seafloor along the fault was elevated, triggering a Pacific-wide tsunami with multiple destructive waves at heights from 45–130ft . The tsunami obliterated the Scotch Cap Lighthouse on Unimak Island, Alaska among others, and killed all five lighthouse keepers, including all five keepers . Cuilapa marks the geographic center of the Americas . It is the capital of the department of Santa Rosa and as the administrative seat for the surrounding municipality . The town has a population of 41,359 (2018 census), with a density of570/sq mi (220/km2)Cuilapa is the location of the largest volcanic field in the world . It was the site of a magnitude 6.4 earthquake on March 8, 1913, which destroyed its department capital, Cui, in the same year as the earthquake that destroyed the department capital Cui . The earthquake destroyed the Cui capital, which was also known as Santa Rosa Cuilapu, in March 1913 .

Active tectonics of Ecuador is dominated by the effects of the subduction of the Nazca Plate beneath the South American Plate . Ecuador lies within the Northern Volcanic Zone . The subduction zone is moving at a rate of 7cm/yr to the east-northeast, significantly oblique to the trend of this segment of the Andes . The active tectonic zone has an overall dip of 25–30°, but varies rapidly along strike due to effects of subduction of the Carnegie Ridge . The Philippines lies along the Pacific Ring of Fire, which causes frequent seismic and volcanic activity . Many earthquakes of smaller magnitude occur very regularly due to the meeting of major tectonic plates in the region . The largest was the 1918 Celebes Sea earthquake with Mw8.3.0 . The 1976 Moro Gulf earthquake killed 5,000–8,000 people . Largest earthquake in the Philippines was the 18th-19th-century Celebes Sea quake, the largest in the country, with a magnitude of 8.3 . The country lies on the Pacific Rim of Fire and is located near the Philippines' southern tip of the U.S.-Pacific Ocean .

China has been the location of some of the most deadly earthquakes in history . Hundreds of thousands of people were killed by magnitude 8.0 earthquakes in 1303 in Hongdong and 1556 in Shaanxi . The 1950 Assam–Tibet earthquake is the largest recorded earthquake in China . In 2008 the magnitude 7.9 2008 Sichuan earthquake killed more than 87,000 people . The collision of India with the rest of Asia has led to seismic activity throughout western China . However these regions in comparison with Eastern China have a low population density . Khorasan-e Razavi Province is a province located in northeastern Iran . Mashhad is the center and capital of the province . Other cities are Quchan, Dargaz, Chenaran, Sarakhs, Sarahs, Shahr Jadidid-e Golbahar, Fariman, Torbat-e Heyda . The province has a population of 6,434,501,000, with a population estimated to be 6,871,000 by the end of the 20th century . The area is 118,884 km2 (45,901 sq mi) and has a main language of PersianHDI (2017)

The South American Plate is moving over the Nazca Plate at a rate of 77mm (3.0in) per year . The same process has caused the rise of the Andes mountain range and the creation of the Peru–Chile Trench, as well as volcanism in the Peruvian highlands . The oldest rocks in Peru date to the Precambrian and are more than two billion years old . Along the southern coast, granulite and charnockite shows reworking by an ancient orogeny mountain-building event . The rocks have anomalously high strontium isotope ratios, which are located close to the Peru-Chile Trench, with anomal

Vanuatu lies atop a complex and active plate boundary in the southwestern Pacific Ocean . The primary tectonic feature of the 1,200 km (750 mi) island chain is the New Hebrides Subduction Zone, the convergent boundary of the Australian and Pacific Plates . Volcanic activity is also present along this north-northwest trending and northeast-dipping oceanic trench . The area adjacent to the d'Entrecasteaux Ridge does not experience intermediate-depth earthquakes along a Wadati–Benioff zone that dips steeply at 70° . There is a corresponding g in the area surrounding the ridge, but there is no corresponding earthquake activity .

The 2012 Negros earthquake occurred on February 6 at 11:49 PST with a body wave magnitude of 6.7 and a maximum intensity of VII (Destructive) off the coast of Negros Oriental, Philippines . The epicenter of the thrust fault earthquake was approximately 72 kilometres (45 mi) north of the provincial capital of Dumaguete City . Aftershocks of 1600+ (as of February 7, 2012, 7:45 PST) killed 51 people, 112 injured and 62 missing . The earthquake was a thrust fault fault earthquake off the eastern coast of the Negros Peninsula . The maximum intensity was VII (destructive), meaning "very strong" and "very very strong

Taiwan is in a seismically active zone, on the Pacific Ring of Fire, and at the western edge of the Philippine Sea Plate . The most recent major earthquake was the 921 earthquake, which struck on 21 September 1999, and claimed 2,4 lives . The first recorded earthquake in Taiwan was in 1624, the founding year of Dutch Formosa . Between 1901 and 2000 there were 91 major earthquakes in Taiwan, 48 of them resulting in loss of life . Most of the earthquakes registered in Taiwan actually occur off the east coast and cause little damage, whereas smaller quakes beneath the island itself have historically proven more destructive . The 2012 Indian Ocean earthquakes were magnitude 8.6 and 8.2 Mw  undersea earthquakes that struck near the Indonesian province of Aceh on 11 April at 15:38 local time . Initially, authorities feared that the initial earthquake would cause a tsunami and warnings were issued across the Indian Ocean; however, these warnings were subsequently cancelled . These were unusually strong intraplate earthquakes and the largest strike-slip earthquake ever record . The 2012 earthquake killed 10 people and injured 12 people in Aceh Province, Indonesia . The Assam earthquake of 1897 occurred on 12 June 1897, in Assam, India at 11:06[2] UTC, and had an estimated moment magnitude of 8.2-8.3[1] It resulted in approximate 1,542 human casualties and caused catastrophic damage to infrastructure . Trembles were felt across India, reaching as far as Ahmedabad and Peshawar . Damage from the earthquake extended into Calcutta, where dozens of buildings were severely damaged, with some buildings partially collapsing . Seiches were also observed in Burma and Burma . The earthquake occurred on the SSW-dipping reverse Oldham fault that forms the n.O.W-Dipping reverse

This list is a list of notable earthquakes that have affected the area currently defined as Tajikistan . Note: The inclusion criteria for adding events are based on WikiProject Eart . The list includes notable earthquakes in the Fergana Valley, Gorno-Badakhshan, Gissar, Ghatlon Province, Gholan Province, and Rushon District . The most recent earthquake was in the region of Rasht, killing livestock and damaging buildings . The largest earthquake in the country was in 2007, when it took place in the province of Gholn-Gholan, killing at least 20,000 people and injuring more than 100,000 livestock . The 1868 Arica earthquake occurred on 13 August 1868, near Arica, then part of Peru, now part of Chile, at 21:30 UTC . It had an estimated magnitude between 8.5–9.0 Mw (est.) A tsunami (or multiple tsunamis) in the Pacific Ocean was produced by the earthquake, which was recorded in Hawaii, Japan, Australia, and New Zealand . The USS Wateree beached at Arica 430 yards (390 m) inland . A total of 25,000 people were killed in the 1868 earthquake and tsunami . The earthquake was centered in Peru and northern Chile, which is now in the region of Chile and Peru

In May 2012, two major earthquakes struck Northern Italy, causing 27 deaths and widespread damage . The events are known in Italy as 2012 Emilia earthquakes, because they mainly affected the Emilia region . The first earthquake, registering magnitude 6.1, struck in Emilia-Romagna region, about 36 kilometres (22 miles) north of the city of Bologna, on 20 May at 04:03 local time (02:03 UTC) The second struck on 29 May, killing at least 50 people and injuring at least 350 in total . Up to 45,000 people were left homeless in total after the first quake, registering a magnitude of 5.6 km (3.5 mi)

The first of the 1957 Fethiye earthquakes occurred on April 24, 1957, with the second and larger event about seven hours later on the following day . Both earthquakes had epicentres in the eastern Mediterranean between Rhodes and the coastal city of Fetiye in Muğla Province, southwestern Turkey . Damage and casualties were 19 people killed in the first and second event . On June 11 June 2012, two moderate earthquakes struck northern Afghanistan, causing a large landslide . The landslide buried the town of Sayi Hazara, trapping 71 people . Overall, 75 people were killed and 13 others were injured in the landslide . After four days of digging, only five bodies were recovered and the search was called off . The earthquake was a moderate magnitude of 5.4 mb (5.7 mb) and depth of 16 km (10 km) It was the second largest earthquake in the country to hit Afghanistan in the last decade . It was also the first major earthquake in Afghanistan to strike in the past decade, causing damage to buildings in the region of Afghanistan since 2001 .

This list includes any notable historical earthquakes that have epicenters within the current boundaries of Turkey . This list is incomplete . Turkey is a seismically active area within the complex zone of collision between the Eurasian Plate and both the African and Arabian Plates . Much of the country lies on the Anatolian Plate, a small plate bounded by two major strike-slip fault zones . The western part of Turkey is also affected by the zone of the North and East Anolian Fault . Seismic hazard is a major concern for the country's geology and geology of the region . The 2012 Haida Gwaii earthquake occurred just after 8:04 p.m. PDT on October 27 . The shock had a moment magnitude of 7.8 and a maximum Mercalli Intensity of V (Moderate) It was the second largest Canadian earthquake ever recorded by a seismometer . The earthquake's epicentre was on Moresby Island of the Haidan Gwaii archipelago (formerly known as the Queen Charlotte Islands) The shock was 135 kilometres (84 mi) away from the epicenter of the earthquake, about 17.5km (10.9 mi) The earthquake was second largest in Canada, after the 1949 Queen Charlotte Island earthquake, 135 kilometres

Myanmar is one of the most seismically active regions in the world . Oblique subduction, block rotation, and a transform margin has been responsible for the seismic activities of the country . The Sagaing Fault is one the largest sources of earthquakes in the country, having produced deadly quakes in the past centuries . The Shan Plateau is another source of earthquakes, hosting many active strike-slip faults that accommodate block rotation of the Sunda Plate . The 2004 earthquake was the largest earthquake in Myanmar, with a magnitude of 6.0 magnitude of magnitude 9.0 in the region . The epicenter was at 43.3 degrees north latitude and 80.9 degrees east longitude at a depth of 10 km (6.2 mi) The quake occurred 700 km (430 mi) from the regional capital of Ürümqi . The March 2021 Miyagi earthquake struck offshore east of Tōhoku, Japan on March 20, 2021 at 18:09 JST (09:09 UTC) The magnitude 6.9 or 7.0 earthquake struck at a depth of 54.0 kilometers (33.6 mi) to 60 kilometers (37 mi) It had a maximum JMA intensity of Shindo 5+ while on the Mercalli intensity scale, it earned a rating of VII (very strong) on Mercalli Intensity of the earthquake . The 2013 Craig, Alaska earthquake (also known as the Queen Charlotte Fault earthquake) struck on January 5th, at 12:58 am (UTC–7) near the city of Craig and Hydaburg, on Prince of Wales Island . The quake prompted a regional tsunami warning to British Columbia and Alaska, but it was later cancelled . The earthquake came nearly three months after an Mw 7.8 quake struck Haida Gwaii on October 28, in 2012 . There were no casualties due to the remote location of the quake, and no tsunami warnings were issued due to a remote location in Alaska and British Columbia, but no tsunami warning was issued because of the earthquake's remote location .

The 2013 Aceh earthquake struck the Indonesian island of Sumatra on July 2 with a moment magnitude of 6.1 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) The strike-slip earthquake killed at least 35 people and injured 276 others . About 4,300 homes were damaged or destroyed in the province of Aceh where approximately 4,292 houses were damaged . Aftershocks occurred 4.3, 5.5 and 5.2 magnitude 6.1 Mw, with a number of aftershocks of magnitude of 5.3 and 6.2 Mw . The quake is common in Sumatra as it is located on the northern end of the island

The 2013 Solomon Islands earthquake struck northeast of Australia on 6 February with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe) Its epicenter was the Solomon Islands, at the boundaries of the Australian and Pacific tectonic plates, causing local evacuations and a tsunami of 1.5 m (4.9 ft) and killing at least nine people . Aftershocks were also felt in the region, with a total of 20 aftershocks of around 20,000 occurring during the event . The Santa Maria earthquake was the largest earthquake ever recorded in Oceania, killing 9 people and injuring 5 others, killing 5 and injuring 17 .

The Chelyabinsk meteor was a superbolide that entered Earth's atmosphere over the southern Ural region in Russia on 15 February 2013 at about 09:20 YEKT (03:20 UTC) It was caused by an approximately 20-m (66-mile) meteor air burst . The meteor caused non-fatal injuries, property damage, buildings damaged, collapsed factory roof, shattered windows, and shattered windows . The 2013 Bushehr earthquake occurred with a moment magnitude of 6.3 on April 9 in Iran . At least 37 people were killed, mostly from the town of Shonbeh, and an estimated 850 people were injured . The 2013 Saravan earthquake occurred with a moment magnitude of 7.7 at 15:14 pm IRDT (UTC+4:30) on 16 April . The shock struck a mountainous area between the cities of Saravan and Khash in Sistan and Baluchestan Province, Iran, close to the border with Pakistan . The earthquake occurred at an intermediate depth in the Arabian plate lithosphere, near the boundary between the subducting Arabian Plate and the overriding Eurasian Plate at a depth of about 80 miles . 35 people were killed in Iran, 34 in Pakistan and 1 in Pakistan, with a total of 117 injured in the region . The main impact of the earthquake was that a tsunami of 18m (59ft) was 18 m (59 ft) The earthquake was the sixth most powerful on record; 6th most powerful earthquake on record in Russia, 6th highest on the world's list of quakes .

The Motagua and Chixoy-Polochic fault complex cuts across Guatemala and forms the tectonic boundary between the Caribbean plate and the North American plate . The most destructive earthquake in recent Guatemalan history was the 197-year-old earthquake in which the most destructive quake was recorded at the time of the most significant earthquake in the country's history was recorded in the 1960s and 1970s . This article is about Iranian province . For the Nepali District, see Ilam District . Ilam Province is one of Iran's most populous provinces . The province has a population of580,158,000 . The highest elevation is 2,775 m (9,104 ft) and the lowest is 118 ft (2,100 m) The province is located in Iran's north-south region, known as Iran's fourth-largest province in the world, Ilam in the country's North-South region . The population is estimated to be at 6,602,000, with the highest density (75/km2/sq mi) of all major urban areas

The 2014 South Napa earthquake occurred in the North San Francisco Bay Area on August 24 at 03:20:44 Pacific Daylight Time . At 6.0 on the moment magnitude scale and with a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe), the event was the largest in the San Francisco Bay Area since the 1989 Loma Prieta earthquake . The epicenter of the earthquake was located to the south of 38°13′N 122°19′W﻿ / ﻿38.22°N 122.31°W＼; 38.22; -122.31[1] Total damage was $362 million–$1 billion[2]

The Philippines lies along the Pacific Ring of Fire, which causes frequent seismic and volcanic activity . Many earthquakes of smaller magnitude occur very regularly due to the meeting of major tectonic plates in the region . The largest was the 1918 Celebes Sea earthquake with Mw8.3.0 . The 1976 Moro Gulf earthquake killed 5,000–8,000 people . Largest earthquake in the Philippines was the 18th-19th-century Celebes Sea quake, the largest in the country, with a magnitude of 8.3 . The country lies on the Pacific Rim of Fire and is located near the Philippines' southern tip of the U.S.-Pacific Ocean .

An earthquake struck near Misca, Peru at 21:35 September 27 local time (UTC-5) The shock had a moment magnitude of 5.0 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong) The event resulted in the deaths of 8 people and damaged or destroyed 60 homes in the region, with rock slides and power failures affecting the epicentral area . The small Andean village of Misca was most affected by the quake, with the collapse of around 45 homes . Four children and four adults were killed and 60 homes were damaged . District in Arequipa, Peru is one of twenty districts of the province Caylloma in Peru . The people in the district are mainly indigenous citizens of Quechua descent .
